I had no coding experience coming in, and she explained everything so it all made sense. If you do the work for this class (there is a lot) you will do fine.

FEH is standardized to the point where it barely matters who your professor is, but if you've never coded before, Dr. Harper does a good job of explaining the concepts, even at 8:00am. The TAs answered almost all my questions, but Dr. Harper was always happy to help. She really cares about your success, and she's very understanding.

Shes a good lecturer. The course is very work-heavy, and sometimes she lectures for too long, meaning you have to do more homework outside of class, but that would be my only complaint. Shes very clear in her teaching and all the assignments, and shes always happy to help you out, in or out of class.

Took her for the robot project.  She was always willing to help you out no matter the problem and wanted everyone to succeed but the class itself was a huge time consumer.  Great experience and amazing professor.
Dr. Harper is excellent at explaining concepts; she has a way of breaking them down to help you understand both the details and the overall picture.

I really liked Dr. Harper's class. She's always willing to help with engineering and physics if needed. She made class really enjoyable. Knows her stuff and is great at teaching it. You use a flipped classroom approach which is super helpful for this course. TAs help out a lot and do most of the grading, so hope you have awesome TAs like I did.

Dr. Harper is my favorite teacher so far at OSU. She is really helpful and wants everyone to succeed. Her class is hard, but it was my favorite freshman class. She is awesome... I would definitely recommend her to anyone!

Dr. Harper was an amazing professor. She not only is very clear in her lectures, but she is also very wise in her "grand scheme of things" advice. She's not easy, but that's because the class isn't meant to be easy. Terrific person all around.

Dr. Harper was one of my favorite professors. She is very knowledgeable about not only the class material but also Physics (use to your advantage). In her class you will get the grade you work for. I am also taking her class for the second semester of FEH because I enjoyed the atmosphere she provided.

Her jokes are rarely funny, and very (very) little is covered in class. The lecture is literally 20-30 minutes, and then you do homework in class.  You will have to use outside sources as no notes are provided on Carmen. The TAs grade the work, but if you follow the directions it is easy to get full points. The quizes are easy, but not the midterms

She seems like a soccer mom. Her TAs grade not her, so as for her 'easiness'. It's up to the TAs and i unfortunately had super hard graders. She seems like she gets exasperated easily. She let me put her down as one of my references so she is nice!
Dr. Harper is a good professor. She is clear and she prepared students well for the exams. She is more than willing to help in office hours on engineering and physics.

Dr. Harper is my favorite teacher that I have had at OSU. She is very helpful and is always willing to help you if you try hard in class. Tests are pretty challenging, but that is FEH, not her as a teacher. Very enthusiastic and is easy to approach.

exams run by FEH department.  lectures are relatively short so plenty of time to complete most homework assignments in class.  lectures at times are boring and not helpful, but overall a fairly good teacher for 191
N/A

She is a very good teacher.  She doesn't always cover everything in class, but that's why she has office hours.  If you go to her office hours and her review sessions, you will do great.  I had her for 131i and 132i, I received a B- in 131 and an A+ in 132, the only differance was that I went to her office hours.  She doesn't spoonfeed you.

She's pretty clear for a physics professor but she gets mixed up with her example problems a lot which is kind of confusing.  And her exams are pretty hard - although I know that there are multiple professors who write the exams.

She is a great prof. I have learned tons from her and if you dont understand something she is always willing to help. In fact she even helped me out in 132 eventhough i didn't have her as a prof! She is awesome! Do anything to get her.
She teaches well, very clear.  Teaches application, not just concept.  Overall, very good professor.

Definately a tough teacher.  Lots of material is covered in this course.  Her lectures cover the basics, but most of the learning you have to do on your own by reading the text.  She is extremely helpful when you visit her during office hours.
never gave useful information in class, only covers the basics, while assigning impossible homework
She spends more time confusing us than she does clarifying.  Thanks to Harper, Ill get to use freshman forgiveness!

Assumes you know more than she teaches you, can be confusing at times, though she is very willing to help. As long as you have a decent TA, you should do alright.  She actually makes the tests used in honors physics, and often forgets to teach a certain type of problem that is on the test!  Voice is a little annoying also...

Good prof. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS.  she does not usually have the time to teach everything in her lecture. She is much clearer one on one. She makes mistakes but that's becuase she does problems on the fly rather that having them prepared.  It gives insight into problem solving techniques. Nice lady.
She is the most clueless professor I have ever met. However, class can be somewhat amusing because it is obvious most students know more about physics than she does.
wow
goes over extremely easy problems in class and tests over very hard problems. not a teacher you want to have

I don't understand all these negative comments.  Dr. Harper obviously loves teaching and is extremely knowledgeable on this topic.  Electromagnetic physics a difficult topic yet Dr. Harper makes it easy.  Tests are not too difficult and everything is covered in class.

Dr. Harper was funny and made the class interesting (well as it can be). The tests weren't asking the impossible and she was helpful. The hw was hard, but I struggled in the class because I hate physics...
decent teacher, not great-seems to get confused in front of the class, gives incorrect information in lecture, tests very difficult for me, compared to getting 100% in Doty's 111 class

She is the worst professor you will ever have. She does not know what she is talking about, and things you have never seen before will appear on your tests. Take Doty, she knows what she is talking about.
Kathy Harper..where do i begin?? While she is a nice woman, she is the most confusing prof i have ever had...Tests are very tricky as well. DO NOT TAKE HER!! Don't say i didn't warn you...

Piss-poor teacher. She frequently continues lectures after the bell as rung, frantically trying to give us essential formulas as everyone filters out of the room. She can't explain anything and uses retarded analogies like "yelling at a birthday cake" Try and get another teacher if you can.
Bad Teacher.  Didn't learn anything.  Stoped going to class after first midterm and my grades went up.  No curve, try to get a different teacher.
This lady is nuts, leprachauns as electricity, its hard to understand as it is then you bring in kids stuff and it just confuses us more.  Worst prof I've ever had.
No Comments
She tries really hard, but sometimes her lectures are confusing.  I still managed to get an A though

Kathy Harper tried really hard to be helpful but I really got nothing out of her.  I'm not sure if the course itself was just extremely difficult or if it was her lack of teaching. In office hours and out of class she was helpful...sleep through lecture!
This professor as a lecturer was horrible.  She knows the subject material, but she has a hard time getting her point across.
what an awful teacher; thank goodness she's finally gone to that other dept

Honestly, this guy is a legend. He is so knowledgeable and cares a ton about his students. His course is challenging but respectable. 

If you get the chance, take ME7384 for Hybrid Electric Vehicles

Dr. Rizzoni is a good lecturer and world class expert in his field. I enjoyed the first part of the class, which was taught by him but assignments were just too long. be prepared to read and re-read the notes because the material is just too dense and overwhelming. I learned a lot but this class is no walk in the park

The first half of the course was taught by Rizzoni.He gives you an overall picture of how stuff works and lets you fill in the details.The course was heavy with material and he goes through all of it quick but you still understand what he is talking about.No tests.Homework is heavy requiring a lot of time to work on but course is very interesting.

I actually enjoyed this class. Rizzoni does a good job at lecturing and his modules that he has assembled are helpful. Homeworks were tough but helpful for preparing for the exams. Busy guy though, so really all office hour interaction was with Dr. Chiara, who was great. Tests were reflective of material covered, ave of 68, 86 and 64 for the exams.

Better avoid this guy..makes you work like hell and more and more  work. Longest homeworks, very bad...thumbs down...make a differential equation wrong and you end with 10 points on 40.....fits in more than what a quarter can afford, finals damn hard.wish I had DETRICK

I was not thrilled to have him having used his error filled textbook in ECE300 and ECE320.  Then I found out we don't have a textbook for this class.  The notes are not clear and don't have enough examples and you don't even have a book to help you out!  His notes come straight from the modules which are ok.  This just isn't my topic.
Makes system dynamics as clear as it can be.  Takes a practical approach towards everything.
very fair and caring! would take again

Akbar is a nice guy and does his best to teach Thermodynamics but struggles to reach most of the students in the class. He posts notes that are just equations and theres no textbook so youll have to actually go to class to get anything useful to study from. Course is almost entirely conceptual... its thermo.

Dr. Parke is a very good professor who gives great feedback. Even if there's something you are still uncertain about, the TAs are always ready to help you. The course is standardized, so there's not much difference from one class to another. I would recommend him for this class.

Professor Parke knows his stuff well. If you are interested in mechanical design drawings it's not a bad class. However, as an EE I found the material extremely boring so it just wasn't for me. Maybe not entirely his fault, but the lectures were extremely cut and dry.
Dr. Parke is fun and the class is very structured so your professor doesn't matter as much.
Really knows his stuff and is good at helping you with specific questions. Great first year engineering professor.

Dr. Parke is a really nice guy and he tries his best to explain things but his lectures are really confusing. That part doesn't really matter though because the TAs will help you with any of your problems.

Dr. Parke certainly wasn't a bad teacher, but his voice drifted like a lullaby through the warm 8:00am air until my entire class was asleep. Doesn't matter too much though because the TAs are where the real learning happens, and they're usually top notch

Great teacher, though lectures are somewhat confusing. However, when it comes to asking him for help one-on-one, he is great help in explaining what you're doing wrong in the assignment and helping you fix it. Brilliant man, but lectures can be somewhat dry.
Laid back guy. Very interested in the subjects he teaches, but the TAs pretty much run the class.  No real complaints about Parke, only about 1282.

Professor talks more than is needed, his voice doesn't carry any enthusiasm about the class and can sometimes seem mono toned. He knows his stuff but I would say he is an average teacher. Most grades are from the TAs so he is just there for lectures and labs. He did not grab my interest like me other teacher, but it was an okay class none the less.
Dr. Parke really knows what he is talking about when it comes to MATLAB! His approach to the class makes everything interesting and applicable.

I did not like him.  It's a lot of work for 2 credit class.  I had other classes to worry about and my grade suffered.  The instructions aren't clear on a lot of assignments and there was a lot of inconsistencies.
He was a decent teacher. He talked a little too much before labs, but other that he's good.

Dr. Parke is a genius. He has so much experience and he's able to understand and help with any question. The class wasn't too interesting but I did really well regardless. He once told me that he took one semester of chemistry and then tested into P.Chem.
Great teacher. Lots of experience, willing to help students and trains them to think on their own as well. Made Matlab quite interesting. Thumbs up!
He's a good instructorand the subject was interesting. My only comment it that I made several errors because he was not that clear on what was needed.
Dr. Parke was a very interesting teacher. He came to class everyday just so excited to come teach and was so helpful. He was such a pleasant teacher and you could learn alot from him.

His class was so hard. His lecture was boring. The grading was so hard on the tests especially the final the average was close from 60% on the final test. The tests are harder than the book questions which is already so hard.A lot of students find it challenging to stay awake in his class.Never said a funny thing.Almost no one laughed at his class.

A pretty decent instructor. The material covered in class was relevant to the engineering field, and applied well. Some of his TA's graded hard, but I would recommend him to anyone. You will learn MATLAB in this class.

very good teacher although he does go through lectures pretty quickly. don't be afraid to ask questions and ask him to slow down. overall a fun guy who likes to tease his students but not as much as herrera did.
My hero... words cant describe how epic mike parke is.
I love you Mike Parke, i looooooooove you!
Very clear to understand. He is usually willing to help out.
Not too bad here. He's somewhat tough but can't really complain much. Now the T.A.....
Professor Parke was always willing to help. His grading is a little tough, but overall he is a good teacher.
Good teacher...helpful always....grading is somewhat tough...but on the whole not bad at all
Always free to talk or help with whatever, whenever.
Always made class fun with his dad jokes.

Krieger is a great professor, I really enjoyed him. His lectures are entertaining. Please respect that. The hard part of this class is not him, but the grading of the UTA's. They are relentless. I am pretty sure they are being forced to grade harshly by the department, however. So essentially this class is run as stupidly as our government.

Your prof for 1181/1182 doesn't matter a whole lot, the curriculum is standard and the TAs grade the majority of assignments, but Krieger is a great guy. You can really tell that he is passionate and he cares about students. He'll come around during working time and start a conversation with you. Don't buy the textbook, find a PDF.

Prof. Krieger is a great professor. You can tell that he genuinely cares about his students, and is always willing to help you out if you need it. Just make sure you are keeping up on your assignments and you're golden.
He is a personable professor that cares about his work and students. If you are struggling, he is there to help even though he has hundreds of other first year students.

He does not explain things in a way that someone knew to the material can understand. He puts in an honest effort but he's just not meant to teach. The class isn't to bad as long as you're willing to do some self-learning.

Dr. Busick is a really good guy and cares for his students a lot. His teaching might be a bit old fashioned, but it gets the job done. My word of advice is that on the. homework make sure you read what it is being graded carefully. They are easy points that can be missed if you aren't careful. Understand the midterm reviews, and you are golden.
Easily one of the worst professors. Has no idea really what is going on and doesnt teach at all. Has a hard time reading his own screen. Overall poor experience in class. Almost failed.

He made a two credit hour class awful. There was an immense amount of work always. He was not good at teaching MatLab because he can barely read computer screens. Without TAs, I would not have passed the class. The midterms were much harder than content from class. At the end of the semester, most of the first midterm was dropped. Final was easy.
The class was very unorganized to me. He does not teach Matlab well. Questions were not answered clearly and examples provided were unclear.

Lectures are a bit boring, but his stories are cool. I learned more from his experience than his lectures. Class content is straightforward; you can learn it from the book, asking TAs, Carmen, etc. I'm hoping to get him for 1182. Do the HW (There is a lot) carefully, and in time and it'll be an easy A. The midterm practice is very helpful.

Dr. Busick is not a bad professor by any means. The course in general is just filled with incoherent instructions. If you get all of the due dates straight and do the homework and lab documentation, then this class will be an easy A.

Don't think I ever got help from Busick once. It was always the GTA and UTA's. Lectures were so boring. Class itself was easy but the one thing he did grade, he graded hard. For the intro engineering classes, it doesn't matter what the easiness is for the prof, the tas grade everything. Wouldn't round up my 92.7. I would avoid him.

Busick did not do much in class. The course is designed with an inverted classroom, but he still lectured most of the class tim . Very boring lectures too. He is nice enough, but I don't know many people who listened to him very attentively in class.
Busick is really out of the loop, and he can be a bit off-putting at times, but he's a really helpful and nice professor.  He'll walk you through everything, just do the HW and do it on time!

I was unfortunate enough to have Busick for both FE courses. The class itself is not the hardest, but Busick was just so unhelpful. He often contradicted the GTA, and never understood my questions and his suggestions were often wrong. My advice, take anyone else. Also, if you have him, ALWAYS direct your questions to the GTA or UTA's.

I thought that he was a really nice guy. The TA's did help a LOT, so please feel free to utilize them, but in the end your grade in the class is based on how much work you're going to put into the class. He wants to help you out, he really does. He is old, but still a really cool guy. I recommend him to anyone.
Very nice and really wants to help students, but is very unclear with directions and presentations. My TA's did 90% of the teaching in this class.
Not a great professor, high expectations, doesn't seem to care about the students too much. Class isn't too difficult, just a lot of busy work

This class was awesome. While he was hard to understand at times because of his old age, he cares so much about his students and wants them to do well. He gives an incredible practice exam and it really helps with the midterms and finals. Best fundamentals of engineering professor in my opinion!
Nice guy, walks you through assignments, willing to help, but use your TA's/GTA's too. Would take him again/recommend him

Mr. Busick loves what he does and it shows. If you need help, he will personally stop and help you one-on-one. He will walk you through the steps and make sure you understand what you are doing. The curriculum is a bit confusing at times, but will probably be cleared up. Pay attention to due dates!! (The only reason I didn't get an A)
Sometimes he's confusing when explaining assignments. Asking the GTA and TA's was what helped the most. A lot of tedious homework. But easy class to say the least.
Good professor, always very clear with what he wants. He is pretty boring, but overall is very solid.

He was a very good professor and was always willing to help when it was needed. The weak part of the class was the TA involvement, since they don't always know what to do. Material isn't difficult but the roller coaster project is very time consuming.

Assignments are rather easy, theres just so many that its kinda ridiculous. Definitely going to have a decent amount of homework but his class is easy to get a B or A in. He is the stereotypical absent minded Professor, hes also kind of useless when it comes to help outside class. Use your GTAs

Prof Busick was a solid teacher. nothing flashy, exams were straightforward. he was a nice guy. your experience in the class is much more based on your TA but if u get rich and u do your work youre definitely in shape to get a decent grade
He knows what he is doing, but he takes a long winded approach to his lectures. Other than that, he is very helpful and genuinely wants you to succeed.

Dick lectures are not all that interesting, but they are designed to be helpful. He will gladly help when you ask a question, usually to the point of doing it for you. He's a good guy who really wants you to do well.

DICK IS THE MAN! He is very cool, laid back and loves telling stories. He only taught labs and not lectures, but he was one hell of a good lab instructor. A great teacher to start of Freshman Engineering with! Take him!
Very helpful
Dick Busick is the man. Its a shame he had a bike accident and broke some ribs. What a trooper.

Excellent professor, very helpful on all assignments. His slides are very helpful and accessible outside of class (he types them up himself). He is very helpful during office hours and during labs. He usually lets students go early but if you stick around he is more than willing to help.
Doesnt care about much other than himself . . . its' his way, or no way - - which def. isnt how this class needs to be taught.
Busick is the nicest guy you'll ever meet, but he doesn't really do much more than read the slides you can get offline when he teaches.
Read all lessons from slides that you can access out of class. Presents information and doesn't explain practical uses. Still a good professor though.
Great guy - first time teaching FEH engineering.  Very helpful and class is enjoyable.
Nice but didn't seem to care much.
A nice guy. He likes his students, and is very helpfull.
He seemed like the absent minded professor.  He didn't always seem to know what he was talking about.  The class was really easy though, and worth taking.
Good professor. Helps his students
Very good lecturer and a very nice guy as well. Has done cool things for the world if you look up his ted talk. Would highly recommend for 1182.

He is a really nice and helpful guy. Very understanding. However, I took a 1.5 credit class taught by him and it was absolutely ridiculous the amount of work we had to complete. (It was an 8 week course but still.) Some of the assignments are so difficult I ended up just not doing them because I couldn't figure them out. But he is a great guy.
This class has a lot of busy work, but it is an easy A. Bixler is a nice guy as well.
He had engaging lectures

Bixler is one of the nicer professors and he explains things very clearly. The class in general is very easy and I passed every midterm with over 95%. If you have some coding experience, MATLAB and Excel will be a breeze.

This is a pretty structured class and the TAs' do most of the grading. Bixler is a very respectable guy and seems like he knows what he's talking about, but after going to a class all semester I still barely know the guy because he doesn't talk much. He makes a lot of dad jokes.
What an amazing GTA! I had Nick for 1181/1182. He made the labs enjoyable and was also very caring of his students. I don't know if he's teaching again but he was the best!
He's a cool guy and his memes are top notch. MAX chili peppers

Dr. Phil is very chill and likes to get to know everyone and their robot. He's very helpful and will always get you an answer even if he doesn't know it. Class itself is fairly standardized but he and his TAs have very realistic expectations about midterms and content on it and communicate what's on it well. Very fair class based on effort.
I was struggling in this class (coding isn't my thing) and I was afraid I was going to receive a bad grade. But he was very kind and helpful and always wants to help. Just reach out to him.

I took him for both 1181 and 1182 and they we're that bad. He's older fellow so he's easy to approach and will help you as best he can or ask a TA you like. The quality of lectures can come and go just on the topic but still listen because its easier to listen and remember instead of looking through slides. Be ready to work in groups of four!

Dr. Phil is kind of like being taught basic engineering skills by a chill older uncle. He is super nice and likes to know everyone, and at the same time the class is built so you have to try not to do well. The lectures can be a little boring but he does always make it somewhat interesting, making him a good professor.
Despite the heavy course load in the 2 credit hour class, engineering is way more fun with Professor Schlosser.

Dr. Phil is truly a great professor and helps you through any problem. The class does take a lot of work, but Dr. Phil truly tries to makes things easier. Approach him, and you'll get a friendly response.
Professor Schlosser was a decent professor, however having him at 8 a.m.  was not good, I relied HEAVILY on my friends that were better coders than I.

This man is the best teacher I've had.  He is so kind and cares deeply about each student. He takes the time to really get to know every single person. On top of that he is so smart. He can be really helpful when you talk to him one on one.  His lectures are just the right pace and easy to understand. You should really get to know him.
I love him! Very helpful and funny.
Dr. Phil is a great instructor and really cares about the students.  He is very knowledgeable and willing to help.

He was a really great guy. Very understanding and impactful. He loved to tell stories about his past work experience and gives helpful advice to aid your future. However, the class was quite demanding for 2 credit hours. Met 3 times a week with homework  that was doable but time consuming but in the long run was quite beneficial to the exams.

This class isnt too bad-but a loooot of work-wish I cold devoted some more time to other classes. In 1181, the proff doesnt do much more than teach, which Dr. Phill (we call him) is really good at, and grade written midterm/finals problems. He comes off as a cool grandpa tbh. Make sure to communicate well with your TAs.

Dr. Schlosser is a really fun guy to have for engineering and he makes things interesting. However, sometimes he'll start rambling and the work in class is not always relevant. Regardless, he's a good guy and is very enthusiastic about helping you.

Not the best teacher. He doesnt seem to know what he is talking about. Whenever it was a lecture day, he would read straight off the slides. Terrible teacher. One of my least favorite teachers ever. Only explained how to do specific examples, never really explained an algorithm on how to do general problems. Tests were VERY hard, 60-65% averages. I would recommend not having this guy

This class was a little odd because we switched professors half way through the class.  He was much clearer and his notes were fantastic, due to the time crunch, I think our class was a little rushed, but he helped me learn a lot very quickly.  He has fair tests, just study and you will do well.
Great lectures and fantastic notes .... very thorough and detail-oriented. Grueling & lengthy HW assignments & exams. One of the very best teachers in the Department.

good lecturer. he has a great teaching skill. he makes me intrigued with the materials. hard midterms. If you take his courses, you will understand the material completely, but don't expect good grade

Just do the work and make a good cheat sheet for the tests and you will get an A- for sure.

gebuibely interested in students success.Good professor.

Prof. Dapino is tough and intimidating and his class is difficult, but he knows the material very well and is very willing to help. His homework is very difficult, but he is really friendly in office hours and willing to help you. Despite how difficult this class was, I would take more classes taught by him. My class was half online and in person.

Homeworks took around 10 hrs to do each, and there were parts of it that we impossible unless you went to office hours. The exams given during covid were supposed to take only 2 hrs, but took the fastest students at least 5. Like someone else said, its his way or the highway. Came off as condescending during many office hours to many students.

Professor Dapino was a very tough professor. His rules were his rules and you followed them, no questions asked. Homework and tests were very difficult. That being said, he made himself available every single day in office hours and was one of the most helpful professors I've ever been to office hours with.

Homework is super time consuming, but if you get started on it early and go to office hours, Professor Dapino is quite helpful. Clear lectures and fair tests, but Systems is a challenging class overall for sure.
Homeworks are extremely long, no example problems are done in class, overall not helpful.

His way or the highway kind of professor. He contradicts himself during lectures and talks down to his students when they ask questions. Exams aren't bad but will lose credit for nitpicky things. Homework super vague and you will lose lots of credit on it. Least favorite ME professor.
More like a successful business man than a professor in engineering.

Lectures were confusing and poorly organized. There was a ton of difficult material presented in class but never tested (why bother wasting time on it?). The homework is taken directly from the notes, and the exam questions, while real-to-life, are incredibly difficult.

Dapino is a very inconsistent professor. He spends more time messing around with his iPad than teaching. Does no useful examples in class, then expects get a perfect score on his ridiculously hard homework. Oh, and the exams? Good luck. He is worthless.

good class...you're in for an awakening if you didn't have him for 482 but he's more than willing to bring everyone up to speed...great at teaching basic building blocks of system dynamics...will give long hw's but if you put the time in exams will come easy

class is hard and tests are long...he is a good guy but tries to be more like your friend than your professor...seemed to me he tried to please everybody rather than focusing on what was best for everybody...that said, he definately went above and beyond what most professors would do for a class, and he was more than fair with his grading

Great professor to have for 482. The class material is difficult, but he does a great job at lecturing. Homeworks are hard and require quite a bit of time, but he is extremely willing to help. Really chill guy, kinda feels like my best friend. Would recommend 10/10

Sorry, but as nice as Professor Passino is, he's not a good professor. You can probably do well in this class, but you probably won't learn much. Nice guy to talk to.

Too easy to get full credit, which means you can actually learn nothing except the formulas which you can easily find online. Barely explaining the formula, nonreadable handwriting, no office hours. But, copy his code and edit a little bit then you can get the full credit from homework.

Very passionate about the course and it shows in his constantly positive attitude. Unfortunately he sometimes goes through more technical content as if you should already understand it. Class is an easy A if you do the assignments.

He is an awesome professor and a great person. His classes are fun and offers clear understanding. Although sometimes you need to study beyond class to get a better understanding. Over all he is great and I would highly recommend him.

Dr Passino is a great professor.  The class was interesting, he provided information very clearly, and he's a funny guy. He is a nice professor. He is very interested in ethical engineering. His homeworks are interesting. And he gives good grades.

Horrible at explaining course material. Slow to return assignments. No solutions provided. Exams have subject that he says are not tested.

She was the least organized prof I've ever seen. Changed the take home final, changed a HW to an extra cred, skipped doing a second MT and much more. Super easy class, exams are a joke. Go to class don't go to class it wont matter just do the homework and go over the slides. Degroat is an incredibly slow teacher and is never very clear.

Professor DeGroat is very kind and knows her stuff regarding VHDL.  I wished that she was more helpful outside of class, but overall I really enjoyed her. Excellent. Speaks Clearly, Posts Solutions Online, Grades for Assignments Can Be Viewed On Carmen. Willing To Help Out Students Who Miss Exams.  Would Recommend.

Although she wants to help, she has no talent for teaching or communicating what she knows. She simply reads the slides word for word. In the FEH program, there are many other professors to choose from. Stay away from DeGroat's class unless you already know the material.

AVOID. Take this class anywhere else, do not interact with Amos Gilat at all. Nice guy, sure, but not good teacher. Bad lecturer and even worse at setting up a class. All combined, the entire class came down to how you did on exactly 16 problems. Nice enough if you meet him outside of class, but still won't help you much. He means well, but still avoid him if at all possible.

Gilat was one of the worst lecturers I've ever had. His lectures only include solving problems, with little explanations as to why we solve them. Amos has some of the worst lectures at OSU, very hard to understand and most of the concepts require you to learn from YouTube. The class consists of 3 exams worth 88% of your grade. Don't take his course. You will only be graded on quizzes, midterms, and the final. The quizzes are worth 12% of your grade, midterms are 44% and the final is 44%. He is incredibly rude and will get upset if you ask a question that he doesn't think is a "good" question. He hates repeating anything and expects everything to come easy to everyone.

Avoid by any means necessary. Its a hard class but his teaching method makes it 10 times harder. It is example after example with little to no explanation behind his problem solving strategy. Professor Gilat doesn't teach you any of the material. He expects you to learn it on your own and he does practice problems in class. Not a bad person, but he is ignorant and kinda dont care how you do.
Terrible and old lecturer, doesn't put anything online and it really isn't worth going to lecture or recitation. HW takes a good 10 hours a week. Exams are all open book and fairly simple however.

Professor Gilat seems nice, but has no interest in this course, as he mentioned multiples times throughout the semester. Requires you to buy 2 of his awfully written textbooks, in which you will realize wont help you much for the 10+ hours of homework a week. Advice for incoming students: be prepared to learn this course on your own.
He is a nice guy. If you go to office hours, ask him questions. He is a bit condescending, but he will answer questions and he knows the material well.
He will refuse to help during his office hours. He says he doesn't have time for you because he's too busy writing his text books. Terrible professor.

Made everything seem easy in class then I would struggle on homework and midterms, often not knowing what ideas to apply. The examples in class were helpful but it would have helped if he taught it in a way that we would know what concepts to apply depending on the problem statement and given information.
Gilat was awful at explaining things, does not give equation sheet on tests

I wish he was more clear explaining what his mindset is in solving problems. He does nothing but do example problems in class, which I liked. I found this class is immensely difficult. Doesn't provide or let you make an equations sheet, so have fun memorizing tons of equations instead of actually studying. Just terrible.
Terrible. Goes over a few simple examples in class that do not prepare you well for the exams or homework, both are very difficult. Take this course with Dr. Mokashi if you have the chance.

This class was terrible. I dont think i learned one thing the entire semester. The material is so bad so it's hard to say how he is as a teacher. Lectures are pointless but his exams are really easy due to the open book policy. Homeworks were very hard and long, and only time I had a problem and went to his office he refused to help me out.

Well, if you're ME you have to take this class and you probably have to take it with him too. Homework is awful, as everyone agrees, but his exams are OK as long as you have a good idea of how to do stuff. Lectures are a waste of time. This professor is AWESOME for FE series, but for the actual ME class it's a rough ride. doable though!

His lectures are an absolute waste of time.  The material in the class is very straight forward, but the exams do not reflect the material that was gone over in class or the HW.  HW takes 5+ hours a week, is graded very late, so you do not know your grade until it is too late. Try to avoid for  ME250

Gilat's teaching is purely from powerpoint presentations. Programming classes should not be taught in a classroom! We need lectures to be labs. He forces you to use his incomprehensible textbooks. Homework is tedious and takes at least 5 hours per week. All seems well until the final, get ready for complete failure.

you're forced to use his crappy text books which are hard to follow and full of typos. the class is basic math but you are forced to think think a computer on all homeworks and tests, and they take a while to complete. he isnt very articulate so it can be hard to understand him.

One of OSU's worst teachers. If you have prior experience with MATLAB and can teach yourself quickly, then you may be OK. Otherwise, it will be a battle. Fast-paced, entirely not enough time for homework assignments, which are graded without mercy. You are on your own in this class, I don't know exactly what tuition paid for with this class.

The whole class is matlab and numerical methods.The grading is very tough,not enough time for the tests,the homeworks was very hard.20%homework 35% midterm 45% final.What he does in class is going through the slides which is really close from the book.He didn't give review sheets or examples for the tests,he didn't clarify what the tests are.
Real laid back guy. Goes over slides quickly which leaves you plenty of time to do your work.

The worst professor at The Ohio State, he gives no partial credit, the only reason he teaches this class is so you have to buy his book, you dont have to go be cause he reads straight out of the book, if you do go take a pillow.
He seemed uninterested at times. Although it's useful at TIMES, he swears by his MATLAB book (I think he just wants your moneys?). I did mediocre on the exams and still managed to get an A-
Funny guy.  Kept lectures short and sweet.  Made fun of the program's slides and made to sure to avoid confusing us.  Great professor, made 183 a breeze(not that its not easy already)
He was a pretty sweet teacher.  He keeps lectures short and sweet, but sticks around to help students 1 on 1.  He is pretty funny, but has a mild accent that isn't too bad.
Great teacher.  Was always available for guidance whether it was for the class or just life in general.  He just wanted to see his students succeed.
pointless class, homework a complete waste of time

awesome professor. Helpful and intrested in helping students succeed. Class is way too long but he tries to make it fun. Both the matlab book and numerical methods books are really good. Fair tests, hard homeworks at time, but you learn alot.
Explains things well, even if it takes a bit to hear what he's saying through his accent.  His book explains exactly what to do, homework takes a while but is never too hard.
He knows the Numerical Methods material he is teaching. He explains the code a bit too slowly for my tastes, but there are some folks who it's a good pace for.

wow...ummm way too much homework for only 10% of your grade...so your midterm and final are worth 90% of your grade...awesome....class is useless...i just  printed the notes offline and taught myself...dont buy the book...just mooch off of someone else when you rarely need it....overall...this class=worthless
No Comments

He's really into his research. With some professors, this can be a problem, but with Gilat, just talk to him about his research once or twice and he will become more interested in helping you out and seeing you succeed. Plus, he wrote the MATLAB book; I mean, seriously, who else could teach it better?
Hardly cared to teach or help students in my class.  He wrote the book on Malab, but refuses to help students with it at all.
Accent gets in the way sometime, but he wrote the book on MATLAB and there is no better person to talk to about it. He'll teach you to program so well in MATLAB you'll wanna use it for everything.
Helps he wrote the MATlab book
He is down to earth and seem to understand the student's thought.  Fairly flexible and available to  help.  Sometimes funny but his accent make what he said so serious.
Has a slovic accent but usually dont have any trouble understanding him. Not very hard, but it was a very easy course. Seemed willing to help. Has a light sense of humor and keeps things interesting
I had him as a lab instructor.  The lecture can be boring, but he's a very helpful teacher and makes the class interesting.
An accent, but you can still understand him.  He knows English very well but phrases he's used sometimes have made me crack up.  Very funny, helpful, and knows what he is talking about.
No Comments
No Comments
Funny and interesting! Makes class 10 times better!

GOAT- I loved being in his class. He knew how to explain tough topics with simple analogies that you could remember in exams. He knows how to break down the topics and explain. Exams were strictly explaining topics, no computations. Just an all around great guy 100000/10. made Semiconductors an EASY topic.

Professor Paul Berger excels at teaching the fundamental concepts of physics devices rather than focusing on numbers. Be prepared for exams that require extensive preparation and a lot of writing. Also, not punctual!
However, he assigns minimal homework and provides opportunities to improve your grades, even if you struggle on the early exams.

S.S.Electronics is already an abstract concept & Berger does its best at explaining it with analogies & everyday life examples. No math in tests but homework is a bit weird because we don't use numbers and equations during lectures. Be prepared to take *a lot* of notes during class. Go to the exam reviews (!!!!) he'll tell you what to expect.

Dr. Berger expects you to be able to explain clearly how everything works. His exams and lectures are about the device physics and less about the equations behind them. Homework can be brutal because of the lack of math taught in class. Exams are all about drawing band diagrams and using analogies to explain device physics. Hard but rewarding class

Dr. Berger has great lectures and tries to emphasize the fundamental concepts rather than the math. Tests ask for you to write out the concepts behind electronic devices instead of math. The textbook is my only complaint, though. The homework questions are math intensive and the book only provides clear answers to its own problems 1/3 of the time.

Class consists of qualitative material taught by Berger in lectures and quantitative material taught by yourself out of the textbook. Exams are short answer questions with no math, while homework is all calculations. Previous review is accurate and I wouldn't recommend unless Solid State Electronic Devices (Seventh Ed.) just hits different for you.

This professor doesn't teach any of the math or material required to do the homework. half the class has resorted to chegging their way through the homework and no one understands what the homework questions are even asking. Avoid him unless being frustrated teaching yourself everything every weekend sounds like a fun time.

Professor Berger is really caring. He inherited this class and was thrown into it unexpectedly. He has done the best he possibly could with everything considered. Cares about students and is continually conscious of the pandemic and is doing his best to accommodate and be flexible. Very transparent with students.

One of the worst professor that I ever had . Not available in office hours or after office hours. He really doesn't care about students. Does not know how to teach. He treats student like numbers because he doesn't care about them.

Hes super nice, and passionate about the topics. He jumps around a lot, which makes it hard to follow. He talks really fast, and moves through content quickly using slides, which makes it hard to take notes in lecture. Super conceptual, probably did 1 easy calculation on an exam. His review sessions are killer, he goes through everything well.

Berger teaches in a very "concept based" way. The only math in the course was on the homeworks (which were a nightmare). Tests are all concept based. I feared 3030 from the things I heard from others but in the end, Berger made it interesting and easier than expected. Go to lectures and take notes. He'll tell you what will be on exams. Great guy!!!

Unlike other teachers, Berger emphasizes the understanding of the physics going on instead of the math. His midterms are extremely specific questions; in order to do well, you really have to understand each concept. He uses weird analogies in class but they help-ish. His final was easier than the midterms. Reading the textbook saved me.

To do well in his 3030 you are going to have to attend lectures, take detailed notes, do outside reading, understand the homework, and talk to him outside of class in office hours. Despite what other comments say he is a good professor if you actually pay attention and don't want to be spoon fed equations that nobody is going to remember anyway.

2300 for you all on semesters. He was so bad at teaching he faulted his 'hard tests' for low grades instead of himself. He actually made the tests even easier to compensate. If you want to get the essence of his teaching style take a 100 page pdf and scroll through it all in 40 minutes. Learn elsewhere but take his tests. Easy A.
Paul is a great professor, although the class is very boring. He is good at explaining concepts simply. Easy to talk to, very helpful.

This guy didn't know what he was doing. He was a nice guy and tried to help students, but he struggled. He couldn't teach the material and do the homework's without a solution manual. His tests were fairly difficult and the averages were very low. He did curve nicely. Avoid at all costs

Professor Berger took this writing course far too seriously.  He approached the subject in the same way he approached his solid state class (which was amazing) and that made this writing course too "nitpicky".  We were graded off for using pronouns in a sentence following the blatant use of a noun. ex: Skinput is ___. This can be used____. :(

I enjoyed Berger's lectures when I took his solid state class, so I took his 582...BIG MISTAKE.  He's somewhat unprofessional because he's very ambiguous about due dates, which is really annoying since half the 582 assignments are done in groups.  He's absent for about 1/3 of the time.  I give him a 5 for his solid state class, and a 1 for his 582.

Taught the material well, and constantly built on prev/331 material.  The tests were amazing; they asked about the material in essay format and Berger only asked for answers that were short and sweet.

Does not make sense in lectures or notes. Very inconsistent and jumps around often. Does not want to help the students and cares more about research than being friendly and encouraging students to learn.

Worst prof I have ever had. Ever. Knowing the material is useless; your grade is determined by how he feels at the time. Anyone who tells you how well you do depends on how well you know the material is lying.  As a general rule the people who knew less did better in the class, because their exam answers were more vague and didn't get marked off.
Terrible. Most uninterested prof I've ever had. Brags about how he went to Michigan, as if any of us care. Feels that research is more important, so he doesn't have to do his actual job...teach

Absolutely worthless professor. Understanding the actual processes and the math they involve doesn't help you. Basically, he fills every lecture with random stuff, and then picks a few unrelated things to ask on his exams. This puts the idiots of the class on an even playing field with the smartest people, which defeats the purpose of the class.

Absolutely atrocious. I got the highest grade in my class in 331, but almost nothing I learned in that class was put to good use by Berger in 432. Since he uses qualitative exams, and grades each individual test based on how he's feeling, actually understanding the material and the math behind it does absolutely nothing for you. Avoid Berger!

Extremely hard to follow in lecture, but be sure to write down everything he hints will be on the test.  Tests are short-answer and he is a very particular grader, but I expected to fail and ended up with a C, so apparently the curve was huge.

He seems not to care about this class at all. Pretty nice guy and friendly, much better than Valco. But still his grading is terrible. I wouldn't take anymore classes with him becuase his grading is terrible!!!

Had him as my prof for technical writing.  This guy didn't seem to care about this class much at all, and for 582 your TA really matters more than your prof.  However, this guy is WAY better than Valco for this class as he is much easier.  Out of the several profs that teach this class, I would take Berger again (thank goodness I don't have to!)
I failed this class with Wu Lu, Aced it with this guy. You have to actually know the material, but his tests are more than reasonable (Qualitative in nature).

It might be the nature of the course, but his lectures were all over the place.  He knows the area well and is friendly enough.  The only real complaint I have is that most of our assignments were returned at the end of the quarter so I had no chance to get feedback on my work.

Taught straight from the horrible 432 Streetman book. Exams are essay based, no math (50 avg, but little curve). Would rather not be teaching because it interferes with research. Missed 1/3 of classes for research commitments.  Avoid Berger, take Brillson
Harsh grader
A lot of writing on group projects, but professor is good and wants you to succeed

He was great. Made real meaningful connections with students and actually cared to help them. It felt like two completely separate courses, the main project felt like it had nothing to do with the first half of the semester but it still was easy.

Lecture is mandatory. Missing a certain amount of project days causes you to fail. Can be a really fun/easy class or miserable/hard class depending on if your team is good. Did not pay attention to one lecture it was so boring. You get to work on making a product all semester. He did not seem to be excited about my group but he was about others.

Easy class, some of the lectures we're unneeded imo. Just doing your work is typically enough. Grading was pretty lenient, but thats dependent on your TAs. Herak was pretty good about taking to the teams about their projects and helping out whenever he could. Overall how the class goes is like 80% dependent on your team.

Patrick is really good at outlining what's expected each week. Your group will affect the class more than anything else. I had an 8 am so I showed up the minimum I had to. You need to show up for 60% of the class to pass.

Collaboration is important in this course as most of the assignments are team-based. The workload is manageable but can take time. Grades are usually rounded up. The instructor can answer some questions but may not always be helpful. Building a good relationship with them can lead to more help. Poor attendance does upset him.
Good luck with this class! Its seriously that dumb. Your grade isnt even based on your own work ethic and effort but rather that of your team and TAs who also dont have a clue whats going on as well.
This class is a total joke. Literally 90 percent of the stuff was a rehash of what I learned in middle school! Useless class and a complete waste of time.
Horrible class that isn't taught well. Waste of time!

This class is so ridiculously dumb and most of the stuff was so useless that I can't believe its even required for our majors. Most of the stuff they talk about is irrelevant towards your career anyway.
this class sucks

This class is so absurdly boring I cannot believe that this is a required class for college engineering students. I have seriously done more interesting work in middle school. This is a joke class where your grade solely depends on your group members and your TAs (who are generally just as clueless about the class). Have fun.

Professor Herak was a rather bland person, but nice nonetheless. Your grade in this class will really depend on how good your team is, and how nice the TAs are. There isn't much direction on what to do in the class, so just make sure you follow the rubric because that's what ultimately is being graded.

One of the better professors in 1182 considering the stories I heard from my friends professors. He is very understanding as long as you show him respect and put forth an honest effort. The work itself is a lot, but follow the rubrics closely and a good grade is possible.

Dr. Herak is a cool guy who sets a relaxed tone to the class. I really enjoyed going to this class because he was truly interested in the students ideas. You are put in groups automatically which can differ your view on the class. The only gripe I can see people having is that he is very strict on attendance.
Great prof, 1181 is just a lot of work so if you keep up with the assigned work and readings its an easy A
Dr. Herak was a great professor when I had him for 1182 a last year. He was really helpful and a generally fun guy would definitely recommend.

Dr. Herak was an excellent professor. 1182 is easier (and more interesting) than 1181 if you put in time outside of class. The group project was awesome; he pretty much gave us carte blanche to do whatever we thought would make the AEV better. Giving us freedom to engineer taught us more than any lecture could. He's a very encouraging teacher.

ENGR1182 was significantly easier than 1181. Professor Herak is a really good professor. He's a good guy and cares about his students. He's one of, if not the, best engineering professors you can have for ENGR1181/1182.

I hated my group in this class and made it known through what I thought were anonymous journals online. They weren't and he talked to me about a member's blatant sexism toward women. Great great guy. Very understandable and really is willing to help you. He is great at explaining and wonderful to get to know. But 1182 has bad documents and TA's.

His lectures weren't awful. He was usually pretty clear and explained things well. Most of the problems in the class weren't his fault: The very inconsistent grading done by UTAs and the excessive workload for a 2 credit hour class. Did seem somewhat rude at times and would bump into my chair a lot as he was going by and never said a word about it.

First off, a really caring prof. He is very open to helping students over email or at office hours. He's patient and ready to work with students. The course material for FE courses are made by the department and not the individual prof so it's not his fault that it's boring. Most grading is done by barely qualified undergrad assistants.

Dr. Herak really cares about learning and students' success. ENGR 1181 is a pretty easy class but A LOT of work outside of class for a 2 credit hour class. The class is mainly based on group projects and they pick for you so cross your fingers and hope for the best. Herak is very knowledgable and sets you up for success. Always read the PowerPoints

Dr. Patrick is a great guy and truly. genuinely wants you to succeed. If you start to struggle (MATLAB can be tough at first), ask him for help and he will get you on track. That is the key, actually. ASK. FOR. HELP. He cares about the students so much but he can't do anything if no one asks him for help.

Basically in engr 1181.01 the professor just teaches the easy stuff in Matlab, which is really easy. Herak did this job well, rarely confusing me. Additionally, he is very sympathetic in grading which was shown as my friend left one of his midterms mostly blank and got much more credit than he deserved.

Professor Herak was pretty great. Of course I'm that one person who genuinely enjoys his cheesey jokes. He definatley sets a relaxed atmosphere for the class, and overall I have nothing to complain about his teaching style, though I never asked for extra help from him. (But of course, still too much work 2 credits)
Overally pretty good teacher. Sometimes vague in explaining certain topics. If you ask for help, he does not mind helping at all. The class is difficult at times, but just ask for help.
Take her if you can!

Good professor, not her fault that this course is beyond help, prepare to read the most random and non-credible articles and create the most random and non-helpful response and work in teams to design the most random and non-applicable project. Attendance mandatory and easy grader.

Professor Wahlin is one of the most caring professors I've had at OSU. The low ratings are just from people who don't like doing work. 2301 is a 4-credit hour class, so you should expect a decent amount of work to come with it. Professor Wahlin is always willing to help you succeed. One of my top 5 professors of all time.

Leah was one of the most caring professors I've ever taken a class with at OSU.  I was going through a rough time during her class and she was super understanding and accommodating to me.  The class was mostly group projects or small individual projects.  Not very difficult but a great experience for resume/cover letter/interview prep.

Tons of homework and projects, much more than other professors. She has a really high expectation about students but ignores that her students do not ONLY have her class!!!! TOO MUCH HOMEWORK! Also trying to deduct points from one single homework!! DO NOT COME!

Leah is such a great professor for this class. The class is set up for you to succeed, but you absolutely will have to work for it. Leah articulates what is expected and how to get there and gives exceptional feedback. This course is a lot of work, but I feel that it is an extremely beneficial class for my future. Expect to work for it.

Leah is a great professor. She genuinely cares about her students and responds to emails quickly. She gives very insightful feedback, as well. You do have to put in the effort for this class and there is a large group project towards the end of the semester. The overall material is very applicable.

Personally, I liked her. Trust me, I wasn't a good student AT ALL, like I was constantly turning in assignments late and not paying attention in lecture. Regardless, she was very patient and forgiving, and I ended up with an A in the end. The group projects were a struggle, but she understood that communication was difficult, and gave credit anyway
SHE IS THE BEST. Super patient to ur stupid questions.

One of the best educators I've had at OSU so far. Her lectures have great structure and are easy to pay attention to. She cares a lot about her students and she is both understanding and reasonable. Grading is on the easy side, but with lots of useful feedback. She teaches the things that matter so that you can be a good writer after college too.

Leah is great and really wants to help you. The resume building project for the career fair was super clutch. Her class is a great choice for your writing 2 GE. Classes were long but she understood that and gave breaks. Had a lot of fun working with groups on interesting projects. Slide design is on point, most visually appealing slides of any prof

She knows its a GE course and doesn't make you work too much. If you even try a little, you'll be fine. The reading quizzes are the only thing you really have to care about. She is a great person and makes sure you're doing well. She's awesome and I wish should could teach all my class.
She goes the extra mile for you if you put the effort in.
SHE IS THE BEST
Great class
She should teach all courses at OSU.
She is the worst..

Basically she tries to teach this class at a far more intensive level than it is meant. This means that she will takes points off the smallest things from your assignments. To be honest, seems like she thinks she's teaching a CSE course, but in reality its a 2nd writing course, chill out.  Don't take her if you don't have to.
Take her
She plans a lot, but it is just too much that she cannot finish them within a time limit. Frequent changes, becomes confusing. There are class with other professors. I suggest you should go for them
she is pretty new. she doesn't yet have standards for class and grading yet.
don't even think about it
She was the most terrible professor I've ever met. Professor matters for ENGR2367.

Never take her class. There are a lot more 2367 options available She is not passionate at all. And compared to other 2367 classes that my friends took, hers was terrible. I don't want her to teach in OSU anymore.

Very clear on what she is looking for on the assignments and papers. Works with students if it is a very busy time of the semester to reduce the workload of the class. Usually her lectures are lectures where she doesn't ask questions for the class to answer. Participation helps a ton. Helpful and fair, readings are gone over in class.
She talks way more than necessary in lectures and is a harsh grader. The amount of work required is not really her fault but she doesn't really make it better.
Dr. Vines is really just ok. Her lectures are very boring but that comes with the FE classes. Helpful when needed but honestly the TA's usually were more knowledgeable.
Cannot call herself an instructor at all. Whatever the word completely opposite of instructing is, she wins it.
Great lecturer, super sweet and greatly helped with my understanding of coding (I had minimal experience before the class, the instructor offered a great foundation.)
Dr. Vines was very kind and genuinely cared for students success. The class is easy if you read the rubrics and turn in things on time.

Dr. Vines was one of the nicest instructors I've had. She was very helpful in her office hours and made a mandatory course I wasn't fond of a lot more enjoyable. I highly recommend taking the FE courses with her.
So strict on Graphic Assignments. Even my worst enemy in my life, I will not recommend him to take her class
Bad at teaching

She treats her students as if they are still in high school. She berates anyone who mutters a word in her class. High ego and does not care about the material she is "teaching". Choose anyone else for your own good.

Very condescending, very much held the vibe of "I am a doctor, and I am better than you" blatantly disrespected and talked down to a student with autism, blatantly disregarding them.  She would publicly embarrass you in front of the class if you talked while she was speaking even at a whisper level to your group mates.

Dr. Joll was an amazing professor that made my FEH experience much less difficult than it had to be. The classes were funny, informative, and accompanied by useful activities. Even though I've never coded before, Dr. Joll was easily accessible outside of class to answer any of my questions.
Class was a lot of work, but Ethan made it very manageable. He gave great lectures, provided very clear rubrics, and was very easily and readily available to help both inside and outside of class.

One of my favorite Professors I've ever had. He's funny in a monotone kind of way and cares a lot about his students. Taught MATLAB,C,C++ and even though I had no coding background I did very well. Make sure to not procrastinate or it will lead to long nights before the due date. He is the best animator using power point there is.
Awesome teacher, recommend his classes.

Despite having absolutely zero experience with coding myself, Ethan Joll did a great job at teaching both MATLAB and C/C++. Although there is a lot of homework, it prepares you for the material on the quizzes and tests. Ethan Joll was the best, and would answer any questions that people had.

Very nice teacher and always really understanding when it comes to needing extended deadlines or anything of the sort. I liked him so much I made sure to take the 1282H class he was taking next semester. He is very entertaining and easy to talk to and overall a really good person.

The start of the course with Onshape (CAD) was easy b/c of his good lectures and clear rubrics (make sure to look at them for everything, don't loose points for random stuff and ask if you are unsure). For the robot portion it was a difficult, but as long as you have a good team (hopefully some of your friends) I think you will really enjoy it!!
This guy is the goat!!! He is such a good guy, and he is always down to help any students. I would highly recommend any FEH or FE students to schedule with him if you can!!!

He is one of the new teachers on campus, but is a really cool guy once you start talking to him! Don't be afraid to ask questions or talk about any circumstances, he is very understanding. He isn't a hard professor, it is just that the course guidelines make it hard.

New to the scene and tries his best. While a bit monotone and bland at first, they really show emotion later as they settle in and can be humorous at times. While not knowledgeable about SolidWorks, they offer great professional advice and give good feedback. Great 8 AM class.

He was just alright. At the beginning when teaching Solid Works, the way he taught was kind of boring and he didn't seem enthusiastic about it. He did answer questions well whoever asked and tried to help every student. He's a pretty lenient grader, and he got better over the semester. He tried to be more funny and enthusiastic as time went on.

Professor Schrock was very understanding when I had to miss a class. He was very helpful during office hours and quite accessible outside of class in terms of emails and additional help with concepts and makeup exams. I could tell he wanted the best for his students, no matter the circumstance. Additionally, he made lectures fun!

Professor Schrock is one of my favorites. He listens to the students' frustrations about how the class is structured and formatted, and he is fighting to make it worth more credit hours. He genuinely cares about his students, and will give extensions on almost anything if you communicate with him. He definitely made this class more bearable.

He hates the class as much as we do (class is structured by people in the school of engineering, not him).  Willing to work with you and he makes the class more bearable.  He comes prepared and I would take him for FE as he is very understanding.

Definitely NOT the worst prof. at OSU! he genuinely cares about his students and understands what they are going through. John really wants to help his students do well, which is why he always pushes back assignments P. He's also they only prof I know that will meet trhough Skype. Hes not the best but definetly not the worst either.

Pretty much what others have said. The class is very canvas heavy, but Schrock seems to be very disorganized. Randomly adds/removes/changes assignments, sometimes he'll announce it in class and never actually update the canvas page, sometimes he'll just do it and not tell the class. He's very disorganized. Rambles a lot.

He is one of the most incompetent/ disorganized professors I have ever had. He takes months to grade midterms and he changes assignments/due dates at the last minute. Awful. I would avoid him at all costs

Definitely the worst professor I have ever had! Spends most of the lecture time rambling/bragging about his personal life and gets mad when we don't pay attention. Skips over most of slides of the lectures or reads them verbatim. Has not posted exam grades and it's been over a month. Coursework on Canvas is also very disorganized. Please avoid him!

Schrock is a really nice guy who I enjoyed getting to meet and learn from. He was given a rather difficult task of teaching a new course that seemingly had no structure to it. I would much rather have him again for a course that actually means something as he seems like a genuine and a highly experienced person.

He seemed to be pretty disorganized and got mad at people for not listening to his pre-class ramblings and working on assignments. Class got a lot better once we transitioned to lab. Overall his class wasn't bad, it just wasn't all that great.

Definitely a good guy, and knowledgeable, but the class became much better when it transitioned to lab every class and no more lectures. Lecture was fine, just often useless for learning the class content. I don't know why I went to all of them. Would be nice if he spent more time on the actual content, maybe did a once over the ppts.

The first day, he told us about how he was hit by a car on a bike in August. I think most of these reviews must be from before that accident. He clearly lost all of his time management skills. He rambled at the start of every class for 20-30 min about useless crap, leaving no time for the class activity, so we had extra homework. Boring lectures.

Really nice guy who knows what he's talking about, and is willing to help. Sometimes the class would just be reading the PowerPoints without much explanation. If you have basic programming knowledge, MATLAB will be a breeze. The class will be similar no matter what professor you have: easy material, but a lot of work for two credits.
You deserve him! He is the best!
Did not teach, fell back on reverse classroom model to switch burden of teaching to the students.

What a guy! Sometimes you can just tell that he doesn't want to be there as much as you don't, especially on Friday's. Honestly he is a great guy and teaches you what you need to know. Pay attention during class! He will literally give you an example of an exact exam question. I went into the final knowing what exactly the application problems were

Easily my favorite professor! He's had a ton of real world experience and brings that into the classroom which is pretty awesome. This class is very challenging but he eager to help students outside of class whenever they need it. Really cool guy over all, very funny.
He's amazing!!!
Tries too hard to be a "cool guy," and doesn't focus enough on being an actual teacher. I learned more from the TA than I did from him.

Hilarious guy. Would love to have a beer or two with him. Very casual teacher, very smart. He advocates for his students and the ridiculous amount of work for a 2 credit hour course. Things he doesn't think are useful to his students, he doesn't waste time on. I appreciate him a lot.

He's an awesome guy in general. Out of professors in the engineering field at OSU, he's probably the most fun. the class can definitely be annoying  at times because you will have to meet your group outside of class and have late nights working on projects, but I feel that prepared you for the real world of engineering Beware: there is programming

John was awesome for this class. Really laid-back guy with a lot of awesome ideas for projects. Really interesting teacher that can relate to students. He does the grading and gives a lot of good feedback to help you with the writing. Also pretty flexible when it comes to deadlines, but don't push it.
Good engineering professor. I wish I could have taken him again. He was tougher than my other, but a much better teacher who prepared his students for the tougher standard he held.

Schrock is a beast. Although I came into the class with knowledge of MATLAB and such... I feel he explained thoroughly for beginners while still not boring more experienced individuals. The midterms were just 30 multiple choice questions and 2 free responses. They gave a lot of partial credit if you are bad but can be tough on the higher end.
Super chill

Schrock is probably the best professor I've had since getting to OSU. He's really young and understands what it's like being an engineering student, so he can be  really empathetic  when grading midterms and moving back lab report deadlines.

Professor Motoyama is very knowledgable, but he was difficult to reach outside of class, and did not give great feedback. Lectures were interesting, and the projects were pretty easy. Sometimes class was boring.

Dr. Motoyama is clearly knowledgeable in his field and is passionate about the material, just not passionate about teaching it. Labs are essentially follow-along lectures with no explanation or clarification. He will try to evade office hours. You will be learning the material on your own for projects. This class was harder than it should have been

Very focused on his own work and only does the minimal to teach students. Will refuse to expand on lectures. Expects students to know exactly what he want in reports and grades harshly if it's not correct. Doesn't respect students ideas or opinions.
Tanner was the best teacher I ever had at OSU. Totally recommend
Strict grader. Takes points off for the most minute details.
Overall, not a bad professor. The exams were a little difficult, but the final project helps boost the grade. Not much information is given on the final project though, making it hard to start.

Luscher waited until the 11th hour of the semester simultaneously drop most peoples grades by a letter grade. The final project, which had an incredibly vague rubric, was graded harshly and killed lots of peoples grades.  The average on the final was a 68 and he allowed us a 20-hour window to contest any of the grades before the end of the semester
Awful grader. Takes a ton of points off for little mistakes, hard to recieve partial credit and hard to understand why you lost points

Super cool guy and the workload is very reasonable. The tests aren't anything crazily out of the ordinary and the homeworks are basically all book problems. The only downside is he's a bit unorganized, but he makes up for it with lots of hw extensions and help outside of class.

I have gotten the feeling from other professors that Luscher is still a professor simply because he is tenured. His capstone section was a complete mess. There was no syllabus and the final assignments were "graded" within 12 hours of submission with no feedback on missing points. Very slow on email response and can be impossible to track down.

Dr. Luscher really likes to hear himself talk. Most assignments were very unclear and typically revised multiple times while students were working on them. My biggest complaint is the subjectivity of the whole class. There is no rubric for anything. Multiple times got no feedback whatsoever and 9/10. Stupid. The class is an exercise in patience.

Luscher was incredibly unorganized! Posted assignments from the previous year which did not correlate with the current work, has yet to get back to me on questions regarding capstone which I have emailed and spoke to him in person about, he did not show up for student presentations, and allows the GTA to lead the class however she wants (poorly).

He's good.  A lot of professors that do research at OSU clearly don't care about teaching.  He's not one of them, I think he really wants to help his students.  And it's fun watching him and Joe geek out over some idea . . . they're clearly having fun :)
AMAZING!!!

Very good teacher.  He communicates his ideas clearly, and does not believe in long, boring lectures.  He is also very interested in both teaching and the material, so his classes are fun to be in.  Also, he is nice guy, and is down to earth.  Take his classes!

Great professor. The topics covered in 3010 are not easy by any means, but he is able to explain each concept clearly and relate to the level of an undergrad student. I took calc III, but didn't understand vector calculus until he explained it. Truly a gem of the ECE department.

He is very prepared for every lecture. He is always there to help if a student has questions. HOWEVER, if you like learning through examples, do not take him. I found a lot of the questions he asks on HW is not provided very clearly in lecture notes or the book. It made the HW very difficult to do.

He knows the material really well, I mean, he wrote the book. You will learn a lot. Sometimes class is boring because this is probably the millionth time he's taught this stuff, but if you ask good questions it can be fun. You will get out of the class what you put in to it, homework is optional.

Joel was a great professor. He presented a very clear course, and the textbook used was written by him, so the notes were often identical to the textbook, which was great. A lot of notes and content. Homeworks were challenging, but were not mandatory, as they just give extra credit on the quizzes. Quizzes are not bad, exams can be a bear.

An excellent professor. You do not need to buy the textbook as long as your pay attention to the lecture in class, and he is always smiling and willing to help. Homework sets and exams are challenging though, but do not worry, you have him.

Professor Johnson is awesome!  He explains everything so well that you hardly even have to consult the book.  He is extremely helpful in office hours and is always smiling.  Exams were not hard if you knew the conceptual arguments and not just how to solve the homework.   I would highly recommend taking any class with him.

Failed it with this guy, but got a B+ with Reano.     Exams are very hard. HWs are very hard too. Try to avoid him,but if you have to take him then you have to study everything in great detail and you have to spend too much time on him, don't take more than another two classes at the same time,so you can find enough time to waste on him.

For 311-312 he is extremely well prepared and very clear.  Everything on the tests was thoroughly discussed in class.  HW was challenging but were excellent for test prep.  I think some people (see person below) ran into problems because they relied on plug and chug instead of actually understanding the equation which is extremely necessary.
