He is one of the hardest professors I had ever seen.I had spent a lot of hours on the homeworks,went to his office hours and studied a lot for that class but I still didn't pass it and its the only class that I failed at OSU.

Great prof.  The textbook was totally unnecessary (B+ without buying it), since he uses a note packet to teach the course.  Homeworks were actually interesting applications of the stuff in class.  Get to see how a SAR radar system works.  Only problem is that, for a grad level class, there's no curve for undergrads, so grades are a little low.

If you have a chance to get this guy-DO IT! I have never seen a professor at OSU teach this good. The material got easier as we went along,avg on the final was 94%. HW's were a **** though. You will get as much you put in.

Very good teacher..explains very well...gives good homework..if u can handle the homework then u'll do very well on the exams. Does not give bonus points, either u get it or u dont. Always smiling and willing to help.

First, his lectures are not recorded so make sure to go. His tests, especially the final, are extremely hard. The average on the final was 55. The elevator project was so hard it derailed a week of my life. Despite that his lectures were the highlight of my day and he truly cares about teaching. There is a truly massive curve so don't give up

He knows what he is doing and the class is very interesting, I found myself always wanting to learn more. The class is engaging and the material interesting. Be ready for a challenge, but look at it as a learning opportunity. Exams are VERY difficult, but just have to beat the curve. Go to lectures, they are very useful.

Participation was not required in class but heavily recommended, lectures can get boring but are very useful. Make sure to study and create study sheets for exams as they are quite difficult, also the final is much more difficult than the midterms.

Lectures are good and homework is reasonable. Exams were difficult despite having a 5 hour window, -- really understand how to apply the design and analysis principles to examples. Don't just memorize; practice. Final VHDL project is hard so start early. However, everything was graded easily, got lots of partial credit even for wrong answers.

He starts off every lecture asking students if anyone has any questions and is truly a very caring man when it comes to student success. He's very accessible outside of class. Be warned -- the class may start off easy but it'll get more difficult near the end (especially with the final project and final exam).

He has good notes but overall his class is very difficult and will require a lot of your time. Never taught us VHDL and expected us to use it in all the projects. Project 3 was insanely difficult and open ended, but graded leniently. Exams are a LOT harder than lecture material. Some homeworks were easy and some were like 'what is this'? Curves tho

has good notes. Expects class to be your only class. Has long hw and gives same week of midterms. Practice midterms are midterms of other classes which are like a 3 his test are like a 10. grades were horrendous. Project 3 he expects you to do yourself when he does 3 lectures on vhdl. His fave "I can't help with that ". harder than 3010. JUST DON'T

3561 is practically 2060 on amphetamines. I found that Eylem did a great job of digging deeper into the concepts, making you think just a little more about what you are learning. Tests and projects were kinda hard, so make sure you start studying/working on them before hand. TIP: When you make your cheat sheet, screen cap pictures from his lectures

Lots of grades in this class. Exams were pretty difficult for me personally, and the projects towards the end get REALLY hard. He likes to assign homework projects and midterms all in the same week at times, so just keep on your toes. Pay attention, study, and you should do better than I did.

Really good professor. He is tough but does a great job explaining the material and knows quite a bit. He teaches with the mentality of us wanting to learn, not on the mentality its professor vs students. He is very helpful. The project for this class was terrible as it was super open-ended. We had no direction and this hurt us in the long run.

Took his online lecture and it was great! He records his lectures from class and also posts all the notes on carmen. He was a funny prof and explained the material very well. However, hw was challenging. Regarding the exams he said,  "Expect to solve problems you havent seen before". True. He makes you think, not memorize. Nothing undoable thou.

I hated this man. He thinks that this is the only class students have. He will assign a homework due on a monday and then assign an entire project due on wednesday. His lectures are ok i suppose but overall i would NOT take this guy.
freaking excellent! extremely OCD! Whatever, I do like him!

He is a good professor and teaches things well. I just wish the jump of difficulty to quizzes and midterms were nicer. Most other professors allow a note sheet, he doesnt until the final which hurts alot. Would I take him again? Probably. Just wish his exams were more related to his notes.

Good guy.  This was a pretty good class overall.  He did a good job explaining concepts on the board in class.  Though, he puts waaay too many slides online, which go overboard on information.  The main issue I had in this class, was that there was a leap of understand from what was covered in class to the HW and sometimes the tests too.

Ekici is a very good professor, and I would definitely take a class with him again if given the opportunity. The class itself can be difficult and the book isn't particularly helpful in giving examples. I'd recommend studying from the quizzes and starting the projects early - if you wait till the last minute you probably won't finish.
This guy is legen... wait-for-it... daryyyyyyy!!
he is good

This class was interesting, and about the easiest 700 level engineering course you'll ever take.  If he just did more examples instead of lecturing over PPT slides it would have been even easier.  Overall, very few and small HW's, final is the last day of class.  Take this class with Ekici!
He is a great teacher and should receive a best-teacher award.

This guy is actually pretty good.  He is very clear in lecture, but his examples took days to do, and helped little on exams.  HW also did not reflect exam content.  Really the exams were easier than the rest of the class- I would study from the quizzes.  Good prof for digital design (561) overall.
Average difficulty for most of class.  Clear notes.  Helpful professor.
Awesome teacher for this class. Midterms / Homeworks hard but thought provoking.
This guy is cool hes allways there willing to help out but he needs to take it easy on the notes a bit
No Comments

Oh god...I don't know HOW I survived the class and got a D+ in it.  This guy is difficult and has 500 pages of lecture notes, which aren't really helpful, especially when studying for his (shudder) exams.

Yes he gives hard midterms but I didn't even do some of the homework or show up for some quizzes and I still got a B-.  Nice guy willing to help you out.  Gives a lengthy project which kind of sucks, but if you are good at MatLab you should be OK.
No Comments

The class average on his midterm (including Grad Students) was 51%. He was willing to help us out, but... after killing our midterms. He gives out 33 pages of lecture notes PER LECTURE, which you have to print out on your own.

Horribly boring lectures but really easy homework and 6 mini exams throughout the semester. Thankfully he posts the slides online so it's better to just read that than listen to him. I practically did the course asynchronously and it was easy.

Pretty decent teacher. He makes the course very accessible with your schedule which I loved. The only gripe I have is that his course is designed to do most work when you have time, yet he has participation quizzes which must be completed the same day. This makes it hard to work ahead OR plan to do course work later.
Super easy class overall. He has six mini exams which are a breeze. Just take him.

(SPEAKING AS A CSE STUDENT) He posts all lectures so watch in 2x after and download the completed slides after. Don't read the book. His slides are the most clear and concise slides an OSU professor has ever made. HW's don't ever take longer than 30 mins, mini-exams abt an hour, maybe 53.5 hours of work (including watching lec) per week for an A+.

Valco is a good professor, although his lectures can get bland really quickly. He assigns a lot of homework but they are pretty easy to do, so definitely find a friend in the class to do them as it makes it so much easier. He gives 9 mini exams instead of finals and midterms, and they are pretty easy if you study beforehand. Overall a solid choice

Lectures technically aren't required in the syllabus but he always gives quizzes during lecture, which add up to a lot of points. Lectures are the worst I have ever had, this guy talks so slowly and will read every single word on the slide. Half of what he talks about is stuff that we don't even need to know. Homework is pretty easy though.

George is a kind dude and a decent professor. Very reasonable overall with expectations. Lectures are a little boring but get the job done and are catered to the homeworks/exams. Exams are fairly easy; Make sure you understand the homeworks. A straightforward A/A-, but you need to put the work in. The book is very helpful.

Valco is a decent choice. There is a lot of homework and reading, but this supplements the lectures well. Exams are similar to homework, but he is particular on answers provided. During online classes, he provided recorded lectures and many office hour times to get feedback. Online exams allow usage of notes with 1% late penalty if turned in late

One of the worst professors I have ever had at Ohio State. He takes all his lecture material straight from the textbook and reads word for word off his slides, and if you ask a question in lecture he doesnt even know how to answer it. Homework is long and not based on his teachings. Exams always have one question over something we never learned.

His class overall wasn't difficult, but lectures were terrible and hard to follow. Slides were a wall of text, or else a diagram with a million arrows and components. The only saving grace was that the homework and exams were fairly easy. As long as you know the basics, you'll be fine for exams and won't have much trouble with the class.
He can't teach to save his life, but at least the material isn't brutally difficult.

Prof. Valco is one of my favorite professor. I enjoyed his class, lectures are a little boring but they are understandable and very useful for homeworks , tests are similar to homeworks and to his class reviews. And also hes a fair grader.

Hes a nice guy, but by far the worst professor Ive ever had. Reads directly from the screen and barley explains anything. Literally, does not explain a single thing. Lecture is not even worth going to but will occasionally have in class quizzes which forces me to show up.
I came to an understanding that the quality of OSU is really bad. Basically, you can add Dr. George J. Valco to your blacklist.

Overall worst professor I have had at Ohio State. Reads word for word off of his slides without elaborating or explaining the more difficult concepts in this course. His slides are also an exact copy and paste from the book. And to make it even better, he puts questions on exams that dont resemble anything in the book or in his slides,

His slides are just copy paste from the textbook. He reads from the slides word for word with no addition explanation. If you ask a question, he just rereads the slide without ever explaining it in a new way. Awful professor, avoid.

Brutal Class. Tons of homework, and a ridiculous amount of material covered, but I've never learned more in a class. You'll walk away from his lectures super confused, but the homeworks help a lot with understanding. Office hours and Review sessions are super helpful if you don't want to spend hours trying to piece everything together for homeworks

Valco's class is comically bad. There is way too many assignments and the lab doesn't even serve its intended purpose which is to teach you about fabrications processes. Every week you are turning in a pre-lab, post-lab, and class homework assignments that takes several hours. This is due to a large disconnect between lectures and assignments.

Take a class with this man only if you are passionate about the material and willing to teach yourself everything. Does not do examples. Notes and (terrible) book do not contain information needed to do homework. His class is structured as if you already know the information and he can't be bothered to attempt teaching how to do problems.

Lectures were long, homeworks were difficult, and tests were very time constrained. Every student in the class used homework solutions, and the tests, while slightly easier than the homeworks, were very long. The highest grade for the midterms were always 1-2 questions away from a full grade, because nobody was able to finish them. Avoid Valco.

The work in Valco's class is really heavy, demanding more time than some of my classes at the 5000 level. His homeworks are very long and you will need to use them as practice to pass his exams. Exams are difficult but not impossible. He is clear in his lectures and quite informative but lacks enough practical example. Recommend avoiding his class.
No way! That's it! I had enough!

Don't know why the bad ratings. He is a great teacher but do not expect an easy class. If you want to learn then he is a great teacher. Tells you right off the bat what he expects from you. He is a harsh grader but overall well worth it.

Good luck if you take 3020 with Valco, the average in my class when all was said and done was a 40%. When we started there were 80 people in the class, at the end only 44 remained. And Valco refused to take this into consideration when he "curved." One person got a .1/10 on a quiz. Why bother give .1 of a point. He just seems cruel.

Valco is a nice dude, he is respectful and clear.  You are going to do terrible in his class, though.  I've spent about 9 hours on all of his 13 homeworks, and pulled all nighters before his exams.  I got the third highest overall grade: 77%.

If not for his tough grading he would be a forgettable, average professor.  As it stands I've started referring to him as Valco the Impaler.  His exams are tough, he grades tough and he is not afraid to flunk half the class.

Valco teaches directly from the text.  Unfortunately, Microelectronic Circuits by Sedra/Smith may be one of the most useless texts I have ever used.  Valco is tough as nails.  His course policies are reasonable, but he is not exactly helpful.  The course is taught like it is presumed that one already understands the material.

He is incredibly tough when it comes to exams and homeworks. He throws tons of material at you and expects all of it to stick. The averages for the exams and overall class were horrid but he curves slightly. Avoid at all costs unless you are truly obsessed with microelectronics!

OK, so here is the truth on this guy. He has a bad reputation for being hard and deserves it, but he is not a bad teacher. He is very organised and really knows his stuff. His notes are good and he follows what the book says to the letter so if you miss something you can just read to catch up. Don't take him if you arent interested in the subject.

There was a prelab, post lab, and homework assignment due each week.  The labs last five hours each week and there is a normal lecture.  In addition there is a midterm and a final exam.  There is also an incredibly long final report for the class.  I never thought I would spend as much time on one class as I did to only walk away with a C.
The guy is a monster! He seems never care about student load and keeps on pushing. Avoid him!

OMG! STAY AWAY. The last week of class someone asked a question from a chapter we didn't even cover in class...so what does he do...he sends out an email telling students to read that chapter he never went over because he might give a question from it on the final. ARE YOU KIDDING ME. I WOULD RATHER WAIT ANOTHER  TO GRADUATE THAN TAKE A CLASS W/HIM

George Valco is one intense dude.  He is probably the most driven instructor I have ever had, and does not miss a beat during class.  Expect two homeworks a week coupled with exams that are laughably hard.  Unless you are really dedicated to learning whatever subject you are taking him with, I would HIGHLY recommend avoiding him.

Despite what you 331 people say, he's significantly harder in high level classes. Grades lab participation to .01. Seriously, can get a 9.65/10 on participation. Lab reports are graded really tough, but the lab is cool as anything. Worth taking even if he's teaching, but it'd be so much better with Anderson.

This guy is surely not happy in his life, but tries to make his students like himself. He is in a battle with himself 24.7.Not a bad guy at all, but he is my least favorite instructor. Grades out of tenth of the point and if u don't show him 2*sin(90)=2*1=2, you will lose points. You can't do anything in your head in his class. Void him at any cost

Laugh at 331/301. It's a cool class, unless you're taking a full load. If you want to spend the majority of waking your time (not an exaggeration whatsoever) doing 637, more power to you. It is a neat class. Don't take it if you're doing more classes. Everything said previously is true, but you learn a lot in class sometimes.

A very good teacher but hard grader. Not the most friendly to the lower level courses, aka people who have yet to prove themselves. His assignements and tests are very fair, he will push you without breaking your back and will never put a question he didn't go over first.

This man does not have the ability to give a simple answer.  If you ask him 'yes or no?' you will get a half-hour dissertation on the advantages of yes and another 45 min on the advantages of no.  Avoid this guy like the plague!!!  If you go to his office all you will get is the same answer he gave in class or the answer from the solution manual.

Not a nice guy.  Incredibly nitpicky with homework-grades each problem out of 10 points down to the 10th of a point, all by himself.  The class all did well on the first midterm-the problem he took off took well over an hour in homework.  Also a jerk.  Rather than giving errata for the new textbook, takes pleasure in pointing out mistakes in class.

Had for 301+205.  The comments here surprise me.  His homework ISN'T bad.  You get TONS of time to do it, and it's EASY points.  His tests are like EASY versions of the HW.  In my book a test is easy if it's easier in comparison to the HW.  He may not be extremely charismatic, but he gets the point across.  I will agree-his grading CAN be harsh.

Horrible grader, will nitpick you on any possible problem. Blows things way out of proportion. For example: The most recent midterm I received 12 points(out of 100) off because I forgot an extra zero on one step (5000, instead of 50000). Avoid if at all possible.

Avoid if possible. Homework is long, and he gives at most a week to do it (some of the problems are based on material he won't cover until the lecture before it's due). Very picky grading, almost impossible to get a problem all right. If you have him, get used to reading the book to figure out what's going on and find friends to help with homework

Not a very good instructor, but he makes you work hard and learn a lot. You may not get a good grade, but you certainly learn something. He isn't a bad man at all; you are always welcome to go to his office. Exams aren’t difficult at all, but for some unknown reasons, nobody does well. His class is like a battle field, so when the class ends, you f

Explained a brief concept of what was being taught, where it was taught again in what course, and left the rest to the book. Didn't allow calculators on midterms/finals. Ended up over 2 weeks behind schedule. Not helpful at all during office hours. Not a good professor.
Semiconductor instructor teaching circuits!!! what the heck!!??? Having nice presentations doesn't mean anything to students unless the instructor has some knowledge!
Personally I liked him but it just depends on how you think about it.
DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH THIS GUY!!! his grading is stupid..lol

There are mixed reviews for this prof.  Personally, I love him.  He has the most CLEAR teaching style that I have seen.  He certainly knows how to make effective powerpoint presentations.  He answers all questions and sees your raised hands.  He also answers them concisely without blabbering for hours, but still gives you what you need.  However, i

Loved this course -not at all what I expected. Prof. Valco challenged us with real-world assignments & discussions, inspired total immersion into the subject with a clear, concise, simultaneously visual and verbal presentation style at an unprecedented level of organization. Fairly tested competency to the highest standard. Complete value!!

After he posted the solution on Carmen, I went to his office to tell him that he answer was incorrect. He said it was correct because he had copied from the solution manual!!! I asked him to solve it for me, but he put his hand on his bald head and said that he didn't know how to solve the problem. What an idiot.
Simply garbage. Void him at any cost! Two huge middle figures up.

On 6/5/06, I made some good comments about him but sorry guys I made a very big mistake. Don't bother yourself taking his class. He is the most irrational instructor I have ever seen. There is no consistancy between the homework, lecture and exams. He teaches from here and there, so u r always confused. I want to kill myself now. He Sucks big time!
Terrible professor.  If you don't understand his teaching style, don't bother going to office hours, because he's just an egotistical jerk who loves to talk over your head.

I disagree with this instructor's approach to teaching.  I'm not against memorizing lots of information, but there should be an underlying framework of main ideas made apparent in the lectures.  Homeworks, lectures, and reading assignments seem to lack this underlying framework.  Too much unrewarding busywork assigned as homework.  Dropped course.

I don't care if this guy is teaching the last class you need to graduate-don't take him!!! Will tell you everthing "wll be on the midterms", but will only test you on 40% over what he went over in class!!

Simply the worst.  An anal jerk who assigns trivial, tedious, and BORING assignements, and will never give you full credit no matter how correct your answers are.  Grades to the tenth of a point; 2 types of homework (including material not part of the class); irrelevant programming chores; essay questions.  Asinine, avoid at all costs.
I'm in class right now and i want to kill myself!!!!!!!  This guy is the best public speaker ever.  Wait, no... he sucks at it!

Most worthless professor ever!  Gives 600 homework assignments daily.  Each homework is based not off of notes or examples in class, or examples in the book, but off of nothing.  Every homework you will not know what you're doing.  Condescending and unhelpful.  Exams are not ridiculous, but not easy either.  Prepare to teach yourself.

as if the overwelming amount of homework isn't enough, he deducts 10ths of points. after seeing your homework destroyed with red ink, his tests will crush your will to even show up to class.  go to office hours if u feel your self esteem is too high and you want it to be knocked down a peg or two.

Smart guy but don't even go to him for help.  As others have said, he is the least helpful professor I've ever met.  And treats you like you are an idiot if you don't understand something. Also gives you an irregularly large volume of (unhelpful) homework

I have to say that most of the comments here are dead on - he's demeaning, condescending, abnormally tough, very demanding, and not very personable.  My least favorite professor of my entire OSU undegrad/grad career.
The worst EE teacher I'm met

Drop any class with valco, not because of the work involved but he is a MONSTER. Very condensending and about as helpful as Berger behind his laptop computer reading the news. You always feel as if he is unsatisfied with life and takes pleasure in misery
Extreamly hard. Literally homework EVERY day.  I learned more from him than any other professor ever.

Dr Valco is really tough, but he is always prepared, and he expects a lot back.  Having said that, on a personal note, he is not the nicest guy I've ever met, but that really has very little to do with his quality as a professor.

George George George of the Jungle.. watch out for that D! Professor Valco was not only hard, but he belittles you in his office hours. His tests and course material covers more than any other professor in the department teaching the same thing.
Great professor for 1181. Really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Ask him for help if you need any, he will happily walk you through anything. I would definitely recommend him.
Lots of busy work but he's lenient on granting extensions. His Canvas page was organized in a way that's hard to find things you need. Overall though it's an okay class
Very easygoing instructor. Dr. Jayakumar seems to be a man of order.
Great professor, great projects, great class.
Very good professor. Is somewhat lax with late assignments. Great person to talk to outside of class as well. Take this professor if you can! He really wants to see every student succeed.

Jayakumar is a very caring and nice professor. He will try to work with you on any problems you may have. His lectures are very informative and he never gives assignments that he hasn't taught how to do very well. The class is not very fun but he makes it a little better by making it easier.

I took Fundamentals of Engineering 1 with him. The class itself is rough, professor notwithstanding. I didn't enjoy the course, but Dr. Jayakumar did an excellent job of making the class as clear and fair as possible. I once missed a test and he was kind enough to let me take it later that day without penalty.  Very caring professor.
He was a very good teacher in terms of explaining the course in a comprehensive way.

Jayakumar really does want students to succeed. His 1181 class is pretty difficult but that's as expected with the 1181 curriculum. He encourages students to come to his office hours and quickly answers every email. Grading is extremely fair. Put in the work and get a good grade.

Dr. Adithya Jayakumar is a Profesional. He cares about what he teaches and is very passionate about it. you can see that in his lectures. He's always happy to help and walks around with TAs to assist anyone who needs it.

albeit ENGR 1181 is the most miserable unnecessary grind for only 2 hours of credit, he makes it a little more bearable.

Dr Jayakumar was fantastic. Sometimes he is a little hard to hear so hope youre sitting close to him. The class is very group heavy and you are basically stuck with the same group all semester. This includes for labs. Hope that your group is good because getting stuck with a bad group will make this class 10x harder.

Professor Jayakumar is amazing. Even though our class size was pretty large, in almost every single class I was able to ask him questions and get one-on-one help. Not only this, but he is a fair grader and emails back quickly. Weekly application assignments tend to take a while and are difficult but if you pay attention in class you'll be fine.
Highly recommend Professor Jayakumar for 1181. He's really good at clearly explaining MATLAB and Excel concepts and really cares about his students.

Dr. Jayakumar was really understanding of everything that was going on with my lief while taking this class. There is a Lot of work that goes into this class for only two credit hours and if you have a tough group then the work load can multiply. He is willing to work with you individually if need be and is easily approachable.
Professor Jayakumar was very kind and also gave engaging lectures. He was very helpful with Matlab and I enjoyed the class. Would take a class of his again.
Adithya is a great professor. He really cares about the material and wants all his students too as well.

Adithya was probably the most caring professor I had all semester long. He frequently extended deadlines and even assisted us with lots of hints through major projects. He does talk alot during lecture but he is very explanatory. Does take a while to respond to emails. This was 2 cred hour class and worth 6 hours of pain but adithya made it better.
He teaches MATLAB very well. He is helpful in office hours and understands that students have other obligations besides his class.

Dr. Jayakumar is a great professor who conveys the information very well. There's a lot of work and a lot of content covered throughout the semester, but nothing that's crazy difficult. Luckily, he's very accessible and very willing to help in his office hours.

Adithya is an awesome guy. He really cares about MATLAB and about his students really understanding the material. This is not an easy course, however. I spend too many hours to count with TA's and emailing Adithya to get all of my assignments done. This class makes you work hard but it is a great class to take!
Do not take his class
Very Good professor
Good professor

The lectures are important because there aren't any real notes for the class. He explains the material very well and almost always provides class time to work on homework which is really helpful. The in class quizzes are not very difficult if you have done the homeworks but the exams are significantly harder than any of the homeworks or practice.

Dr. Jayakumar cares about students a lot and wants you to understand MATLAB, it's just the way this class is structured, loaded with unnecessarily difficult assignments that were both time consuming and long. Def go to the TAs' and Dr. Jayakumar's office hours, they have been extremely helpful. He had extra study sessions outside of class times too

Overall a good teacher. When the examples provided on the slides by the department were not clear enough he would come up with more examples. There are a few group projects at the end of the semester that are a little annoying. The homework takes a good amount of time but the teaching staff was very helpful.

Professor Burks was very caring, listened to any concerns regarding group work or needing extensions for work, and gave really good feedback. The course is really useful for learning technical writing and Mrs. Burks does a really good job teaching it.

Engineering 2367 is an actually useful 2nd writing course. We covered technical writing, presentations, and how to market yourself and your ideas. We wrote professional proposals and emails, analyzed case studies, and got a chance to work on our resumes. Professor Burks is caring, smart, and does a very good job with the online format.
She is the best professor I met.

Very chill and easy class. I think I worked on it for a maximum of 10 total hours outside of lecture this entire semester. Gives examples for the bigger projects which shows you how to get a 100%. Lecture was 15-20 minutes long every week with discussion posts. Group project at the end but I was never stressed in this class. She's super nice 10/10.

Professor Burks was very encouraging and had clear expectations for the class. We had three major projects (2 of them in groups) and she was always accessible and willing to help. Top notch professor that I would recommend to any student.
Easy A. Absolutely the easiest course I've ever taken so far

Class is max one hour of work a week. A few group projects near the end. Show up, put a decent amount of effort into your work, easy A. Professor Burks is easily the best prof I've had at OSU. She truly believes in her students and is completely accommodating and helpful in every circumstance. I wasn't interested in English but still learned lots
Great professor! Very easy class, probably worked a total of 6-7 hours outside of class for the entire four months. Definitely take this if you need second writing credit

Engineering 2367 may have been one of the most useful and relevant classes I've taken as a student at Ohio State. The content of this class focused on technical writing, presentations, and ethics. We wrote professional proposals and emails, analyzed case studies, and got a chance to work on your resumes, all with a caring and engaging professor.
An easy class with a very caring professor.

The content of this class focuses on communication in the workplace and teaches you skills such as how to write resumes, memos, and proper email ettiquite. There is also an emphasis on presentations, which is helpful in improving public speaking skills. Prof Burks definitely sets you up for success, and is a caring and passionate teacher.

Professor Burks class is one of the most useful classes that I utilize in my professional career. It is focused on professinal writing, reports, emails and presentations skills that help shape your professional image down the road. Her teaching style made it very entertaining.

The class is the easiest A possible, as she gives insane amounts of extra credit, even though I'm pretty sure everyone had 100% in the class anyway. There are a few group presentations and papers for each, but as long as you do what she says, you will get a 95+. The content is actually useful, and she LOVES her students (she will tell you often).

Angie is a great professor, for a super easy class. She is very accessible outside of class, with several office hours every week. She gives very good feedback (she'll take a rough draft and tell you a few things to change to get an A). She can be a bit goofy (sometimes bordering on cringy) but is very nice and caring. Great prof who loves teaching
Love Angie! Her classes are fun, and she is such a helpful and approachable professor.

Very cheerful and enjoyable class. She is super supportive and caring for all the students, in and outside the classroom. Class discussion was fun and easy, but useful for writing the assignments.  Most of us still put enough effort and got good grades.

She is very inspiring and really cares about her students. This class is very easy and her standards are very low. You do group activities for no credit almost every class. She is very nice, but a little too touchy feely for me.

Burks has a true talent for speaking and teaching. It is impossible not to pay attention to her, and she encourages class participation, which keeps the class engaging. She gives a lot of great tips on improving your technical writing in emails, resumes, etc.  Honestly the most helpful, caring professor I have ever had.
Prof Burks is super nice and is a good choice for ENGR 2367. She kind of babies you, which is nice and there isn't a lot of writing.

Professor Burks is very nice and really cares about her students.  The class is pretty easy and very popular choice for second writing gen. ed. credit.  It is obvious she loves teaching and she makes class enjoyable.

This is a REALLY popular choice in GE second writing. You need to act fast to get in the class! Prof. Burks is a really nice, hilarious prof who is always willing to help and gives out tons of 'A' in her lectures. She loves students. She also helps me with my reference letter when I applied for graduate school. Taking her class is relaxing!
Taking Professor Burks' class was easily the best experience I have had at Ohio State.  She is a professor that truly cares about the well being of her students.  Take this class!
Prof. Burks is absolutely the best teacher I have met in OSU.

Professor Burks is inspirational and engaging but most of all she cares about her students. A full year after I took her class I emailed her asking if she would be a reference on a job application. THE VERY SAME DAY she emailed me back, remembered me, agreed to be a reference, and wrote an entire reference letter I didn't ask for. INCREDIBLE

This class is the best. All the people I took this class with did exceptionally well. It is a shame someone comes on here and makes 10 poor reviews to discredit Professor Burks. She is one of the most inspirational and beloved professors at OSU because she cares about her students and is passionate about the subject. She really is one of the best.

This class is one of the most rewarding classes I took while at OSU. Professor Burks is very helpful and makes the subject matter easy to understand.  The material you learn in ENGR2367 is applicable to the real world. Professor Burks does an excellent job of covering the material while encouraging personal development. Easy to get good grades.

It was a great class, Prof Burks is helpful and inspirational, you can learn the practical skills to write resumes, cover letter and proposals which would be extremely helpful for the future career. Prof Burks is the nicest prof I have ever seen. Easy to get good grades as you follow the instruction.
I thought this class was an easy GE, but turned out to be really difficult
TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Professor Burks is super nice and helpful and will always complement you all as students. She loves her students  and always gives out encouragement and good grades as well.

Angie is incredibly nice, as in, probably the nicest human you will ever meet. Sometimes she can be over the top, but it is really nice to have a professor who loves and cares about her students so much. I highly recommend taking this class for a second-year writing even if you are not an engineer!
Perfect professor! Love her!
She is so nice and patient. Everyone in my section gets A for final grade.
Best professor ever! Class is easy, helpful, and interesting.

Prof. Burks is awesome! She is fun and funny in class, and extremely supportive of her students. Some of the work was difficult, but if you put an effort in and do the work you will get a good grade. She is an excellent teacher who communicates very well. Would definitely recommend her to other students.
Such a great professor! She is extremely kind and is a very easy grader if she thinks you put effort into it.
Prof. Burks is awesome! I enjoyed going to class and the she makes the material easy to learn. If you do the work you will get a good grade!
Ms. Burks is awesome! She is very helpful and lightens any settings. She helps make hard topics fun and understandable. I would strongly recommend this course!

Wonderful teacher, caring, kind, professional, should be an example for all FEH teachers. Style perfect for IBE. I would do the one pro one con but there is nothing I can criticize about this Professor.
Professor Kennedy was one of my favorite professors during freshman year. Her passion for what she teaches is evident and her classes are stimulating and make me want to show up to class

Professor Kennedy is an awesome professor. She really takes time to meet her students and know them on a personal level. She also is extremely knowledgeable in the cross section of business and engineering

An amazing instructor, if you get him you definitely lucked out! He has a lot of knowledge and passion for Computer Science. Additionally, he's very relatable and cares a lot that his students succeed. Overall, just fantastic!

Great Software 1 TA (hopefully a professor soon). Made the fairly difficult class much, much easier when compared to other sections. Join the discord and attend his review sessions for midterms, as they are very helpful. Always brought in cookies in friday, and brookies after midterms. Don't make him upsetti spaghetti by taking another professor.

You will not find a better professor; especially for SW1.  He is funny and he makes this difficult course manageable and fun.  Every Friday he brings in cookies.  There is not a single coding question that you can ask him that he does not have an answer to.  Knowledgeable, caring, smart, great teacher. Take his course if you can!
Best Software professor out there by far. Great lectures and definitely one of the smartest guys I've ever met. Great explanations.
Braedan is an amazing professor. He is extremely relatable! He makes concepts very easy to understand.

Midterm 3, Final Term project, full homework assignment, and a Final exam all due the last 2.5 weeks of the course. I went into the course excited to learn about steel design and that was ruined for me by this professor

A lot of people hate on her because they can't understand what she says but its pretty easy to understand her if you actually listen and pay attention in class like you're supposed to. Overall, Dr. Hur is an amazing professor who actually cares about her students and has fun in labs assisting groups. I would definitely recommend her.

Going into this semester I was really scared based on the other ratings but professor hur is genuinely one of the nicest professors i have ever had. She was so understanding and was very flexible with deadlines. The only reason I can think that people hate on her for is her accent. Grow up not everyone will sound the way you want them to.

Professor Hur is one of the few great professors in the department. She's extremely caring and makes sure everyone has a good understanding of concepts. She is a tough grader but if you do whats asked you should receive a fair amount of points. She's really forgiving when it comes to exams. Overall a great professor.

Don't let all the negative comments about Professor Hur steer you away from her. She is a great professor, she is just very difficult. She does genuinely care about you and if you just ask her a bunch of questions then she will like you. Lectures are important and the hw is heavy.
Very busy professor who is hard to understand, but she cares about teaching and really wants her students to learn.

Cannot understand anything she says. She is just not meant to teach. She may be very smart, I don't doubt that, but she is the worst professor I have ever had in my life. Rushes through things, doesn't offer proper explanations, and often points at the board while teaching like "add this to this and that to this" instead of articulating.

Dr. Hur was OK when she taught steel design, but abysmal when she taught capstone. She has unreasonably high expectations and is never clear on what she wants to see in reports. She can be very condescending at times and refuses to consider the students' perspective. My advice would be to just steer clear of her in class to avoid the headache.

Very nice and fair grader. Willing to work with students for grading questions. Pay attention to her and she is easily understandable. Nice caring person who works with students on the material. Lectures are good with appropriate material covered with good examples. Don't skip class as material is challenging.

Professor Hur was confusing to follow, frequently writing and erasing things on the board and adding seemingly unnecessary explanations and details. The homework, quizzes, and tests were all very challenging. Thankfully Professor Hur graded nicely though, and she was willing to work with students in need.
Dr. Hur is a nice person. But her main issue is that she is very bad at explaining topics. Also her accent makes it hard to focus in class. Her only good attribute is that she is a easy grader.

She genuinely wants you to do well. She's a nice person and hard to understand at time. Is very helpful on quizzes and her exams are very straight forward. If you pay attention in class, you'll do fine.

She's a really bad professor. We would discuss the same thing 4 lectures in a row. She was clueless most of the time. She would call out students and embarrass them in front of the class. You get to make equations sheets which you can write basically anything on for the exams making them incredibly easy. Not sure I learned anything though.

Absolutely atrocious. Avoid at all costs. You'll learn nothing from Hur. She often can't answer the questions herself and even if she can, can in no way explain them in a way that makes sense to anyone in the class. After taking quizzes or exams, she'll spend an entire class or 2 going over the material, but of course doesn't clarify anything.

Worst professor ever. Thick accent. We talk about the same thing every day for a week, and then she teaches a ton of new material and gives a quiz over all the new stuff. Constantly talks during quizzes. Very rude to students who don't understand. Writes over her other writing on the board making it impossible to understand writing. Avoid this prof

She has a thick accent and doesn't always know what she is teaching, frequently making mistakes or asking the class if she is correct. She doesn't teach you all the material on the homework and then gets mad when the average is so low. She is very arrogant and sometimes condescending if you try to ask her a question.

Wonderful professor and person. Very manageable workload and lectures are very stimulating despite attendance being mandatory. I never dreaded going to class with Dr. Hall as my professor. She clearly cares about her students, and I learned a lot from the course as a whole.

Dr. Hall is an amazing lecturer. Her slides and lectures are very engaging and make it easy to pay attention. There is a lot of discussion board and assigned reading quizzes. She also takes a long time to grade. I overall loved her as a professor but some people I know really did not like her or the class. So its 50/50 on how the class be for you
More work than some of my major classes despite being a GE. Grades too hard without giving clear enough rubrics/requirements. Lectures are mostly useless as well
Very terrible professor.
Always post the grade 2 weeks late and such a tough grader.

Hall was an overall good teacher. The individual projects went well. If you watch the lectures, do the reading, and put effort into your assignments, you will do well in the class. The group project was hard if you got bad teammates. She was an overall good professor. I did not trust other reviews here, which ended up being the correct move.
If you have other choice, don't take this class.

The toughest grader I have ever met. Always post all of your grade about one week after the session is done, so you won't know anything about your assignments and papers till the end. NO EXTRA CREDITS! NO CURVE! Don't take her course if you have other options.

"Im not saying Im Wonder Woman but, weve never been seen in the same place at the same time" How flipping conceited do you have to be to put that in your professor bio? This isnt Facebook for flips sake. For someone who teaches a class that technically revolves around engineering she seems to be lacking a background in it, might want to fix that
Why this lady so mad? Cheeba wouldn't recommend this class at all. Lady has random fits of rage coupled w/ an ego the size of Texas. Good luck with this one.

Assignments change the day before they are due. TONS of homework - more than the other classes I was taking combined, most of it is busy work. Didn't take into account the increased difficulty of group projects for online only classes. Graded 90% of homework a week after the class ended. AWFUL. Could keep going but I'm limited character wise.

To be honest, Dr. Hall's class has clear criteria, if you follow her instructions you will get a good grade. PDF textbook ready! BUT her class is boring and has a lot of homework and projections for you to do and some of them are unnecessary. Participation matters, if you skip 4 meetings you will get a letter down 5 or more absences mean an F.

Grading criteria is clear and she gives great feedback. She wants her students to succeed and will help in any way she can. Don't be late. She is a little slow to grade stuff, but whatever. There's not a ton of lecture in this class, but when there is she does a decent job. Pop quizzes are hinted at beforehand. Class teaches useful career skills.

Lynn is a hard grader but the criteria is super clear and she gives great feedback. She is also very compassionate and willing to help out. At one point in the class I was feeling very overwhelmed and she was very considerate and helped me out immensely. She also wrote the textbook and its free! Fair grader, very helpful course, great teacher.
If you take this course, you will regret your decision for the whole semester

Attendance is necessary at this class. You are allowed to have 3 absence but beyond that it is 10% deduction every absence and 2% every late. Be aware of late policy, even if you are 30 sec late she will mark you late. A LOT of information, homework, team project is included in this class. On average you will have one more 1-month team project than
Ill never take her course again in my whole life.

Her class is very boring. I took her class in Summer, and there are lots of assignment, which I think some are unnecessary. I don't like the way she teaching this class, peer evaluation is very useless, and waste time. Also, she did not give good feedback when she gave you low grade on some assignment. I got A- for the final grade on this class.

Good teacher, but super disorganized. I know she's always busy so it makes grading hard but she does not get things back to you for months. Super nice teacher and gives really interesting lectures. She loves group projects, so beware if you hate them. I really liked her class, but I can't say I was a fan of the lack of grading.
Follow the rubrics and you will get A's.

Prof. Wisniewski was great. While the lecture material wasn't the most riveting thing out there, he did a good job lecturing. Quizzes were open notes and the lab was amazing. The machining section is far better than the Arduino section due to the amount of work. The machining section is easy and impossible to mess up. Good professor, good class.

Dan is knowledgeable and interesting, but his lecture section is pretty boring. I think he knows what he is teaching is not too interesting and works hard to make sure there are cool videos and constantly asks for interaction from his students. Overall,a pretty easy class and pretty good professor

Professor Wisniewski is awesome. He's a caring guy, understands that the content is not the most interesting and does a good job making it interesting with his own stories of his career, and gives good advice about anything with engineering. He teaches the machining section of this class and it had fun labs and was pretty easy.

He's knowledgeable and keeps the content up to date, but his personality makes the class miserable. He is condescending, has a big ego, fills his slides with a textbook worth of information, and calls on students he doesn't like constantly. The exams are difficult but make you actually apply your knowledge. The final presentation is make or break.

Dr. Anderson is one of my favorite MSE professors. His lectures are clear and he genuinely wants you to succeed. The homework can be a bit challenging, but it's far from impossible and going to office hours helps a lot. He's receptive to feedback and allows you to have a cheat sheet on the exams which are very fair.

This is a math-loaded subject. One can easily drown in all the equations and be either scared or confused. Professor Anderson was able to convey the essence clearly and incrementally. Except in-class handouts, no extra reading is needed for HW. Final exam is a 15min project presentation. Highly recommended to those interested in micromechanics.

Great professor! Posts powerpoint slides and video recordings of lectures online! does require attendance by having daily clicker questions. midterms and final were very straight forward and very similar to the practice midterms and final he posts. Very Clear and easy to understand in lecture too. One of my favorite professors yet!

He's a great teacher! Posts powerpoint slides online, and records lectures and posts them online. There are clickers, so attendance is almost always required. Tests are straight forward, you get a cheat sheet; and the practice tests he posts are very similar to the actual exam. And he even brought in donuts and coffee on the day of the final exam!!

Very easy teacher and class overall is easy. Tests are a little odd, though you get a cheat sheet, there's bound to be a few new questions never seen before that catch you off guard and you don't know the answer, and the tests are only out of 20 pts, so if you miss 3 pts, you're automatically in the B range. Other than this, it's a leasurely class.

Very nice guy and good lecturer.  Attendance was mandatory bc of those clickers, but those things arent that bad.  Midterms and final seem alot harder than the samples he puts online, but its not too bad since you get cheat sheets.  HW is on carmen and its like webassign for physics.  Take him for this easy class
Made class very easy, lectured very clearly and made lecture notes available online.  Highly Recommend.
Gravy
Extremely easy, lectures are videotaped and archived online, can skip an entire week of class and pull off an A. recommended.
Boring, not difficult topic of class... Great Lecturer.  Very clear! Very helpful!
Awful. Get ready to learn absolutely nothing in his lectures.

Boring lecturer. Extremely lazy and seemed to not understand what was going on. The homeworks often had questions that they did not prepare us for. He did not care about students learning. Little partial credit. Some projects were pointless and long. He claimed a quarter of the class was caught cheating on hw. Easily the worst ECE prof I've had.

While this course was hard, I feel like I learned a lot out of it and have a fair understanding of the main topics. Prof. Liu is a great teacher and cares a lot about his students. I will take his class again anytime, he is very understanding and always willing to help you.

Go to class everyday, take notes of whats important or work on homework in class. When you get to MATLAB non-coders should DEFINITELY GO TO CLASS. Don't request the answers on ZYBooks unless you have taken MATLAB courses before. Lots of fluff assignments, do the projects ahead of time, group work whenever works, and try hard on lab reports.
was understanding of absences; boring lectures but really easy class.

Dr. Weinberg is a good professor. He's very quiet but he knows his stuff. Lecture wasn't super helpful to me but it's not mandatory. You do a lab every week (also not mandatory attendance) and everything is coding in MATLAB. If coding is easy for you then ur set, otherwise good luck.

Was not a clear. Liked to speak in circles and spew words at will (syllabus is just one example, it's the longest I've seen in four years of college). Course context was easy, project was not tied into context however. Jokingly threaten to yell at students if they didnt follow instructions. Treats 4+ years like highschoolers. Avoid at all cost.

I had a funeral to go to and he told me to get the notes from other students since his notes weren't reliable...Get ready to hear about every single piece of research he has ever done! And don't forget about the worst setup of a midterm you will ever witness.

Class is structured into lectures that use an INSANE amount of powerpoint slides. Prof also does reading quizzes which are 10-minute quizzes with 5 questions covering 150+ pages of reading. His exams are difficult but he gives a study guide. A nice person, but not a great teacher or class
Professor Sours is a great teacher
Cool dude
Such an L professor. Didn't even show up half the time, and never taught anything. Thank goodness the class was easy. By the end, only 1/3rd of the class remained because everyone dropped.
He is the worst lecturer I have ever met. Avoid taking Capstone or any course with him.

I felt like I learned a lot from Dr. Lenhart. I took this class as a requirement for civil engineering. Dr. Lenhart made me work hard, 3200 was not easy. I am very satisfied though, as he taught it well, was very rational, and I learned the most in this class than I did most others in my four years at OSU. Took this class in AU22

one of the hardest and most time consuming courses I've ever taken at osu. not an enveng student so annoyed he gives so much homework. deliberately makes tests harder- even said it in class. hes just too much. avoid him if you can

He presented the material in a clear and concise manner. He would be available to provide feedback in class and during office hours, with detailed homework solutions as well. Labs required a report each week, which was a lot depending on your group. Homework was due each Friday, with some material still being taught on Thursday, which was stressful

Expectations were weekly pre-labs, lab quizzes, lab reports, a lab project, & weekly HWs in lecture. Lab concepts were usually more advanced than ideas presented in lecture and required hours of prep & reports. HWs were intensive; concepts often covered right before due. Exams were challenging with no review provided & accounted for 50% of grade

I think Lenhart made 2100 a lot harder than it needed to be. The class was very homework and lab heavy and the final exam was nothing like the homework and was the worst part of the class. He is a very caring guy and I liked the class, but I think he could be more forgiving on the amount of work required. Get ready for some sleepless nights.

Prof. Lenhart conveys the class material very clearly and really cares for student success. He's very passionate when teaching the fundamentals of environmental engineering. He takes time out of the beginning of each lecture to ask if students have questions on homework and even on exams.

I always knew what to expect for the homeworks, quizzes, and exams based on the thorough notes. Also, he would spend time at the start of class to provide help for current homework assignments. He seems to actually care about clearly conveying the material of his lectures.

Dr. Lenhart is a really nice guy and very well versed in environmental engineering. His notes are crystal clear and his lectures are straightforward. The homeworks and tests can be very difficult, but manageable. No complaints really.

John is a great teacher who knows the ins and outs of his field. He is a little bit hard to warm up to, but once you get to know him, he is a friendly and fun professor. I'd take another class from him.

Can't complain about this class. Homework can help you prepare for the exam. Before taking the exam, please make sure you understand the concept of the assignment. He is the best professor in the civil engineering department and office hours are really helpful.

I added an environmental engineering minor and he was the first professor I had in the department. He's also my favorite professor. He is great in office hours and over email. The class was hard, but I thought it was really interesting. He's pretty clear about what goes on exams, so it's not a surprise. Homework can be difficult, but good practice.

He knows what he is talking about, helps you with homework during lecture, and specifies what will be on exams pretty clearly.  All that's left to do is for you to study a reasonable amount, nothing crazy.  I got a B+ and thought I deserved a higher grade since I was above the average on all exams, but he didn't curve class.  Overall great teacher

Dr. Lenhart is a very intelligent guy. He can fly through notes a little fast at times and homework and exams are difficult, but he is very willing to help at the beginning of each class and in office hours. He really wants his students to understand and succeed.

Dr. Lenhart is a great professor! There's occasional pop quizzes in lecture and homework almost every week but the exams are pretty straight forward. It's important to print out the lecture notes  and to attend lecture. Civil engineers bring the average down making it easier for environmental engineers to get a good grade!
Kind of dry information but if you print lectures off and fill in the blanks as he does then you have all you need to do the weekly homework. Exams come out to about a 70% average.

Lectures were pretty dull. Homework was extremely tough with a lot of things to figure out on your own. Would quiz us on trivial information so expect to remember as much material as possible. Cumulative final - which wasn't fun for semesters!
pop quzzies in lec

This class was very difficult. Weekly APPs and lab reports took hours, and quizzes weekly. My advice is too work your hardest and you can do it. I struggled mentally cause of the course but it wasn't Dr.K's fault. Make sure to ask questions and if you're new to coding please don't be afraid to get help like I was. You got this and don't take @ 8 am

1281.01H is already hard as it is, especially the lab reports but Dr. Kecskemety did a good job during the lecture of trying to stimulate group work. The lectures weren't mandatory but Dr. K made the first half of the actual leaving the last half as time to work on the weekly assignments with your table and you can usually finish them in class.

Dr K was such a good professor, and did a good job giving clear but concise lectures. The few times we had substitute lecturers, I was annoyed at how much they droned on and gave pointless details, which made me appreciate Dr K even more. A fun class, though the post labs are time consuming.

1281 in all regards should be an 8 credit hour class. Prepare for countless hours of application/Post Lab assignments. A benefit is that exams/quizzes only account for 25% of your grade. Dr. K is a great professor, though, and was able to make many accommodations for me throughout the semester. Highly recommend the professor, not so much the class.

FEH has TONS of homework. Dr. K does an AMAZING job explaining everything so it feels manageable! Lectures are great and much better than the daily readings. If you need something, ASK HER! Beware, though, the weekly quizzes and daily pre-lectures can be rough and postlabs are tedious. As long as you manage yourself, you'll be fine.

FEH is most likely the class with the largest time commitment, look forward to countless hours spent on applications and weekly lab reports. The class was very demanding, but Dr. K was very responsive to emails and flexible with due dates for personal reasons. The whole department that teaches FEH is great!

This class will consume all of your schedule so beware if you are taking it with other difficult classes. This professor in general was not approachable to help in a situation that was definitely not possible with my own given knowledge.

She is delightful. She comes to class with a good attitude and is very receptive to how students learn (she is an engineering education PHD). The content was tough, but learning it was made easier by the amount of assignments and extensive notes. She also made sure we had the concepts down with various concept-only assignments. You will learn.

The class itself is just a huge pile of busy work that will eat up a lot of your time, but Dr. Kecskemety makes it bearable. She only took attendance for class once, lecture slides were posted on Carmen, and she would do classroom whiteboard activities to test our understanding. The actual material is super easy to grasp, just do all the homework.

Dr. Kecskemety is a really kind and helpful person. Attendance wasn't taken in lectures, but there were lots of whiteboard activities that helped learn concepts, so don't skip! Overall, she's a pretty fair and helpful professor.

Dr. K was a pretty average professor. She read off slides, but tried to engage the class. The one thing I really didn't like was that we had to switch groups halfway through the semester. It was really unnecessary and didn't provide any benefit.

The class is easy for sure, but I did not have a good experience with Dr. Kecskemety. She seems to have no issues with group members freeloading off of others in a group project. If one of your group members does not do any work, she will not do anything and the useless member will still get the same grade as you.

Doesn't really care one way or the other what you do in the class. She rarely lectured, and if she did it wasn't useful. I tried asking for help on a project and she told me not to worry about it and that I would figure it out. The class is easy, so don't worry about that just don't expect anything life changing.
Participate and pay attention and her class is a gpa booster

Dr. K is the best! She is dedicated to helping students learn the information, and gives class demos and good lectures. This class contains a ton of work, but as long as you do the work, you'll do well. She has office hours and is willing to meet you at a different time if her office hours conflict with other classes.
Dr K. is a great professor. Be prepared for tons of coding and a lot of group work!

I really enjoyed this class. Dr. K was very helpful, and the class structure allowed for a good balance of lecture and working alone/ in groups. Like all 1181 classes, the workload is much more than 2 credit hours, but if your group meets regularly you should be fine. I got help both in person and email (quick responses), so don't be afraid to ask.
Very nice, energetic professor.  She seems to care about her students, she answers questions and gives us clear instructions on assignments.
Dr. K is great! She is very clear on expectations for the course. Her lectures are not boring, but they are not  super interesting either. She's one of the best 1181 professors!
You can tell Krista is truly passionate about what she does. She is bright and cares about her students, but there is a lot of homework which sucks.
Krista is clearly intelligent and you can tell she wants her students to succeed.  She has a difficult class, however, it is well worth the effort.

The FEH Robot project is one that requires a ridiculous amount of work, but for many people it does pay off. The class is a lot of work, but not too difficult to get a good grade in. Dr. K is super helpful and will answer whatever question you need, and is also pretty cool to joke around with. Still, most of the help you will get from TAs.

FEH itself is hard. Responds to emails very efficiently, and is a great help in class. Use class time effectively. TAs do the grading, but Dr. K included great examples and exam preps in PowerPoints and lectures. She operated the flipped classroom well, and asks questions in the beginning of class, so it helps to be prepared. Good luck!

FEH: Get ready to spend 14 hours on a Lab Report and get a C- on it while you also are do pre-lecture and post-lecture assignments for each class. You'll spend about 6 hours per day on class-work  Dr. K: She kept lectures short and sweet, allowed most of the class time to work on  programs. The TAs are pretty helpful. She is also pretty funny.
Dr. K was a great professor who did a great job teaching this course.  She really wants to help her students succeed on the in-class assignments and the exams.  Definitely recommend her overall.

If you got Dr.K, so you are in FEH and your only way out is dropping. Dr.K is easily the hardest FEH professor in the history of FEH and your GPA will never recover from the trauma she will inflict upon it. She makes pretty great brownies, but you'll need to get an A on a midterm to taste them, and that has only happened once. Sobget ready

Very helpful professor and made class fun. Definitely knew everything that was taught in the class well. Replies to emails quickly and is happy to help you outside of class. I was terrible at programming but thanks to Dr.K I got an A in the class. I definitely recommend this professor.

Not what you would expect from a new instructor; seemed very prepared. Knowledgeable about the  programming languages used (MATLAB, C/C++). Very helpful when answering questions. Also pretty funny. Would definitely recommend that you take her class (that is, if you have the misfortune of being in FEH, haha).

She's very knowledgeable but doesn't know how to convey it. She just reads from the slides in lecture - rly boring. She did a huge curve for the exams bc people were bombing. Practical exams were hard. Would go to class bc sometimes exam ?s were on TopHat. Easy to do well on labs. Quizzes find a good group to take them with (she says to do this).

This class was heavily curved and I ended with over a 100. Yes she reads from the slides but an anatomy course is so content heavy you pretty much have to. I think she did a great job and tried to make it fun for the class. The labs weren't difficult and neither were the exams. All the questions are pretty straightforward.

Class was hard, but everyone struggled so it was curved nicely.  Lauren was not a great teacher.  She just reads off slides, often in an uninteresting way.   It made retaining information very difficult.  I found the lecture to be mostly unhelpful, but Lauren won't post any notes online for if you miss it.  She also encourages cheating on quizzes.

This class is not hard to pass due to exams being not super heavily weighted and not cumulative. There is a lot of content to remember and you'll need to study a good amount to get an A. Dr. Eichaker does an ok enough job but mostly reads from the slides. She gives some good examples. We did not have a real cadaver lab due to a shortage of bodies

Fair grading and low-effort class outside of the week before a paper is due (which there were two of). Not a good lecturer. Content is not structured or displayed well. Very soft-spoken which makes hearing his lecture difficult. Not the best at answering questions. Sometimes kind, sometimes cold. Avoid if trying to learn, take for easy A.

His voice is way too quiet to the point where it is impossible to listen to everything he says. And, as the last review stated, he gives useless and sometimes completely wrong information during office hours which has hurt my homework grades a few times. He also never posts any grades into Canvas so it is impossible to know your grade.

Pathetically bad at teaching and everyone usually left lecture more confused than when we came in. Hides equations on the slides so if you ever miss a class you won't have the content you need to do the homework, and gives confusing and sometimes just straight up wrong advice in office hours.
Answers questions, gives you exactly what you need. Exams translate to homework pretty well. Doesn't always answer questions well.

A lot of self-studying and internet help.  All lectures are hand written ppt slides, which are hard to read sometimes. Quite voice. A lot of derivations, but he reads through them rather quickly and not enough of examples to do HW. Exams are different from HW, more conceptual. Extra credit offered often. Overall he cares for students to do well.

This was not an easy class as far as material and exams go, but he is very generous with bonus points, lets you redo a midterm problem if you really messed it up, and Im pretty sure he curved the class a lot. Also, go to office hours, he is interesting to talk to and very helpful.
Prof Brillson was amazing. Great guy and extremely helpful, especially in office hours. Allows you to use multiple cheat sheets in exams and the exams were pretty fair. Highly recommend.
Homework was difficult but optional. All of the tests were simple, straightforward, and very fair, as well as open note. He really cared about making sure everyone understood the material.
One of the better teachers. Cares about everyone understanding the material. Exams were based around homework problems. Fair grader.
Hands out notes. Will go over the big test ?, and goes over it in the class before test.  Gives extra credit on test.  Just study the notes and you'll be fine.

Dr. Brillson is truly a gentleman. You should take as many classes as you can with Brillson. He is fair, generous, fun, and prepares you pretty well. If you read his notes, follow the book, and do the homework you will do fine. He is probably the best in 331/432 series.

Probably the best teacher for 331/432 series.  Sometimes goes a little fast through lectures.  I had to learn a little bit from the book on my own but the bottom line is that this guys gives so much extra credit you would have completely blow the class off to get a grade below a B.  He also curves exams so that class average is around an 85%.
Best Teacher at OSU, you want to take him, he makes sense and you will ENJOY solid state :)
Probably the best teacher for this class series. Fair exams, good grades in the end.
Pretty good prof.  Wanted to be as clear as possible in lab.  Nice guy, class was pretty easy & fair.
Bleh! Worthless class, made me want to be mauled by a badger!  However, he liked me and I think I may slip by... so I was kind.
He's the kind of teacher that makes me wonder why I'm in electrical engineering.

THE BEST TEACHER IN ENG. HANDS DOWN. His material is to the point, brings in real world situations/products to class, takes you down to the cleanroom, genuine love of teaching, every prof. should be required to have real world work experience.
he's a good lecturer, but his explanations goes like a bullet train esp. at the end of the class where everyone starts leaving.

Great professor. Very helpful and understanding of our circumstances. Exams are fair, lectures are very helpful, and labs are easy. Homework ranges from very easy to very hard and time-consuming. Quizzes are hard and you have a limited amount of time to do them. Make sure you go to lecture and start your final project waaaaay ahead of time!
He never respects others' work.

Please do not take 5200 if you aren't actually interested in DSP. The latter half of the class moves completely into filter design work, with few resources actually relevant to helping you solve the given assignments. The notes, while very nicely done, don't give much direction for problem solving, offering examples that are trivial or irrelevant.

The BEST professor I've ever met at OSU, his lecture packets were laid out perfectly with some of the information left out blanks and would be taught during the lectures, he would upload the full version later. HWs and exams were challenging but if you fully understand the lectures, they were pretty useful for learning and doing well is natural.

He is clear in his teaching, his notes are very well organized, and he was really helpful in office hours. However, while both midterms followed the structure of the class and homeworks, the final exam had an entirely different focus. Which made the review sheet worthless and the exam itself painful. Also, he did not curve the final grade.

This class might be the toughest class for an undergrad, but Schniter's notes helped out a lot. He encourages students to come to class by uploading partially filled notes. Midterm was really difficult and long, but he evened it out by making the final really easy. Really nice professor.
He is a nice and helpful professor
Good teacher. Notes were self-contained, and you could take this course without the text, if you go to all the lectures. Quite a bit of homework. Tests were fair but not easy.

This professor is probably the laziest professor I had so far. he just copy's old stuff. don't be surprised if he posted a homework 2 days before its due. If I was him I would be embarrassed to even get paid.
He is cool and his notes are really good and clear. He is very helpful in his office hours.

Pretty cool but very lazy guy. He skipped many classes, notes contained a lot of errors and it took him forever to update the notes, and he assigned the HW just two days before it was due. He is a very capable person but he surely doesn't do his best!
No Comments

By FAR the best ECE professor I've had at OSU.  Encourages questions even in a large lecture hall, and is very good at putting circuit components and ideas in layman's terms.   The only complaint I have is that he is often absent (he lets the class know ahead of time), and the substitutes that fill in aren't nearly as helpful as Phil.

Phil is a very good teacher and is very friendly. He puts tough concepts in plain English and always has a good analogy to help you understand. He also gives very succinct and complete notes during lectures. His notes reading back through the textbook much easier. Exams are quite fair.

Kahraman is a masterclass in delivering lectures. Despite the amount of content in the course, his teaching never feels rushed and he takes time covering plenty of examples. He has high expectations but is a super cool and funny prof. Exams and homeworks are very fair. Go to his lectures and you'll get a lot out of this course
He's very funny and taught the material really well. Some concepts can be confusing, but that's just the nature of the class and he did a solid job of teaching it. Made the class pretty fair.
He's a good professor, and made a pretty tough class fair. Homework and exams are all doable as long as you put in the work. He's pretty funny too.

I took this class because it was a technical elective and it fit in my schedule, but it ended up being my favorite class. Dr. Kahraman seems to genuinely want to teach his students the material as well as keep them entertained. He is by far the best mechanical engineering professor I've had, and I had him in my final semester of undergrad.

Very good teacher. He makes the class very interesting even if the material is boring. Gives a lot of practical examples. Funny guy. I loved this class. The grade is split between 2 midterms and a Final. Homework is only 10%. I'm not good with numbers , so I got only a B+, but  the subject is not tough at all.
One of the best professors I've ever had.  He's very interested in the material he teaches, and he's very organized.  He likes Pink Floyd so he's OK in my book.
No Comments

No curve, it seemed; grade weighted almost exclusively toward exams.  Worked very hard on homework, had what I felt was a great grasp on the material, got a lower grade than I expected.  VERY helpful professor, though; presents material well!
Keevyn is a good fellow, very knowledgeable
Genuinely the best and helpful professor at Osu

Easily the best GTA I have had in my time at OSU. Send's almost daily messages reminding students of homework, offers amazing help in office hours, provides meaningful and understandable examples in recitations. If I had a GTA like Boden in every class, I would have absolutely nothing to worry about. Cannot express enough how awesome he is.

Boden is an absolute gem! Easily my favorite instructor at OSU!! He explains things clearly and is super helpful. Honestly he makes a tough semester somewhat enjoyable. I only wish I could have him for every class!

I had Boden as my physics tutor, and he really turned things around for me. I wish I had started tutoring with him from the beginning of the semester. He's a nice guy, and the way he explains things is super clear and helpful. Honestly, he should be teaching physics!
Had him for ME3751 and was 1000x better then the actual professor
I was struggling with dynamics this semester and Boden spent his own time to tutor me for free! he knows his stuff back to front and was really helpful! my first midterm went very well
Super duper helpful! THIS DUDE IS THE GOAT!!!
