He understands the course materials extremely well, and on top of that, he knows how to be a good instructor

Had him as a tutor for physics. This guy should be a real professor, cause he did 100X better than my prof! He made difficult concepts look like a piece of cake. Have always enjoyed the way he teaches. It is like watching a stand-up comedy lol
Jin-Fa Lee is a very good professor
JFL is the man! Entertaining lectures!

I loved Professor Lee. He cares more that you understand the material and the grade is secondary. His lectures are very student involved (A couple of us lectured for him in front of the class) and he makes funny deprecating jokes. Exams are take-home and he works through them in class before they are due. I learned a lot from his teachings!

He uses a lot of self deprecating humor in class. This is the hardest class I have ever taken. He makes it seem like he's going to curve the final because that's what he did for the midterms and then he didn't, which was annoying.

A master of the material. He is very good with the rigors of the maths and the explanation of the physics behind boundary value problems. I highly recommend his courses if you really want to learn something about the deep, underlying principles of Maxwell's equations.
Probably worst class I've ever taken. Combination of Lee's horribly unclear teaching, boring material, and his pompous attitude i hated every minute of this class

His teaching material helps a lot. I took a similar class two years ago and I found out his material has been a lot more organized and helpful. You could learn a lot from his class once you really try to understand computational EM.

Skipped 25% of the lectures, never replied his emails, and was never in his office during his office hours. Extremely arrogant, rude, impolite and offensive. He joked the first half of the quarter, but then accused us of being dumb and lazy. Void him at any cost. He is a disgrace to EM program at OSU. He should leave OSU immediately!
This professor is arrogant,ruthless, and shamelss. He doesn't care about the student accept for trying to make a big name for himself. Prof. John Voulakis should fire him immediately.
He is really good in explaining physics and math behind electromagnetics

Jin-Fa is really a math professor in diquise! Loves proving vector calc. Of course the class was hard, its electromagnetics! Nevertheless he was sent from the hevans above-he really wants you understand the concept! "Don't worry about your grade, you will do good". Failed midterms and final, but still got a B+. Like I said, he was sent from above!

Crazy, ruthless, and confusing, but very hilarious! Material before 1st midterm a repeat of Physics 132, but then it picks up and gets complicated. Grading is very generous. As long as you write the correct equations on test/homework, you will get an A!

What a jerk.  He was goofy/funny early on when the material was easy, but once there is anything you don't understand you are in trouble.  Can barely understand his english.  "Let me wepeat one more time..."  he sucks.  Refuses to do example pro

I switched to the better 3020 professor (Musah) after one lecture. I suggest you do the same. Musah is a amazing teacher, unlike this one. Any good reviews of this guy didn't actually show up to his lectures, or he wrote that review.
Take him for easy A. Avoid if you actually want to learn.

Bibyk is a hobbyist not a teacher. He goes over LT spice homework questions in class and posts zoom recordings but still left me head scratching if the answer I submitted is what he wanted. Grades very easy but I did not learn much. Class schedule was very disorganized.

Bibyk is an incompetent teacher who preaches about flaws in the American education system while providing an even worse experience. His course fails to teach analysis techniques or calculations, essentially weeding me out of higher-level electronics. Do yourself a favor—avoid him for 3020 and find a professor who actually teaches the discipline.

Everything in the other awful reviews is still true. He seems to acknowledge that he is disorganized and lazy with how he teaches and does not care. His teaching style would actually be good if he was just more organized in lectures and on canvas. I mean his notes are unformatted, not labeled, and just all through together and typed in a Word doc.

He will legitimately never go through a single practice question in class. Instead he will just yap about an upcoming makeathon. Unless you really take the time to go through the MIT lectures and textbook material, you won't pick up on anything. I did so good in ECE 2020 just to forget it all when I had Bibyk.

All this professor does is use the word abstraction about a million times, assign MIT lecture videos because his lectures are awful, and give homework that is "participation based" however the answers are legitimately impossible to find. Do not take.

I loved Bibyk. His methods aren't conventional but by god it works.... he encourages you to search and look for answer. I'm not used to answering essay questions but I feel like I learn a great deal from working on the homeworks.
Didn't teach, just told us to look at Wikipedia pages and MIT course slides from 2007.

Dr. Bibyk is indeed very human. He likes online classes, Wikipedia, and biking. Also loves MIT lectures more than his own. Encourages involvement outside of his class. While his class is an easy A, I switched to a different professor because you can actually learn the material.
He loves ECE but cannot teach, you will learn nothing. However if you want a free pass through 3020 it is much easier than any of the other professors.

This ece hobbyist does not deserve to teach. He cares nothing about learning. In fact, he simply points you to Wikipedia if you actually want to learn anything. No effort in lectures. Assignments are directionless. He is the scum of ECE at OSU. Avoid at all costs if you even remotely care about ECE. Only praise possible is that he is an easy A.

Another semester still no changes from Mr. bibyk. If you want to learn about electronic do not take this professor. Lectures are very broad and he doesnt teach specific or problem solving. Homeworks and exams are confusion and have no correlation to anything. Everything seems to be for effort so thats a plus but you wont learn anything.

trust these reviews and don't take this class. We're 7 weeks in and we haven't learned anything. he's too selfish to share how he knows stuff, so instead he tells you to look everything up. Doesn't care whatsoever. Uses other people's material (MIT, wikiversity, etc) and doesn't even teach them. Expects you to be an MIT student. DO NOT TAKE HIM.
Man's straight up teaching from a wikipedia article

Just started the semester and already wanting to drop out. He expects you to remember everything you've learned before, and does no actual teaching. He just gives you links to find information for you to learn YOURSELF. I don't understand why he can't just teach the material. He just tells you what to look up. I'd much rather pay for khan academy.
Don't take his class, especially 3020. If you don't believe me, just give it a try.

The homeworks arent bad, as most problems are explained in class. This genuinely makes the class so much harder because exams are graded are on accuracy as opposed effort like the homeworks. Class was made a lot more difficult and definitely not accommodating during COVID-19. Avoid taking it with him if you can

If I could give him a negative rating I would. You will not learn a single thing in this class. Homeworks are graded on effort but then both midterms and final report are all for accuracy which is almost impossible to get a good grade due to him teaching nothing. Not accommodating at all for COVID-19 and strived to make the class harder for us.

Really nice guy, very knowledgeable, but not meant to be a teacher. He can answer any questions you have, but email responses take several days (if he does get back to you). If you want to learn, you'll have to read the textbook and definitely study the stuff he posts online. Lectures are brutally boring, but have important info. Generous grader.

Dr. Bibyk is an awesome guy. He cares a lot about his students and wants to be a resource for success for the future. However, he is not an organized or gifted instructor. It feels like I haven't learned anything in his classes and now I'm walking into a final that I'm pretty sure I'd get the same grade on if I took it at the start of the semester.

Horrible. Literally told our class he could do a better job at teaching, but he'd rather spend his time creating a makerspace, pathetic. Extremely disorganized, not even given a syllabus. When applying for research with 3020 prereq, I was told to take I would have to take the class again with another professor. Don't take him if you want to learn
Waste of my tuition. Did not learn a single thing.

This course with Bibyk gave me the knowledge to interview for industry level VLSI jobs.  He doesn't spoon feed material which makes lazy students mad.  Rather he teaches what things to look for and how to find the material for yourself.  I literally just got a top notch VLSI job because of this course. If you work hard, you'll get a lot out of it.

If you watch his video lectures then you can follow him during class, but he isn't the best on explaining topics. Nice professor, wants people to succeed and be creative. Loves jokes and isn't intimidating. It's an easy 'A' course if you put some effort into the work.

Terrible professor. Doesn't really teach, just expects you to learn. Get ready to make stuff up for his class. Also he usually cancels class about every Friday and does a "distance lecture" (worthless video that might be helpful on the homework). One good thing though, he helps you answer the homework (even on the day it's due), which is nice.

Steve Bibyk is probably the worst instructor I have ever hard. He is a funny,  laid back guy, but I have never learned less in a college class. You will take this class, not learn a single thing, and pass the class with a B by making things up on the exams and getting "partial credit". It is a true shame to not learn about a fundamental EE subject.
You will not learn one thing about circuits in his class. Awful teacher.

Bibyk teaches differently. He doesn't teach linearly and expects students to put in a lot of time outside of lecture (watching separate lectures, googling, reading). He knows the subject, is happy to help and is quite lenient when grading, but his rambling  way of lecturing can be really frustrating. Find a group, do the work and you're golden.
Sucks. Worst professor I have ever had. Decides not to teach and tells you to look at 3 other sources of material instead.

Terrible. Avoid if at all possible. I have learned more about circuits from my device physics class. He tells you to just look at the online MIT freshman circuits class (for a junior level circuits class).

Dr. Bibyk is the worst professor I have had yet at OSU.  He babbles during class about what you're going to go home and teach yourself through other college's online courses and doesn't teach a thing.  At 6 weeks in and I had less than 1 page of class notes.

Don't take his course if you really want to learn something. He is the worst the instructor I have ever seen.  He taught nothing in class. And I'm happy he does not continue to teach ECE5021 this semester.  He is the shame in my college learning life.

If you are willing to take initiative, his classes are informative and somewhat easy. He provides answers to homework, even tests during lecture, but projects and studying for the final should always be a group effort.
You have to have some IC background to attend his class otherwise you will never what he's talking about... It's not hard to get an A though.

Dr. Bibyk is a great guy, but not a great teacher. It's not that he can't teach - he prefers to not teach. He gives vague assignments, cancels class every Friday, doesn't post homework/exam solutions for weeks... etc.  If you need rigorous logic, don't take Bibyk's class. Beware the final project - its more arduous than you think.

ECE3020 in AU15. The guy is really cool, but he's a god awful teacher. He doesn't teach. If you ask for help in office hours he's helpful, but he doesn't teach or lecture in the slides. If you have him for 3020, read the book early, ask questions often, and watch the MIT OCW videos quickly.
Not helpful at all. But it is a good course to raise your GPA and make the credit hours you need.

Truly a great guy, but I don't recommend taking his classes. He doesn't lecture, just rambles about random topics and the homeworks. Exams aren't bad if you know the material, which means you needed to have read the textbook, read the random slides he provides, and Googled it all.
Worst IC professor ever. I don't even know why he taught digital VLSI while knowing nothing.

Prof. Bibyk does not lecture like 90% of profs. He simply introduces you to the material and expects you to read/skim the text book and websites and learn the material how ever you can. He does not spoon feed at all. If you take his class and follow what he says to do YOU WILL LEARN SO MUCH.

Awesome prof.  Study hard and go to class. The students who don't learn anything don't do either of these and just do the minimum to get by (pure laziness.)  Bibyk doesn't spoon-feed but is incredibly helpful towards students who show initiative. After all, we're in college, not high school.

Dr. Bibyk is an awesome professor!  He is difficult (especially regarding the tests) but definitely fair.  He is genuinely interested in helping students understand the material and knows his stuff. He has wealth of knowledge in Digital/Analog VLSI.  I definitely recommend him, just don't be lazy student. Put the time in to learn all th

Proffesor Bibyk is an extremely difficult professor BUT you will learn SO MUCH. Be ready to spend alot of time in the lab! Even though it was difficult, I did learn alot about VLSI design and I'm glad I was exposed to that material. Very helpful after class also!

Be prepared for a lot of individual work. If you are interested in learning the material well, be as resourceful as possible. Hard to follow in lectures, but if you know what questions to ask, he gives good answers. His grading is not always very easy, but the material he quizzes you on you will have seen before, so grade wise the class is easy.

Lecture is the most worthless stuff to go to for this guy. I guess he tries to teach, but you learn absolutely nothing. He tells you to go ahead and watch the MIT OCW lectures. Not too hard of a grader bc of his lack of teaching skills though. I don't know what to say.

Worst professor ever. Nothing he has ever said has been useful. His notes are useless and he tells you to go to Wikipedia instead of using the textbook. I seriously don't understand how he is able to teach. The class isn't that bad if you watch the MIT lectures. Avoid him at all costs.

Steve Bibyk is simply the worst professor at Ohio State. He never teaches anything, uses powerpoints made by other professors, and basically tells you to look at MIT lecture videos in order to learn. He gives partial credit randomly, tests over material that he never covered in lecture, and tells you to memorize the material rather than learn it.
He's the laziest guy in the department.  I went to his office a month after final grades were posted, and I asked to see my final project grade.  He told me he didn't actually look at them in detail

May know his stuff, but terrible at teaching. Never actually teaches, just mentions what he is going to teach. But never actually does it. Never works any examples, just goes over how he would do it. No math in class, no thought processes. Just skimming. Telling us to go home and teach ourselves.  Very frustrating to deal with.

Steven Bibyk was a very good teacher who challenges his students to work hard, and if you pay attention you will get a lot out of his lectures. He's very prepared and informative and you will learn a lot from him if you really want to; he's also a big fan of Darcy Egan and the Great Outdoors and the table of contents. The book is also very good.
Put simply, the worst professor i've had in my 4 years at OSU.
unorthodox style of teaching to say the least, but the class is so easy it doesn't matter... tests are straight forward, a recitation would make this like any other class with a useless lecture

Totally unorganized. Uses MIT lectures and PPT's to teach and is all over the place. This guy will have 10 different windows open on the computer and click back and forth between them. Grades dont matter to him either just write down whatever he says in class on the exam and youll get a pretty good grade. I cant believe they let him teach.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. He teaches absolutely nothing at all in class. I can't believe anyone would defend his teaching style. All he does is open the MIT website and read their lecture PPTs. I'm pretty sure I don't pay thousands of dollars a quarter to have PPTs read to me. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!
Spends 10 minutes a day looking at the table of contents. Doesn't explain anything well. The only positive  thing he has going for him he speaks english. Should be fired.

Absolutely terrible professor.  If you need to advance in ECE, do not take him.  Grading was very easy - he gives points if you write jokes on the tests or quizzes.  I missed a 30 point (out of 100) problem on an exam and got a 91%.  Take if you want an A and to learn nothing.

Bibyk is for people who want to learn on their own. He is a true teacher only when you apply yourself. He understands not everybody in the lower classes(as all of the other ratings are from) are there to learn. Much better teacher in higher level courses. Good teacher who gets a bad rep from people who don't actually apply themselves.
horrible

Take him if you dont need to understand the material.  Write down every word he says, then repeat them in any order on the test and you cant get less than an A.  It doesnt need to make sense to you or him.  Let his classes be a GPA booster and thats it.  If you want to learn the material, get another prof

"The biggest thing you need to learn in this class is to skim the book"-beginning of class till a week before exams.  "You should memorize everything relevant in the book"-week before exams. Had 4 exams in 1 day. Asked to switch his to another day. "I think you should suck it up and take it then." Note that all of these actually are quotes of him.
If you take 323 with him, go to class every day, write everything he says down, and on the exam write everything back to him, even if you don't understand it.  No way you can get less than 90%
Teaches inverter very well. But that's almost it!

Graduate students: He is not advisor quality - not smart, gives you the run around before giving your recommendation, his lecture and his courses are useless, in a word totally unprofessional.  Undergraduate students:  Dont waste your time with his classes, if you think you cannot understand him, its not your fault neither does he.
Constantly puts down other profs and the department. Very unprofessional. His "lectures" are nothing but scribbles on an overhead. Buy the book and read it on your own time, you will learn more!
Never take class from this guy. He is a terrible teacher. You don't learn anything. He is so unorganized and very hard to follow.

Very helpful. If you want to learn VLSI take it with this guy and pick his brain after class. In class lectures are VERY scatter-brained and hard to learn from. The textbook is awesome though. This guy (unlike other profs) is based in reality and isnt affraid to tell it like it is.
She's actually the best professor I have ever had. She cares about everyone, and if you put in the effort, you can get an A. I also genuinely learned the material.

Very very nice, gives corrections and extra points. Tests are pretty straigh foward you just have to put in the time/effort to study and topics which can be hard to understand at first but she is very helpful in office hours

Really awsm prof and class, ended up getting 100.1/100 finally in class. Keys r: Do hw by urself, utilize test corrections, office hours. The final had lot of extra credit so don't worry abt it. Prioritize the 3 midterms which were not hard but content heavy, just once again do the hw and make sure u know how to do every problem. u cn succeed ezily

Professor Dupaix is a very caring professor who wants her students to succeed. She provides answers to HW assignments in order to check your work, and tests are very fair with many opportunities for corrections. Probably one of the best engineering professors I have had.
She is amazing! I had her for ME 2010 although it isn't an option on here. My best lecturer for ME so far.

She was truly such an amazing teacher. You could tell she really enjoyed teaching and wanted students to do well in the class. Her lectures were sometimes overwhelming with the information but she explained it well and gave detailed notes and practice. She let you correct midterms for points back and gave very good comments on anything she graded.

She's one of the best professors I've had. She answers questions very well. Homework was easy, midterms were tough but fair, and if you did the homework and practice exams that she posts, you will do fine. She's very caring and is able to relate with her students. Additionally, she allows midterm corrections. Make sure to do the work.

The nicest professor I have had at Ohio State. Prof. DuPaix absolutely cares for helping students truly learn the course material. If you want an A you are going to need to work for it though. Most of the grades are weighted in the exams and the course is uncurved besides getting half back with midterm corrections (does not apply to final).
She is so nice. Homeworks are VERY easy. Midterms have 50% revisions. And she's just really nice!!!!!
Professor that cares about her students doing well, but struggles to teach difficult concepts. Tests are tough but corrections are allowed.
Best Professor I have ever had, interesting lecture with useful examples. Give back the midterm quickly and provide useful feedback. Give extra credit for correction.
Participating in classes was a waste of time. Also, the required book, written by the professor, was not helpful at all.
The professor is not accessible outside of the class. She makes you to hate FEA class with useless/hard hws
THe class was not organized at all. The labs and project are not useful, so you spend hours and hours on one of the project without learning anything.

The professor makes you to buy her own book which is not very useful and be ready for the typos in the book. She is learning the softwares along the student so do not expect her to be helpful. The tests are too hard for only 50 minutes. Canceled the classes/office hrs because of her personal problems. Do not take her class if you have other options
Dr. Dupaix is reaaaally good at being there for students. Just participate on the discussion page and she will help you enormously. Highly recommended professor!

She is a VERY good teacher. Really good at explaining how to do problems, and homeworks were a good practice for the exams. Her exams were fairly easy, except for the final. Homeworks were often slightly hard but the exams were never as hard as the homeworks. Very helpful in office hours as well.

Such a refreshing professor who always walks into class with a smile. She is extremely friendly and dedicated to teaching and helping you understand the material. She is phenomenal at explaining the subject matter clearly! You have to work for your grade, though.

Not as easy as she says, its a grad level course and for an undergrad like me, it was a lot of work. The course is 50% home work and 2 mid terms of 50%. It is tough, get ready to do some real work and learn the material, finite element using ANSYS is gonna do lot of help in future, so take it
Show up to lecture and you are sure to do well. Very helpful in office hours as well. She will do what she can to help you.
Very clear in class when teaching as to what you need to know. Nice, friendly, and always in a good mood
She's a wonderful professor. Very friendly, tries to make things understand physically rather than just mathematically, great communication skills and beautiful :-). Highly recommended!
She is the best.
She is very nice but not always the best teacher.  She is tough when it comes to assigning grades at the end of the quarter.

Overall a very good professor. Makes class as simple as possible. Lectures wouldn't be so bad if they weren't at 7:30 a.m. in the morning! Tests are fair, same stuff straight out from the book and homework. Very nice and helpful during office hours. Highly recommended!

Each student paid ≈$90 for the software we use in class. 200 students * $90 is $18000 per class. She taught 3 classes, meaning this semester alone, she made ≈$54,000 off of her students. She is truly an inspiration to me, as I now wish to become a professor for a required class so that I too can make a ton of money off of my students.

Sandy is funny, passionate, and easy to understand. Although the course content is fairly simple, I would definitely recommend attending classes and paying attention somewhat to the textbook. She provides ample examples in class and the homeworks are just like the exams which are on excel.

Very helpful, wants to make sure you understand. Never makes you feel dumb for asking a question. Exams were fair and lined up with the HW / in-class activities. She had required textbook reading assignments, and they were tedious and annoying, they barely lined up with the lecture content. The textbook and lecture felt like two different classes.

Dr. Furterer was an excellent professor. She always wanted to help you learn and was easily available outside of class. The material is incredibly easy. The exams were open-note and like the homework. The homework is simple and you have many attempts. Good class with a lot in it! Don't skip, though, even if it's boring, you'll regret it.

Her lectures were great. I went the whole semester without opening the book because she explained everything so good that I didn't need to. The exams are in person and open book/notes AND you can ask questions to her or the TA and they will guide you through the problem. Overall amazing professor!
Looks like a pencil

Terrible teacher that has no mercy at all , Won't accept late hw / homework that ain't latex form , He will deadass give you a Zero on homework instead of taking partial credit off, That is just inhumane.Harsh grader , Who does not  care about students grade.

He is a very passionate lecturer. But, the course was taught from a very math oriented pov and I think I still do not know anything about course even though I got an A. There is no broader sense given to why we are maniopulating a bunch of matrices and what we want to achieve. Definitely not useful froma ny actual practical learning

Serrani's lectures are great and he is a very nice person. Besides being an expert, he was always very enthusiastic, which is very important in a theoretical class like this. His class was challenging, but he teaches all you need to understand and do well in the exams. Do not expect a lot of numerical examples.
Passionate teacher, well-prepared lectures.

Serrani is an amazing teacher.  The best teacher I have had in OSU.  Even though his classes are though, you leave learning a lot.  Also, take advantage of the office hours, he will not judge you and he is very helpful.

He is feeling it! The way he is teaching the famous "change of basis" topic is awesome :) He is a real gentleman and a wise man. You may see Serrani at one of the floors of SEL while he is taking a book from the shelves any time. He has a big heart; even you perform an act that is disrespectful, he forgets it. He remembers good things :)
Nice style of teaching. Gets involved but the assignments are really tough.

Serrani is a great lecturer.  If you're anything like me, half the battle in class is keeping your focus on the words being said.  Serrani will draw you in.  It's true that he was challenging, but this is acceptable when the teacher gives you all the knowledge needed to perform well.
Awesome Prof. Exciting lectures, clear presentation, and sets you up to tackle his challenges. If you want to learn, take his class. If you want to float, don't.

Serrani is the kind of teacher that pulls you into learning with his enthusiasm.  He has a loud and audible voice that constantly has your attention.  His 551 was organized and paced very well.  His assignments were very fair in length and difficulty.  The tests were based off of homeworks directly and weren't that bad.

Dr Serrani did a much better job in 315/52 last year, but he is still one of my favorite instructors. He is extremely challenging, and exams are very hard, but you get a good grade if you are willing to work hard. I just wished he used the blackboard instead of PowerPoint presentations. He is a very cool person.

Dr. Serrani is a true expert in his field. He knows his stuff really well and he'll answer any question you ask him without difficulty. He is by no means easy and truly challenges you. If you follow his lectures and do the homeworks you will really learn. But if you just want to sit on your ass and do no work, then look elsewhere.

I took 351/2 with Dr. Serrani. He may not be the easiest instructor on campus, but he is certainly the instructor you want to take when you can take him. He has a great sense of humor, extremely helpful during office hours, knowledgeable, and replies emails quickly. He has a great job spirit. He is absolutely the most pleasant instructor I had.

One of the few instructors who thinks it’s better to give students confidence rather than breaking them down. He is challenging, yet rational, reasonable, kind, fun, knowledgeable, and down to earth. Office hours are wonderful! He is a big fan of soccer, so u better love Juventus; otherwise he will kick u out of his office. hates Ac, Inter & Fioren

Dr. Serrani works hard to give students an intuitive understanding of the material.  He doesn't bore you with endless proofs but rather illustrates the principles with mech or elec examples.  He is very helpful during office hours as well.  My only complaint is that there is still a leap of understanding between lecture and homework problems.
He has been the lecturer of ECE2050 for 30 years. Once you follow with him all the lectures, notes, and homework a you will know why OSU didn't change him.

Has a policy in the syllabus stating that he can fail students at will even if they would have passed the class based on the numerical values that he has expressed on the syllabus and on each individual assignment.

Prof. Bradley Clymer is highly knowledgeable and arguably the best for introducing signals and systems. His teaching style might be challenging for some students, so be prepared to adapt. The material starts easy but becomes harder. Weekly homework assignments can be long and occasionally confusing, which I found particularly difficult.

This was my favorite class I've taken before.  Prof. Clymer was always very enthusiastic and also went over the material in a way that made it much easier to understand.  If you go to office hours and make an effort to get to know him, he will also try to get to know you.

One of the best professors at OSU. He cares about his students and makes a huge effort to communicate the material in a way that you will understand. Office hours were underutilized in my section but super helpful for the projects (they are long, start early!) I learned so much in this class and got to see many aspects of 5200 applied practically.

Very nice and passionate prof who is very helpful in office hours. Lectures were fast paced and I honestly didn't understand them until reviewing them. Gives good partial credit and gives great practice exams to review. He made a hard topic easier and you can do well if you take advantage of office hours and practice exams.

Very dry, old school style lectures. He focuses almost entirely on the procedural part of the problems so it feels like a math methods class. He will often show shortcuts that doesn't make sense to us yet. I felt because there was such little grounding, this style left me forgetting most of what he did shortly after but it's ok if you like signals

His lectures are very dry as he only goes over theoretical examples and never actually does example problems. He gives some other papers he has written as background info but it's hard to apply to what he is actually teaching. It's impossible to finish his tests on time, his lectures are just random info here and there. He can't teach well.

Prof Clymer is a great professor who is genuine when it comes to teaching. He is very helpful in his office hours, and takes time to make sure you truly understand what is going on in each problem. He also posts practice exams/previous exams for each midterm/final in the class, which makes preparing for tests much less painful than most classes.

I found it hard to rate him. He is EXTREMELY knowledgeable and smart, but I found it hard to learn from him. His lectures are done on-screen on a legal note pad and were sometimes hard to comprehend. He also writes really fast. He is super helpful and will give you as much help as you are willing to seek.
Dr. Clymer is a respectable professor, making the class educational but not too easy, all with some smoke and mirrors.

Awesome professor, been teaching this class for a long time so is very good at teaching it.
I ended up not going to lectures because his notes he uploads after class are so good. Lots of homework to help you master the material and prepare you well for exams. He also uploads multiple practice exams that are 100% practicing.

Amazing professor. Understands the material well and very good at conveying the right information. The homework is very straightforward and reinforces the things you learn in lecture. The problem sets and practice exams were extremely helpful for figuring out the material. His handwriting is very clear and he is very accessible outside class.

Dr. Clymer is the sweetest professor ever. He provides so many resources like video lectures, homework help videos, and practice exams with answers. You always know exactly what you'll be tested on. I wasn't a big fan of signals/systems, but Dr. Clymer was so passionate and positive that I enjoyed going to lecture and learning.

Professor Clymer is very organized with his notes, as well as with his Carmen page. He has all the lecture notes, lecture videos, homework assignments, and other relevant material easily accessible. The only critique I have is the homework is usually very difficult unless you watch the corresponding problem session video.

Bradley needs to give every other professor a lesson on how to organize course content and a Carmen page. Everything you need is perfectly organized on Carmen: video lectures, lecture notes, homeworks, exam prep, everything. Clymer can be dull during lecture but is so organized that the material is understandable. Super helpful in office hours.
He's OK, his lectures are boring. The in-class examples are ridiculously drawn out for no reason. It's hard to make Signals interesting though.

Not only is he a great instructor (that puts his lectures online so you can re-watch them) he is very lenient with his grading so you wont get punished massively for an algebra mistake. Just listen to him carefully, do the homework, and practice for the exams and this class will be a guaranteed A with him

It was such a rewarding experience to have him as a professor: Well-organized and dedicated professors who dies for success of students. His guidance through the lectures + projects, as well as career advice and mental support, mean a lot to me. He is one of the reasons why I am going to do PhD in Signal Processing & Medical Imaging.

Probably one of the most organized courses I have taken. All lectures are posted online via PDF and video. While the homeworks may be challenging, he posts practice videos of homework problems that are pretty helpful. In addition, he provides practice exams for each exam, which gives you a good idea of the difficulty of the exam.
Highly recommend

Professor Clymer is one of the best professors in the ECE department. He genuinely cares about his students understanding the material. Gives tons of partial credit on assignments. The only downside is you don't really have to learn the material for the homework because he does problem sessions showing you how to do problems similar to the homework

Dr. Clymer is one of the most caring professors I have had to date. He was both enthusiastic about the subject and in helping students to actually learn and understand the material. With both lecture videos and notes posted online the class was very easy to study for, even if it wasn't always easy subject matter.

Okay, he appears intimidating, but is a nice guy. There are some bad things about him. He doesn't provide all the information that is needed to complete the homework until the day before it's due. He writes unnecessarily with a sharpie, making his notes hard to read. Basically, homework is a nightmare because of his poor-teaching styles.

his notes are very straight forward and he also has a weekly problem session that focuses the hw. His midterms are just like the practice that he puts online  and the final, even though was harder, was fair and you can still do well on it if you study. he also lets you have a page of notes for each midterm and final. overall great teacher!

Dr. Clymer was very organized and clear about his expectations for the class.  He took the time to design the homework and exams to be thought-provoking and useful instead of just as busy work for grades.  He is a fair grader and cares about his students understanding of the material. He has been one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State.
Took his online lecture but sometimes I show up in his physical lecture. A great and friendly professor and really understands what he teach. The homeworks are challenging but doable.

Pretty easy class. Make sure you watch all the videos. Homeworks are not bad, fun to me for the first half. After topics switched I was lost and his examples became less like the homeworks. I didn't do so well after the switch, so be prepared (ask him for more concrete examples worded like the homework). Overall, my best class this semester.

He's very clear and loves what he's teaching. Still takes a lot of motivation to watch videos, so be careful about online-only. Near the end of the semester, the topic flips to some hard stuff, and more concrete example problems would have helped, but if you go over it carefully enough, you can work it out when the homework comes.
Took his online lecture. Videos are long and require discipline, but very helpful and clear. Labs can be challenging but tests are fair and recitations was helpful.

The HW is annoying to do since you have to go through all of his videos. My recitation was not much help since it was on a Monday and the HW was collected on Fridays so he had not gone over the material yet. Labs are challenging but doable and the exams are identical to previous years. Overall a pretty easy class.
Online course is doable if you are disciplined enough to watch the videos you will be fine.  Great guy, very passionate about what he does.
Dr. Clymer is a really down to earth guy who provides great lectures. Homeworks/labs are reasonable, and exams aren't bad if you have been following the class. Great professor!
Explains material well. Easy midterms and final. Homework could be challenging at times but mostly easy to do.

First 2/3 of the course was very easy to understand. Last 1/3 (beginning signal processing) was significantly more difficult, so needed to study more for that (and final was not comprehensive). Helpful during office hours, though!

One of the more clear professors in ECE. His teaching style is very systematic. If you learn the methods he teaches for 2000/2100 you will do well in his courses. Office hours are amazingly helpful as well.
Do not take ECE 5206 unless you enjoy suffering. Clymer is a nice guy but this class is just awful.
The professor is soooo nice!!!But the projects are annoying, and he is strict on the reports.
Excellent instructor. If you can get him for the ECE 2000/2100 series, take it with him. Just an overall excellent professor, clearly very dedicated to teaching.

Professor Clymer is the man. Had him for 323 last quarter and he was great so I took this class specifically because he was teaching it. He explains everything so clearly and his assignments are cleverly designed to squeeze the most learning out of you per amount of work you put in. Super helpful if you struggle at all. Couldn't recommend him more.

This man has a lot of love for his field and it shows. His enthusiasm is contagious. The course is set up in a fantastic way as well, with recorded lectures and thought-provoking group projects in the place of mindless exercises.
I love Bradley Clymer !!! He is such an awesome guy -- teaches very well, has patience with students and he really cares about his stuff !!! Top notch !!! Strongly recommended to take the class !!!

This professor is by far the best professor in ECE. Even though I had nothing to do with Medical imaging I still took the course and learnt more than I imagined. This professor really helps you learn, he is so enthusiastic about teaching.

This professor is really helpful and obviously really knows his stuff; however, sometimes he covered too much in lecture and it was quite confusing for non-ECE students.  He provided lecture notes and videos of lectures online, which were convenient, but the most helpful thing in getting through this class was the TA.
Excellent professor.  I went into this class thinking it was going to be terrible, but he was extremely helpful.  One of the best professors I've had at OSU.
TAKE THIS CLASS!  Professor Clymer makes a fascinating topic truly accessible to undergrad/grad students.  Willing to help every step along the way.

I really enjoyed Professor Clymer's class.  He video tapes all of his lectures and puts them on carmen along with the PDF files of his notes.  His exams are extremely fair and his homework makes you think.  He is very excited to teach his subject matter and will do anything to help you learn.  This instructor is very thorough and highly recommended
One of the best professors in ECE.  Challenges you but gives you enough info to get to the solution.  Very helpful in office hours.
Dr. Clymer is very helpful in office hours or anytime and is very understanding of his students.  The homework can be long but is very helpful for exams

Clymer is one of the best. Unlike most of the ECE faculties, he is there to teach you, help you, and answer your questions. Responds to emails very quickly, and gives very clear lectures. He doesn't bombard you with 1000s of theories and equations. Instead, he teaches you what you really need in real world. Very fair instructor.

Clymer is extremely fair and helpful. He encourages questions and is always happy to see students come to office hours. He records his lectures and uploads them to Carmen so you can review the material again later. You want Clymer as a professor.

Great prof. He's the kind of prof, whose material will stick in your head for a long time. Brilliantly planned questions that provokes thought. The best part is his assignments are real world problems. And always ready to give hints. If you are new to the subject you really have to earn the grade, so don't expect to get much sleep.
Very kind person and willing to help.

The best professor ever. Almost everything is available online. You can watch the lecture online because he taped it. The notes are online too. Exams are pretty easy although the homeworks are a little tedious. He cares a lot about his students, he is a man with a big heart

The rare professor who thinks it's more important to give students confidence to tackle difficult problems, rather than breaking them down.  Amazing how this approach motivates you to do assignments and practice for exams, rather than dread the work and just toil to get it over with.  The good cop to the bad cops of the department.

like all the previous feedbacks i would say he is one of the best ece profs. do not miss a class with prof clymer. you will learn alot if you are willing to ask questions and he would explain you stuff time and over again till you dont understand it.he is a ridiculously nice man at heart.
One of the best teachers in the ECE department.  Hated the subject of the class but ended up enjoying the class anyway.  Exams are pretty easy and he explains the material very well.

He isn't the kind of prof to treat students with disdain. If you don't understand the fundamentals, he'll explain them to you, not brush you off. His homework is challenging but he'll give you hints, and group work makes them pretty fair. Great prof overall.
He is very helpful and 'cares' about the students quite a bit.  The exams are fair, and he keeps lecture somewhat interesting.  You gotta respect his bow-tie too.
This guy is great. He puts movies of all the lectures on the internet, so you never have to come to class. His exams are very reasonable, and he really seems like he cares about you.
Great prof & class.  Learn a lot, espcailly applications.  Class consists of all projects and no tests, and is worthwhile.  Very knowledge about about the subject.
He is the best teacher I have ever had.  I was not interested in the material at all, but his examples were very intriguing.  I learned more in this class than any other engineering class.
So cute!

Clymer is one of the best, if not the best in the department.  He's fun, appropriately difficult and challenging and you learn a lot.  He's one of those profs where you can tell he's been in industry in the past.  You learn theory and how it's really used
Nicest guy in Department
Love the bow-tie

Love Dr. H. Super friendly guy who clearly cares about students and their progress. Great course and lectures as well. Ohio State FEH classes are brutal but the instruction is top notch and Dr. H. is no exception. Be prepared to do a *lot* of hands-on assignments ("apps") which are not easy (better than FEH 1 though) and group work during class.

Dr. H was a great prof. Class had a lot of work, especially with the lab reports, so start early. He was a very caring and nice instructor, and had great knowledge of MATLAB and C. Overall, great prof.

I loved Dr. H, he genuinely cared about his students and all of the office hours available outside of class were extremely helpful. As a student who had never coded before, he made everything a very seamless progression, and everything was easy to understand and follow with the practice problems and homework. Highly recommend!
Probably one of the best professors I've had! Though it was his first time teaching, he knew the material well and kept the class engaged.

Professor El Hamahmy is amazing! Nne of my favorite professors, and genuinely cares about his students. Lectures are chill, you MATLAB, C/C++ as well as engineering fundamentals. There is a coding project instead of final. Weekly assignments, from lectures and from labs, lecture assignments are doable, but lab assignments take up the most time.

Dr. Hamahmy, better known as Dr. H has by far been the best professor I've had in college so far. He makes an effort to get to know every single one of his students of they let him. Another great thing is that he's always accessible for you to ask questions so his assignments aren't impossible if you make the effort to ask questions.

Maybe the best teacher I have ever had. A great personality along with a good understanding of MATLAB and how to teach it. The course uses a fair amount of things learned in ENG1181. It is very important that you work though homework and practice problems, because if you fall behind, you fall fast. Stay in contact with / see him outside of class.

The lab segment of this class was brutal, but the lectures (the part Dr. Kramer was responsible for) were great. She gets everyone involved, gives great feedback, and both her and her TAs are highly available in and out of class and happy to help students. I actually enjoyed the software design project at the end of the class. Highly recommend.

Dr Kramer is great. Incredibly caring and very knowledgeable. Class itself is hard and that will be consistent for all sections, but Dr Kramer knows the course very well which was incredibly helpful. If you get the chance, I would highly recommend! Couldn't get a nicer, more genuine professor at OSU
She's so kind and really helpful to her students.

Professor Kramer is great. Class itself is pretty easy, although the lab component can be brutal sometimes. Good lecturer, genuinely cares about the students and is willing to help, and lots of hands-on projects and "application" assignments. No textbook required (but if taking Honors, a MATLAB textbook is recommended for the programming sections).
Really nice professor, understandable, and flexible with deadlines if you ask. Also can really be helpful for additional projects if needed.

Amazing professor, deeply motivated and wanted students to make sure they understood the content. He made lecture's extremely easy to understand the material and very helpful in office hours if you needed more help. Quizzes were extremely specific regarding content but manageable. Take his class if you can.

Chris is legit the best. It was an honor to have him as my lecturer, and he is the main reason I am pursuing a humanitarian engineering minor. I would give almost anything to have him as a prof again!!

Dr. Ratcliff is awesome. He truly cares about his students and although 1181 is just a ton of busywork he makes the work a lot more bearable. He is always willing to help on projects and makes an effort to take an interest in his students. Truly a goat professor!
Professor Ratcliff was an amazing professor and cared about his students. Directions and outlines are clear for grading.
Dr. Ratcliff is a great engineering professor. His 1182 class is much more fun and interesting than 1181. He is very helpful and a good professor to make connections with.

Dr. Ratcliff shows applications of engineering and make sure we understand not only the technical part of engineering, but also the ethical side of it. I haven't had anyone explain engineering to me in that way and I will apply his ideas in my career. He understand circumstances with deadlines and is my most approchable professor.

Dr.Ratcliff is a really good instructor for the FE courses. He cares about his students deeply, yet will get you prepared so you can do well on the assignments and tests. TA's do usually matter a bunch in making this course tolerable but Dr.Ratcliff is very good at making sure the TA's are doing their job. Very likeable guy too. Take him if u can!

If you have to take 1181, do it with Dr. Ratcliff. Absolutely amazing professor, despite some things he's unable to change about the course itself. He's a great guy and he understands that this is too much for 2 credit hours,  so he's very understanding in how he gives extensions. Talk to him after class if you can, he's a great conversationalist.

Dr. Ratcliff was definitely one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. He always had personal stories that related to the material he was teaching us and he genuinely cared about helping every group excel with their engineering design process. I think the the class 1182 could be changed some to be less paper heavy but I enjoyed having him.

Great teacher. I had no coding experience and he taught it well. Make sure to participate in the class. He gave many extensions, and a lot of good advice. Honestly, he made me realize engineering was the right choice for me. Hands down amazing teacher and human being.

Very nice, respectful, and accommodating guy. Some of the assignments are rather difficult but with a group they're manageable (as long as your group is competent). I had a particularly nice group (though it was only 3 people) and we managed to do pretty well. Easily one of my favorite professors at OSU.

Dr. Ratclidd was a great professor and cares about his students. Beware this class is a weed-out. It's a lot of work and frustrating depending on the group you get. It is doable if you are willing to do the work your group slacks on. Definitely do not save work till the last minute or you won't do well. The class taught great engr skills though.

The class is tough and there is a lot of work, because it is a weed out course. There is a lot of group assignments and class applications that take a long time. But Professor Ratcliff is a great professor and is very understanding of delays and issues that occur. He is great at teaching the material and I would highly recommend taking his course.
He was great, the class went smoothly.

The best teacher Ive ever had. Hes such a great guy and he really cares about his students and their success. Although the content of his class is somewhat boring, he does all he can to make it interesting. His experiences outside the classroom involving engineering are invigorating and youll get to learn all about it.

Dr. Ratcliff was a great professor overall. Sometimes the lectures could drag, but that has to do with the content more than the professor himself. He is very easy to approach and ask questions, and continues to be a great resource. There was quite a bit of out of class work, but nothing unmanageable. He gives lots of time to do the work in class.

Prof. Ratcliff is a great professor stuck with a dull course. However, he really tries to engage with the class and encourages us to pursue engineering. I really enjoyed hearing about his experiences in the field. Also, he's always down to help you if you need it or explain things better.

Out of all your options hes the only one that can teach the class well. Hes super flexible about assignments, stressors, and just your life in general. That said this class is still busy work but he makes it doable. All you have to do is hope you have a good group and good TAs and you should be good for this class. Definitely would take him again

This class is difficult by inheritance, from the department, but you gotta take him as a professor. Literally the only guy that can actually teach this class and actually care for the students. Very flexible with assignments and understanding of everyone's circumstances. Clarifies any holes he finds with assignment instructions.
Super flexible and understanding professor. Very clear about what he expects of us in projects and assignments and all his lessons are easy to understand. All my classmates love him.
Chris is a fantastic professor. Fundamentals of Engineering is a difficult class and Chris knows that and does a great job preparing the class.
Mr. Ratcliff is understanding and caring, highly recommended to take his class. Hes not too harsh on grading too.

He is super nice and cares about students' learning process. He always provides a bunch of examples to make students fully understand each concepts during class. It is extremely valuable to take his class.

The class is annoying and requires a lot of effort. The class is department run and he apologizes for how much homework is given by the department. He extends due dates for assignments and is accessible outside of class
He is awesome. He cares a lot about you and does everything he can to make sure you do well. He understands you have a life and he is very passionate. As for 1181 just hope you have a good group.

Prof. Ratclif is a really nice dude. He shows up to class ready to teach and never forgets to address any questions people have. He talks about his interests a lot (farming and solar panels). Really great professor.
He is just so nice. The grade is always satisfying though labs are kind of stressful. And there are some easy extra credits. Definitely should take his class.
Lecture is great with Dr. Ratcliff. Attendance is not mandatory for lecture but you will miss a lot if you don't go. Attendance for lab is mandatory, but lecture is more important than lab.

Overall, awesome teacher/mentor. He knows so much about everything (from farming to engineering) and is very passionate in all that he does. He is very empathetic towards students and considers your workload/stress level. 100/10 would recommend.
Super understanding guy Really tries to make the course as not stressful as possible

Engineering 1151 is a very annoying class with an insane amount of work for a 2 hour course, but Ratcliff is a fantastic professor. He routinely apologized for how much work was assigned (he doesn't have a say in it). He extends deadlines, gives extra credit, grades assignments quick, helps students, and is just a very nice guy in general.

1181 is a lot of work, but Ratcliff is definitely a good choice and a good guy. He often extended deadlines, posted review videos, and was very knowledgeable. He is very helpful in and out of class and wants students to succeed. Midterms were graded very quickly. Overall I enjoyed his class.
He is super cool and I havnt tried in his class AT ALL all semester and I'm ending the class with a B without studying at all.

Really awesome professor, he really wants to help students and give great techniques to you. For the application details, he can demonstrate extremely clearly and reasonable. And your grade for application and lab report are all based on the TAs and your lab-professor, so you can not say that's his mistake.

Dr. Ratcliff actually cares about his students unlike some other professors. He took the time to learn our names, and would actually say hi to me in the hallways. He was very reasonable when it came to grades, helping out students where he could. If you have a chance to take his class or even just talk to him you will be glad that you did.

The 1181 curriculum is the same no matter which professor you get, but Dr. Ratcliff is a great choice. He was very passionate about engineering, and he had a particularly good instructional team. His lecture was via PowerPoint. Also, he was easy to contact via email. He had our midterms and final graded pretty quickly as well.
she‘s good

Genuinely cares about the students if you express effort in the class, the amount of work in the class is definitely on the higher side especially for a 2 credit hour class but get used to it, your going into engineering.

The lectures were sometimes hard to follow because of how fast she went, especially the lectures on MatLab. I feel she could've given instructions on certain assignments way better. She talked to the class like we were middle schoolers which was the most annoying part of the class. Overall, I've heard of better professors for this class.

Doesn't read student work. Nor provide thoughtful feedback. Relies upon flowchart-like, pre-programmed responses. Her focus on her career leaves little care for students, promoting exclusion over inclusion. Consistently tardy and full of excuses, she holds students to standards she fails to meet herself. Impersonal style; undervalues students.

Dr. Thomas is a good lecture and has a good concept of what she is teaching. Was always helpful when struggling with items in class and was understanding and cooperative with situations that were less than ideal. 1181 is a course loaded with busy work and attendance is mandatory by GPS but overall not a bad class. Just do the work you will succeed.
Great professors, Only one thing is you have to go to class, the check in is mandatory and with GPS, so you have to go to class room.
Has improved in teaching overtime

The class is pretty group project heavy, but she's very open and is willing to meet whenever possible. I'm not a very good coder in MATLAB but she made everything so easy and open that I was able to ace the exam with ease. 10/10!
Amazing, best professor I've had so far

Very fair and understanding professor. Course was boring but she attempted to make it entertaining and engaging. Have had for a few courses so far and couldn't recommend more. Grading isn't too harsh, and rubrics detail exactly how TAs will grade.

It's not Dr. Thomas's fault that the Fundamentals of Engineering sequence is so... well... not great. There is more work in this course than you'd expect for a two credit hour course, but I think that Dr. Thomas tries her best to make the dry lectures slides a little more interesting and gives fair feedback and help on projects if you ask.

I got lucky with a good group and amazing TA's. Prof. Thomas loves a little comedic relief, and she enjoys solving problems in MATLAB. She reads from the slides during lectures and most of her instructions are vague. Attending her Zoom office hours when learning MATLAB really benefitted me.
She was nice and entertaining. Class is an easy A.

Super energetic, loves to explain (and complain) about MATLAB. Works through all HW and assignments in her own time, so gives super helpful advice if only you ask questions. Lectures pretty quickly, but she makes things pretty easy to understand.
Epic swqag w amazing yuh skrrt teacher if i have to be frank. EE OO EE OO EE OO EE OO pulling out the preoffesor DSWAGGGG
She's a good professor who is trying as much as she can to work with students and help them succeed.

Jessica is very passionate about engineering and teaching students! She always made an effort to make class more interesting and keep students engaged. 1182 is a relatively easy class if you enjoy autocad, but be aware that you will be working on the final exam (group project) for the whole semester.

ENGR1182 is not a fun course, but I'll say Dr. Thomas did the absolute best she could with it. She was always prepared for class and kept it organized so the student knew what needed to be done before each class. She was always avaliable to answer questions and made sure her TAs were avaliable to help us as well. She did a great job in this course.
Professor Thomas does a good job of being available for clarification on assignments. Tries to make the class as interesting as possible and relate it to real-world experiences.

Do not understand why the reviews are bad. She was SO NICE and literally told you exactly what you needed to do to get an A and helped out with every assignment. I guess if your group is bad it might be hard, but don't blame it on her, blame your group.
Super nice professor. Very available and organized. Even went out of her way to help me with an interview project for another class. Highly recommend.

To be honest 1181 was a lot of busy work. Its an easy A though if you put the effort in. Professor Thomas is a pretty good lecturer and is readily available. Its a ridiculous workload for a 2 hour class. I think most of the bad reviews are from people unwilling to work to get an A. Guaranteed A if you have a semi-competent group and a work ethic.

Not sure why her ratings are so low. She was a fine professor, always willing to answer questions in detail and available outside of class. The department just has this class set up awfully, unclear assignments, odd layouts, etc. etc. Not her fault though.

Professor Thomas is a good professor, not sure why her ratings are so low. Shes helpful and easy to contact if you need something. Beware of ENGR1181 though, its extremely group heavy and so much homework. If you get a bad group you will be screwed! Blame the department for how the class is set up, professor Thomas is doing the best she can

Professor Thomas is a good professor. She is always willing to help if you have questions and she is funny. A lot of her negative reviews probably come from the fact that engr1181 is just a terribly designed class by the department. the instructions are useless, there is a ridiculous amount of homework, but that is not up to her! She tries her best

She basically just rushes through everything to get out the door. She can answer questions sometimes if you ask them but she doesn't really set you up for success. The TAs are about as lost as any student is. There's no references to anything they ask for, they're unhelpful when they're asked and then they wonder why students go to Chegg.

Showed up at least 15 minutes late to almost every class. Did not communicate what we actually needed to do for the class. The TA's were just as out of the loop as students were. Was very short with all of her students.

Awful experience! Takes forever to respond to emails, has undergrad TAs that literally have no clue whats going on, and get this, when I went to ask her what an assignment was cause her slides gave no info and she said nothing about it, she also had no clue. Sent an announcement out to clarify it at the very last minute. Avoid her I certainly will
Probably the worst professor I ever had. Clearly could care less about students and just about her research at the university. Definitely made life during COVID much harder than it already is.

Horrible class but an even worse professor. Literally can tell she shows no interest in actually teaching and puts no effort into making class organized. You basically have to be lucky with good TA's and groupmates to do well in this class.

Really don't like how she handled the class. Reads straight from the slides and provides no context on how to complete assignments and then is very unflexible with grading. You are definitely screwed if you get a bad group. TAs are honestly just as clueless about what's going on as you. Anyways, good luck having any fun in this class.

I highly enjoyed my class with her! I took fundamentals of engineering II with her and I wish I had her for the first course. Her lectures are engaging and through. She is always reachable on email and willing to help out whenever you need it! Great class, loved her.

She puts in minimal effort and reads off the slides. She does not care about the students' grades. Her jokes gave me headaches and consistently ruined my day. She is basically an annoying 6th grade nerd, but that applies to half of the students. You'll be screwed with bad groupmates and unclear rubrics. She is extremely disorganized.

She reads off of slides so you have no idea what you are doing. You try to get help from the TA's and they all have different answers. Don't expect to see a grade come back at a normal time. At the end of the semester I turned in my final project and still had stuff from 2 months ago ungraded. Would not recommend.

The lectures were disconnected from the class assignments and on top of that class was so disorganized to the point where she just snuck in assignments without even explaining what they were. She's also honestly just as clueless about whats going on in the class as you since it is department runned. Take Ratcliff if you can Much better option!

The rubrics and instructions are incredibly unhelpful and the UTAs find a way to take off points for no reason. She makes terrible jokes and reads off of slides. It's like having a 7th grade unfunny C student teach a class. The class is made poorly and you are so screwed if you get a bad group. I am so stressed.

I like Dr. Thomas as a person and shes very personable, but overall the class was pretty bad. Im not sure if the class is just put together poorly or if its the way Dr. Thomas teaches it. Also, she isnt very accessible outside of class (online class).

Instructions on projects are unclear and everything feels disorganized and stressful in class, although not all her fault. She is pretty nice and helpful when you ask questions individually, but I definitely should have chosen a different section with a different professor if I had to do this over again.

Never showed up on time (was always 10+ minutes late). The only day she was on time was after we had a mid-semester review of her and the class TA's where everyone, I'm sure, commented on her frequent tardiness. She was helpful outside of class over email though and is very nice. If I am showing up on time though, so should she. No Exceptions
Not terrible, but I definitely would have taken the other guy if I could do this class over again!

The class was poorly structured which wasn't Dr. Thomas's fault. She showed up late to class almost every day and her lectures consisted of reading off slides created by the department. She was helpful in office hours but class always felt like a waste of time. She's not that bad but if I could do it over again I would've gone with a different prof

She is late by 5-20 minutes every class. This is a group based class, so we had even less time to work on our projects. She does not give clear instructions, and her lectures consist of reading PowerPoints created by the department.

It's unfortunate to see Dr.Sommerich with such low ratings. She's a wonderful person and learning from her is a prilvedge. Still, I think she needs to reevaluate the structure of her course. The exams were a bit confusing, and expectations aren't clear. Getting an A- and having a 94 is not great. Put in the effort and you'll do ok..

Agree with everything previously mentioned- lectures are very boring and slow. Overall grades are hidden all semester and you don't know what you're ending with until it's put in, furthermore an A starts at a 95%. Exams are difficult but doable.

I wanted to ignore the reviews of people bashing Dr.Sommerich. However, her grading scale is just terrible. You don't know your grade throughout the whole semester and the cut-off "+" grades at high precentages. Having a 94% but still ending at an A- really sucked. Her lectures are dry and questions on exams are confusing. Nice lady, bad class.

Horrible instructor, hidden grades with no opportunities to clarify rubrics that don't exist. Will not change grade seven if there was a mistake. Has open door office hours, but is never there. Sets her grading scale so harshly its unfair that an A is at least 95%, an A- is anything less than that. Does not give ample time for readings/assignments.

Terrible instructor, does not provide clear grading criteria and changes the rubric after the assignment was due. Will not explain why she takes off 0.39 of a point when asked and refuses to give back points when grading rubric was unclear/non-existent. Won't post grades, you never know where you stand in the class and gives about 2 days to do hw.

Overall grades hidden entire semester. Doesn't give exams back you have to go to office hours to see them, but you can't keep it. Grades pretty tough. Most boring lectures on planet earth (which is sad because the material has a chance to be interesting). Midterms were wordy. Seems like a nice lady, but she shouldn't be a professor... like at all.

I've taken about 30 classes so far at OSU, this one definitely put me to sleep the most. Dry material and a soft spoken lecturer makes a terrible combination. Tons of busy work, sporadic assignments, weird grading system, and everything in Carmen is out of 0 so idk what grade I have. Line up your schedule to take this class with the other professor
find someone else with personality disorder
Avoid her class if you can.

I've had her for 3 classes.  She can be really nice when she wants to, and then not so much other times.  BIG BIG BIG fan of "busy work", loves chapter summaries! Only class where I've gotten a 82.64 on a quiz.  Odd grading policies, but still manageable.  Kinda stuck taking some classes with her, just suck it up, cuz its gunna suck.

Hated the class. The material was easy the teacher was awful. Her tests had poor structure to them and required too much reading.  The first few weeks of class were useless. All the material is common sense.  She is not very friendly.

She sucks; a low talker, speaks too slow, puts the students to sleep all the time, has a horrible grading policy, is a very closed minded and stubborn individual. If you do poorly in a test, think that she graded not fairly, or even she miss interpreted what you wrote, than good luck talking her into changing anything. I would avoid her if I can
She grades hard, their is just 100 points in the class. You have to do 2 hours of reading and turn in a write up for 0.5 of a point!!!! I did not like this class.
stressful ! used to a an easy class but not anymore !

The classes is extremely dense with topics but he does a good job explaining them in a slow and easy enough manner.  The exams were graded harshly with a poor grading distribution. There were MCQ's worth about 3-4% of the paper, and a lot of open ended questions were based on topics that were a brief mention in class.

Dr. Subramoni wants his students to succeed but struggles with grading. Exam averages were 70s with no curve on the final grade, and homework is not leniently graded either. His "open door" office hours make scheduling difficult, and he's often unresponsive to emails. Meeting outside of class to get help can be nearly impossible.

Professor Subramoni is a nice guy. He's smart and obviously is well versed in OS, but he does just an OK job of teaching it. He relies heavily on the slides and his examples often cause more confusion. The homework and labs were reasonable and fair. Exams were graded harshly and mostly free response. I lost 3% of my final grade on a T/F question.
He definitely cared about his students and what he was teaching, but wasn't the best at conveying the topics.

Prof. Subramoni is a great lecturer and I really enjoyed his class. He didn't assign my section much homework (only 4 homework assignments and 1 lab) which was really nice. Although this can come to hurt you if you aren't prepared for his exams. The lecture material is quite dense but he does a good job of slowing down the pace of lectures.
Paul cares about all of his student's learning and teaches in a fun and engaging way.

"A pointer
is a variable
that has as its value
the address
of another variable."
Great at teaching and super funny too. He made a difficult class the most fun one I've taken. Textbooks were offered, but I never bothered to read them since the same material was covered in class anyway.
Amazing guy. Genuinely funny and cares about the students.

Best instructor for this course; you'll definitely get an A if you submit all the work and it's done competently, but you'll have to pour in tons of hours outside of class to finish the assignments in the first place.

GOAT. Amazing lectures, super caring, funny, and understanding professor. Make sure you go to class, if you Fundamentals of Engineering is a hard set of courses, honors or not, so be prepared to do a LOT of homework. His lectures helped me a lot with understanding how to do homework. Very nice guy
goat
Good teacher, tells jokes during lectures to keep it entertaining

My only gripe with Professor Clingan was how hard it could be to hear him at time in the class especially if you sat further in the back. Overall, he was a wonderful teacher, note that the readings and paying attention in class are extremely beneficial especially if you have no background in computer languages.

Very fun lectures and labs, however, this is a LOT of work for a 2 credit hour class. None of it is exceptionally difficult, but you're at the mercy of the teammates that you are assigned. Paul is an incredible professor and makes the class very fun to get involved in, and my lab team became some of my good friends. Highly recommend his class

Paul was one of the kindest and most resourceful professors that I have had thus far at OSU. He truly cares about his students and makes the at times boring content more lively with his humor. He offers great advice and is willing to sit and help students with various assignments!
Clingan is a fantastic, funny, and caring professor, and while the course is very difficult as is, Clingan does his best to make it as manageable as possible.

I had Paul for the FEH Nano project and definitely would recommend him. He is super laidback and has an extremely dry sense of humor. He's pretty approachable and cares about his students. Even though he's not an expert in nanotechnology/microbiology, he does his best to help you through the project along with the TA's.

Paul made a class that I was scared to take fun and mostly not overwhelming, even though it was a lot of work. He is funny, kind, genuine, and considerate. He always checked in on students for questions, comments, and concerns, and he actually listened and provided help or solutions if there were any. Even online, he was a fantastic professor!

Paul is just an awesome guy. FEH is a tough class both semesters, but he cares about his students and does his best to help you succeed. I thought he had a great sense of humor, and he was always available when I needed help.

FEH is a demanding course. With that being said, none of the problems I had in the class were with Clingan. He is an amazing person who deeply cares about how each and every one of his students is doing in class. He has a ridiculous amount of office hours too. One problem is that sometimes he moves a little fast, but his other qualities redeem him

Paul Clingan is an excellent instructor. I highly recommend him for the first year honors engineering courses. Most of the instructors chosen by FEH are of high caliber, and Clingan is no exception. There will be a lot of homework, but if you pay attention and go to class you will learn a lot.
Awesome dude

Mr. Clingan is a great professor. He knows the class is a lot of work regardless of how it's taught, so he makes it as bearable as he can. He lectures for about half an hour at the start of lectures and the rest of the time is yours. If you have any issues, he will do anything within his power to fix them and genuinely seems to like teaching.
You must stay on top of all of the work to pass this class.
Great guys, willing to help you if you need it. I like his sense of humor, his jokes help make the tough project a little more bearable. TAs do most of the grading.

ENGR 1282.01H is a very time consuming class for 3 credit hours, but it isn't very difficult in terms of grading. The robot project was very time consuming but not nearly as much as you may have heard. As long as you do the work you should get an A. The beginning SolidWorks section was fairly difficult though.

ENGR 1281.02H has a lot of homework, but as long as you do all of it you should get an A. The course is fairly standardized so your lecturer doesn't matter too much, but I found Clingan's lectures to be boring with too much forced "comedy". You can skip half the lectures and still get an A, however, as the content is fairly easy.
Would recommend. But NOT the .02 version. The advanced programming simply assigns more work. It will NOT help you learn more programming. Definitely just take 1281.01
Paul is a good guy, loved his class. Would recommend for FEH.
He's an good lecturer and overall great dude.  I don't remember the content in the class being to difficult.  He's very supportive during the extremely intensive robot project.
