I had Paul for ENGR1281 and the robot project. He is absolutely hilarious and really easy to talk to. One of my favorite professors at OSU. His lectures are short, so be prepared to read the slides before class.
All around great guy. He wants you to succeed and truly cares about his students. He's super funny too. Really nice guy.
His videos about C and MATLAB  were the greatest pieces of art to ever grace my eyes. FEH is hard but Mr. Clingan is a great instructor.

Paul's a really good professor to have if you are being introduced to programming.  He spends most of the class walking around helping people after a short lecture.  TAs also were very helpful and personable.  Highly recommend his class, that being said, it is difficult and you better be ready to get Bs and Cs on things  you worked very hard on.

Paul was my favorite professor last year. He was so funny and helpful on everything and truly tried to get to know each of the students personally. He was clearly intelligent and loved helping students. I ended up changing my major out of engineering but I would take his robot class again for sure! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Paul has been by favorite professor in my first year at OSU. Extremely funny and really wants to get to know you. The 1282.02H class was challenging in terms of workload but Paul truly does his best to make it easier on the students. He's very supportive and always there for you. Overall great professor.
Paul is hilarious. He wants to help you learn.

Had Paul for first semester of FEH and Robot. Excellent teacher! His quirky sense of humor always makes class enjoyable. Probably one of my all time favorite teachers. If you are getting ready to take robot, have fun with it. It was the toughest, most rewarding, and most enjoyable classes I have taken.

Paul Clingan was my favorite professor I have had thus far in college! He was great at explaining the topics, making examples that were fun and interesting to the students. He has a dry sense of humor, but his jokes are hilarious and he will crack multiple jokes throughout the course of the class period. He and the TAs were also very helpful.

Class was the easiest I had first semester other than survey.  Paul makes it short and sweet during lecture and the class is easy to get a good grade in as long as you keep up with the assignments.  Worst part of the class was my TA experience, watch out, they don't want to help you.  Ask Paul directly when you have questions if you want help.

He "teaches" for all of 25 minutes of the 2 hour class and then left.  The TAs were the only ones there to help, but they always had to reference the key to help with questions.  You can go to his class, drop off your homework, and leave.  He does not care if you are there.
A terrific professor. Humorous, understanding, down to Earth. Truly a pleasure to have as a faculty member. Love this guy!

INCREDIBLE! Paul makes everything extremely clear from day one and is always willing to help. He is very knowledgeable in all matters regarding computers and he also makes class fun! You will likely hear between 5 and 7 great jokes per class period and taking this class at 8 AM was definitely a great way to start the day.

Great teacher. Makes everything extremely clear and is always willing to help. Each class starts with a brief lecture for about 10 minutes and he probably cracks about 6 or 7 great jokes in that time. The class was enjoyable, even though it was a lot of work. Lab reports were tough but you will make it through alive. Welcome to FEH.
Great professor for FEH. Really, really funny and helpful! Made class interesting and kept me awake for lectures even though it was an early class.
A good teacher, though his competence with the advanced stuff leaves a little to be desired.

Mr. Clingan is an excellent professor. He always keeps class moving and interesting. He was sick one day, and another prof. filled in. I could see a difference right away - I was weak on that day's content all the way through the final exam. The lab reports are strenuous, but spreading out the work eases the pain. Get Clingan if you can.
Awesome instructor! Very good sense of humor so I almost always enjoyed class. I'm definitely not a programmer, but he made it possible to succeed. I'm really glad someone recommended him to me.
ask about sexy halloween costume

Paul was a pretty nice guy before class, but once we got to London he started to give everyone a hard time and would offer almost no advice for what to do. I felt as though I was intruding on a personal trip and that he didn't have time for me. If you have the chance to go to London, GO. Just we warned.
He was an amazing teacher. Best I've had yet. His teaching style is really helpful and He makes the dry stuff interesting.
One of the coolest teachers I've ever had. He made the class much more interesting than what it might have been. Highly recommend taking a class from him!
Great guy, quite hilarious, and really enjoys teaching. Very helpful and approachable. Would highly recommend
Awesome teacher! Best I've had in engineering so far! You are very lucky if you get him. He is very approachable and helpful...a great teacher overall!

Clingan is a boss. If you can get him you should he is probably the best teacher i've had at ohio state because hes funny and is such a good teacher its almost hard not to get an A in his class. Nice guy, heck of a teacher. GET HIM

Fantastic teacher. Im not a great programmer but he made things easy by doing real examples on the board instead of muttering through slides already available to us. For all you engineers next year or in future years, make sure you get him. You won't regret it.
God of a teacher.  without question one of the best professors in the business.  Programming used to be hard, this guy fixes everything.  unbelievably amazing.
He is a great teacher that keeps the students interested.
He's a really great professor!  He is helpful and you can tell he cares a lot about his students.  Also kept the class lighthearted and fun even though it was stressful and a lot of work.

Really good professor with a real interest in students.  Will usually always be available to help students who may be struggling.  Some assignments can be difficult, but with the TA help and him around they are easier.  Highly recommended!
Really good professor.  No bull attitude.  He knows the material, and will get through the lectures quickly.  The course wasn't that interesting for me, but he definitely knows his stuff.
He keeps the class fun and light hearted, but the room temp tends to make me want to fall asleep sometimes.  He has an interesting sense of humor though!
He's far and awya my favorite professor. Let's face it, FEH material is exceedingly boring and a pain. At least you can have a teacher who is great to be around!

Awesome prof.  Took him for 192 and 193A.  Willing to help you out of class as much as needed.  In 193A, stayed every day towards the end of the quarter till 7:30 if we needed help in lab or on HW.  TAs like him, you will too.  Everything is reasonable, able to say something in different ways.  Best FEH prof, period.

Professor Clingan is bar none the best professor I've ever had.  He is extremely helpful and cares for his students.  And I'd be willing to bet you he's got a dirty joke to beat any one you've got to tell him.
he is wonderful
Great prof, comical, teaches material well in a "no-bull" fashion, very friendly and approachable, good TA's, knows his stuff
Very helpful, like chipotle, always a plus, gives an opportunity to ask any question in the world at the beginning of class
Baldilocks is my hero
Great teacher!
Nice Guy...Chipotle lover, very helpful, has good TA's!
Bald and Awesome
extremely helpful, funny as all get out, knows his stuff, the one class i could never fall asleep in
Really nice guy, chipotle fan as well, cant go wrong! really helpful, willing to work with students after class, on off days, made this uninteresting subject doable
Great class, very helpful guy. He'll bend over backwards to help you get through the quarter. Go with Clingan or Freuler for your FEH courses. Great profs.

Paul is a great teacher & a cool guy. He has a self depracating sense of humor that's pretty funny. Don't copy someone else's journal entry though! Even though they're worth like zero points That gets you in trouble.
Boring lectures make me sleepy, but other than that he's a good guy, knows his stuff, and down to earth.
Took for a 2 hour matlab course.  Really easygoing nice guy, very clear.  Class had no homework and was easy easy.  Get this dude!
proves that there are actually engineers with a sense of humor.  nice guy, and a good teacher.
Paul lets you call him by his first name because he wants you to be comfortable talking to him and asking for help.
great professor.helps students and understands them.
Good professor. Will work with students out of class if they need help. All-around nice guy.
hes just a great guy, and a great prof.
Easy class, get this professor.
Very good teacher, knows everything about the subject, extremely dedicated to his students. Great Guy, loves Chipotle!
Really good lectures and very caring professors. He wants you to succeed

Very good and nice professor. He knows his stuff. Make sure to ask for help if you don't understand something and he will gladly explain. Lots of lab reports, but it's not Casale who teaches the lab, so to me that was almost like a separate class. I would take again, and hope I have more wonderful professors like this in the future.

Lectures are so boring and honestly kind of useless. Attendance is mandatory and graded. Really nice guy. U will not get ur grades back on assignments for significant periods of time. Class is honestly not hard but there is just a decent amount of work. If u do the work u get an A.
Casale helped my team figure out their issues and it really helped us come up with a cool prototype

When our group approached him about an issue with one of our members he barely helped. Also avoid this class at all costs. I'm not even an engineering major idk how I ended up in this class. This will be the single hardest class you will take in all of college. Some people think he's a good professor. Different experience I guess.

Dr.Casale is really a great professor. His online section can be a bit shaky, but that is not his fault. This course is a lot of work, and he does his best with offering a crazy amount of opportunities for you to do well. If you put in the effort, you will do well negative reviews are for those who didn't try. Cares deeply about his students.
A great professor who genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Professor Casale is easy to talk to and willing to help. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him.
Great teacher. Lots of homework, but that's because of the course not him. The final project really helped the grade.
avoid this class
He's a really nice guy and helps out whenever you ask.
Not the best lecturer, but understanding, kind, and respected.
Incredible caring, very helpful and respectful. Genuinely wants every student to get an A and will help as much as needed.

Dr. Casale is a caring, intelligent, and extremely knowledgeable professor. Unfortunately, due to personal reasons I couldn't complete the class. However, if I could, I'd pass with an easy A. Sure there's a lot of assignments, lots of "busy work," but it's plenty of easy grades to pass with an A. If you can't pass, it's on you.

Aside from the group projects, I loved the class and loved Dr. Casale. He is a very interesting person and always tried to give a personal example of a concept covered in class, such as presentations that he had to give for his work, or papers he had to write before he was a professor. Definitely recommend, just be ready to work in groups a lot.

Dr. Casale is a cool guy, and he is very passionate about his job! He makes the class less stressful and is really chill when it comes to projects and presentations. He is so kind and loves to interact with students. I wish I could have taken this class with him in person, he seems like such an amazing professor who would be even better in person!

Casale is the BEST professor. He is genuinely one of the kindest profs I've ever had and I would take his class 50 times over. The setup of ENGR1181 leaves you with a lottttt of assignments, but he does his best to help you and make them manageable. If you're taking him, stick with it!! You won't regret it.

Dr. Casale has definitely been my favorite professor so far. He was a big heart and cares about all his students equally. He truly wants you to succeed and will gladly help you. Lectures are not the most engaging but that's more on the course material. His background experience allows good feedback and ideas. 11/10!

A very kind professor who cares about you succeeding in the class. Group had difficulties turning in an assignment and ended up turning it in late. Had a conversation with him and he was very understanding and waived the late penalty.
Dr. Casale is a great professor. He is so helpful and he actually cares about his students. You wont regret taking his class. He is the kindest professor around!

I took the Montaña de Luz service learning class to Honduras with Dr. Casale. The whole class became really close on the trip and I couldn't have asked for a better leader. If you have the opportunity to take Dr. Casale for any class, do it. He really cares and you will have a new favorite professor.

Dr. Casale is amazing. If you're reading this, you're lucky you are going to have him. If you have a choice for your 1181 professor, choose him. I came into this class not evening knowing what programming is and I got 100% on my final exam without doing much outside the class besides the applications. Strongly recommend!

Dr. Casale is a very caring and understanding professer, he truly wants his students to do great in the class and does all he can to make that happen. Even with 72 students in his class he tries to talk to everyone on a personal level. His lectures could often be very dry, but that may be more because of the content.

I cannot ask for a better instructor than Casale. He has a very big heart and inspirational lectures to make sure his students succeed in the class. If you get to know him well, you may consider him as a second father. He is also willing to give you a big hug and useful advice if you are in trouble or need some help.

I really love Dr. Casale! Very kind and helpful, a father-figured type that will provide you learning, researching and real-world experiences without spoon feeding his students . I wish there were professors like him in ECE Department.

Dr. Casale was a great fit for this class and really brought our project together. Helped just enough to push us without doing it for us. This class was the best I have taken at OSU and he was a major piece of that. Always inspiring and interested in helping students with anything.

Jack is genuinely one of the best professors I have ever taken at Ohio State. His lectures can be long and be prepared to put in the work for presentations every single week. However, he truly cares, he's funny, and has amazing energy.
Had Jack for two courses back-to-back ISE 6801 and ENGR 6210. Great instructor, great person, genuinely cares that students learn what is being instructed.
You can tell he doesn't take life too serious. Attendance wasn't mandatory I literally showed up because he was just a cool guy and his class wasn't boring.
amazing

ISE 3800 really should not be a semester long. It is all very basic knowledge, and I really did not learn anything this semester. Tests are worded extremely poorly, causing people to get bad grades on very easy subject matter. To improve, I recommend that Jack take the GTA-created tests before giving them to students. They are awfully worded.

He is a very nice person--extremely personable. Material covered in class is straightforward and will be applicable in any professional context. The class is really easy if you've managed a project before. Exams are not well written, and a few students did badly on them even though the material covered in class is not particularly challenging.

Professor Slavinski was a nice and caring guy, but his tests were tricky even though they were on easy content. I bombed midterms, but would go into the GTA and get some points back. The professor cares about real world applications and not so much about grades. Attendance sheets are passed around at every lecture/lab.
Jack is awesome

Jack is a great professor. Getting a good grade is secondary to him to making sure you leave with something valuable. If you decide to go in and not be involved in the class and just pass, you're not going to get anything out of it. But if you decide to put forth some effort and get to know Jack he's a great connection to make and you learn lots.
Pretty easy grader, most of the stuff was common sense. Do the readings and you will get 100% on the quiz. I didn't do them but still got an A in the class

They need to figure this class out...it's a joke. All of the material covered in the course could essentially be covered in about 4-5 hours of lecture..but it's a whole semester. Shouldn't have studied for the final. Everything stemmed from basic knowledge but the questions were so poorly worded that you didn't know what was being asked anyway.
Good use of industry knowledge

He was by far the chillest professor I had with numerous extra credit opportunities and make-ups in case you miss couple classes or due dates. It's sad that he's leaving, but we can all appreciate his work for creating this ECE 2360 curriculum in a way that is fun and easy to learn about circuits (and ofc not having to take 2020).

He did a great job teaching the material, and we got a lot of hands on exerperiences through in class activities and fun labs. There are 5 quizzes, the lowest 2 are dropped, and no final, just a final project. I think he plans this to be his last semester, but if not, definitely take his class.

Clayton is awesome. I struggled with circuits because it usually relies on physics and math to teach instead of the practical applications. He focuses on the practical and now I actually understand components of a circuit and the circuit itself. I hope he doesn't stop teaching, he's good at it. Otherwise, I hope you sail the world Clayton!

The GOAT. Clayton made electronics interesting to a lecture hall of CSE students and often told interesting stories of his sailing expeditions. Super knowledgable and also extremely flexible when it came to assignments and grading. Lots of extra credit. Definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU.

A cult of personality among his students, Professor Greenbaum does a wonderful job at making microelectronics an accessible and interesting subject without making the course content rigorous. There are many different hands-on labs and simulations which gives students a breadth-focused view into a wide array of ECE-related concepts.

Excellent instructor who makes the course engaging, though it could be slightly more challenging. Grades are based on five timed home quizzes, with the lowest two scores dropped, in addition to homework and at-home labs. The hands-on nature of the assignments makes them quite enjoyable.

Prof. Greenbaum is a dawg. You must take this class over ECE 2020, there's no question. He's a super interesting guy who truly cares about his students. There's a decent amount of homework (including take-home labs) but the work load is very doable. He always makes himself available outside of class as well. 11/10 as a person and as a professor.
One of the best professors I've ever had. Extremely knowledgable and was an honor to have him as a professor.

Amazing professor and amazing person. Extremely kind and favors learning above all else. Favors "hands on" style learning and is extremely flexible. Very funny and charismatic. Only criticism is that he might be *too* easy going, but I'm sure a student was saved by that. Couldn't recommend him enough.

Easy but time consuming, especially with graded attendance, lab, 11 homeworks, and 5 take home midterms. Lectures are useless except for the posted lecture slides which tell you exactly how to do every problem.

Very funny professor, although his lectures can be boring at times. He's very knowledgable and accessible before/after class. Attendance is worth 5% of bonus credit, so it's fine if you skip but I recommend just going since he does a better job of explaining the concepts in person.

This was Dr. Rahman's first year teaching here, so she is learning. However this class is CONFUSING. She never explains anything, and I learned nothing. It's always unclear what they want on assignments, the structure of the course is overall a hot mess, and there's a lot of busy work. Lectures don't feel important to attend, but are mandatory.
Very much cares about his students, however the course is a bit disorganized and the material can be hard to understand.
This is a difficult class but he is such a sweetheart and cares about students. Homework is worth a lot so you have a good amount of fluff points if you do bad on an exam.

Dr. Kusaka is a gem. He genuinely cares for each student, takes his time to explain each concept in detail, and is effortlessly hilarious and inspirational. Homeworks and exams are very reasonable, and his expectations are extremely clear. The class is more math/theoretical heavy vs. application-based, but still a great course.

Amazing Professor, really cares about the student's and makes very reasonable exams. Stopped class once after he noticed we weren't asking/answering questions, and asked us if we were tired/needed a break and we said yes and he finished the example and told us to take some time off for the rest of class.

Dr. Kusaka's transport 2 (SP2020) was fine. He's good at explaining the difficult material, which is the whole class. He isn't the world's most engaging prof, but he is easy to follow and very straightforward. His exams have very few surprises, and the examples & homework prepare you well. Very sweet guy who definitely cares. He curved us up a bit.

I had Dr. Kusaka for 2420 (AU18) and 3521 (SP19). He is a refreshing change within the department. He uses the chalkboard rather than PowerPoints, his homework is only due every other week, and answer keys are neatly typed rather than handwritten in cursive. His exams can be rough, but he curves generously. I felt smarter after taking him. 10/10
Excellent Professor

After the first unit most of the things he goes over in lecture are related to the homework and exams but without going to TAs for homework theres no way you could do it. Covers very few exam type questions in lecture. Understand how to do the problems on the practice midterms and go to TA office hours and youll be fine. Very generous curve.

This was the weirdest class I've ever taken. For the first month I didn't even know what we were covering. Then Dr. K Mr. Miyagi'd the heck out of me and everything we'd learned just kinda fell into place and made sense. It went from my most hated to my favorite class in like a 24 hour period. Weirdest class ever. Go to the TAs for homework help!

Kusaka is an amazing professor. The material that he's teaching was difficult but he explained every single detail in such a way that even I could understand (says a lot haha) Go for TAs for homework, he curves pretty generously, watch out for his third and/or final midterm as it could be pretty tricky. You can tell he's been in this game forever

Kusaka is a funny guy.  Go to TAs for homeowork because it is worth a decent amount of your grade.  I read the book but I don't know how helpful it really was.  Homework isn't in the book so you don't really need it.  Study homework for tests.  He does give a pretty decent curve.

Incredible professor. Had him for transport I and II When we finished transport II the entire class gave him a round of applause. The topic itself is incredibly difficult. However professor Kusaka explains it very well. Exams are difficult but similar to HW and in class examples. Gives generous curve and inspired me to be a better person.

Dr. Kusaka is a fantastic professor. He does a great job of explaining very challenging concepts and takes extra time in order to help his students. While his tests were extremely difficult, he curves generously. He does not mean to be funny most of the times, but his train of thought ramblings can be hilarious. Definitely take his class!

When I walked in the first day, I thought Kusaka was going to be ridiculously difficult, but he is actually one of the better professors I have had. He takes the time to go through multiple examples and clearly explains everything. His tests are generally fair, except for one bad question that is usually straight from the book and very specific.
Had him for thermo and transport and had amazing examples and his tests were difficult but the class was curved.
Great professor. It may be hard to understand him initially because of his accent. But it gets a lot easier later on...exams are hard especially final. Really need to know your stuff.
Very hard to understand, and assumed you knew stuff!!??

Great guy.  Super helpful.  I thought he spoke English just fine.  At first I thought he was a bad teacher, but soon realized it was the material that was hard to understand, not him.  I would take him again.
No Comments
Very difficult to understand.

He sometimes didn't state things that would otherwise be seemingly obvious, but overall good lecturer.  He had some language barriers thought, like I didn't think he understood what a study guide was.  He sometimes took us for dumb, BC its a lower level class.

Dr. Toney is very knowledgeable and helpful. Since this class is so standardized, he doesn't make many of the assignments, but he knows them in and out and helps efficiently with any problems. 1281 is a tough class, but Dr. Toney makes it manageable if you go to class and put in the work.
n/a n/a n/a n/a

He goes through his lectures very fast which does not help very much when trying to actually program for assignments very much. In this class, I tended to find TAs much more helpful than Toney. He's not a bad professor, just nothing outstanding from my personal experience.

I had Professor Toney for the self paced online ENGR 1221 class. Class was fairly easy given that you paced yourself and regularly used resources. Virtually guaranteed to get an A if you complete all assignments as you can complete them until you pass the unit. Very helpful and overall high quality professor.

Had him 1181 and 1182 (online for 2020-2021 school year). He made concepts easy to understand and was a clear lecturer. He was available outside of class. Toney is a great guy just 1181/82 are so workload heavy its annoying. He made the class easy and the material was not too difficult.

Organized class structure. But have fun clicking through 4 tabs to actually see the whole assignment instructions and rubric. Relatively easy to get a good grade (but large courseload). Lectures are not particularly helpful with the assignments. Somewhat cold with students and unhelpful with team problems. The TA's saved this class.
James Toney is a clear lecturer and very precise with the requirements for assignments and class work

He's a nice guy but this does not help how awfully this class is structured. There is no instruction and hours of busywork. Unfortunately, the class is required for all engineering majors so if you can try to find a more engaging professor.

Dr. Toney's lectures were really useful in completing all of the assignments. Projects and exams were straightforward as long as all of the exercises and applications were completed and understood. Communication of details at the end of the semester was somewhat weak.
Very thorough, clear, and concise. He is very fair in grading and accommodating.

Professor Toney has been a very helpful teacher for my learning. Very clear and often replies to emails very fast. This class is a lot of work, but thanks to all the resources and help provided it is not too hard to do well.

Dr. Toney is a great teacher. He can be a bit stale in his lectures, but if you pay attention they really, really help. He was always available through email to answer questions. His class improved my Matlab skills immensely.
His lectures were difficult to follow because he just read from a PowerPoint instead of actually teaching.

Very knowledgeable and provides clear presentations with lots of in-class examples. Assignments can be hard and take a long time to figure out, but he is more than willing to answer questions and help you through it, so start them early. A tough, but very caring and fair professor.

Good professor, willing to answer questions, super hard content, and lots and lots of assignments until you feel as if you are drowning. He makes the wording of the hw, exams and exercises way harder to understand. If you want to take this class, find a buddy asap!!!

Lectures can be boring, just showing examples, but they were easy to follow and the notes were posted online so found that I didn't need the lectures. His class is laid back but will take a lot of time out of your week doing the assignments.

ENGR 1181 is a VERY time demanding course for supposedly being 2 credit hours. Dr. Toney is a pretty chill teacher. His lectures were very boring, but, there's no way to really make lecturing about Matlab interesting. Most grading is done by TA's and they follow a rubric that you have access to, so as long a you follow the rubric you'll be fine.

He's the best. Super chill and nice. His class is relatively easy, noted that you do the work. MATLAB is MATLAB, regardless of who teaches it. Having said that, he is so great and I would highly recommend his class

The lectures were so incredibly boring and she went over the class end time on numerous occasions. The material was easy to learn, but the notes/examples she would post are very hard to understand. There is a small curve at the end of the class.

Not a great professor, lectures were fairly disorganized and it had some level of a flipped classroom aspect. You are expected to read fairly useless slides before class then questions in class. mainly excel focused with homework taking 2-3 hours. Only nice thing is that exams are fairly straight forward with a long time to do them online.

Lectures were super long and didn't feel very informative. All tests and homework online, so it's easy to do if you pay a little bit of attention and check back in notes. Extra credit if you answer more than the required amount of poll questions on zoom lectures

The sessions were long and terribly boring. The homework and assignments were time-consuming. The tests were GRUELING. Yes, this was an online class, but I heard the in-person equivalent wasn't better. I got the impression the professor knew her stuff but didn't know how to teach. Just glad it's over.

bombed the first test and immediately dropped and I will take it with Sandy instead. i think hannah is a new professor so imma give the benefit of the doubt and say she is still learning. office hours are horrible and poorly managaed, dozens of students waiting for one person. TA was not helpful.

Professor Smith was okay, the way she lectures can be hard for some people to learn from. Class is quite boring and there aren't many assignments. She is very understanding and gives students 2 “late tokens” for overdue assignments. There is no final exam, just a final group project.

Dr. Smith is a fantastic professor. She really knows Matlab and is gives helpful advice/ tips. She is also super accommodating and understanding - just work with her to figure something out. While learning Matlab is not much fun, Dr. Smith brought a much needed levity and snarkiness towards the idiosyncrasies of the program.

Dr. Zhai is a solid professor! His style of going through examples is very effective, however, undermined by "cold-calling" to measure attendance. Fortunately, a 20% bonus is granted per the syllabus as an "optional" final exam (though you'll likely need to take it). Homework varies and can be easy to rage-inducing. Fine class and good prof!

Not a bad professor, but not an amazing one either. Lectures can be boring, but are slow and very well structured. Shang takes his time and stops for questions. Midterms and grading are very fair and doable. Overall, definitely one of the better professors I've had.

Sezen repeats himself a lot and usually runs behind on lectures. Examples were often given two days before the homework that relates to it was due. His exams are tough but fair usually with a C average. He's not the best are responding to emails but usually gives good help in Office hours. I don't like his no technology rule and not posting notes

Professor Sezen is a really good professor and super knowledgeable. He calls out students in class so be prepared to answer a question. He is not a tough grader at all and makes the class easier than it seems. Overall course is tough, but just ask questions all the time and you will succeed.

MUST COME TO CLASS, no exceptions.  If you're willing to do that, and to not use anything but pencil, paper, and calculator, you'll do well.  Fantastic lecturer, good methods, fair exams, incredibly helpful
Very useful notes and examples. Plays great music!
GREAT PROFESSOR, HELPFUL
Very good professor and a heck of a guy

Kelsea really cares about teaching and her students. She is extremely organized with her content and carmen page. She does a great job at preparing her students for exams and she will only get better as I had her the second semester she taught. She gives helpful responses in emails. The class isn't a walk in the park, but if you study you'll do OK!

She's very sweet. I took the class when it was her first time teaching it and she did a great job. The class itself was a lot of work and requires you to be interested in the topics, but overall not a bad class. She's also very responsive on email, which helps.
She went in depth on all the topics we needed to know for quizzes and exams, as long as you pay attention in class you will get a good grade.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU. Cared about us and wanted us to do well. Willing to help no matter what- before/after/during class, and even during exams. Really made an effort to make the class interesting and give us unique experiences (like driving a tractor, tours, etc). Easy HW, easy worksheets for points, exams are open notes.

Peter is one of the lab lecturers for FEH1. He doesn't help that much during labs; he is not prepared for the labs, the TAs helped a lot more. Post Lab rubrics are kinda vague and not easy to understand what to write for the weekly report. Some labs are confusing, but most are really fun! LOTS OF WORK for post labs.
When I found out Dr. Kim is not longer teaching at OSU, it made me so sad!  She was the best professors... actually taught me something.  COME BACK!  I will buy you 3 Chipotle burritos!

Absolutely a great instructor. Extremely helpful and understanding, and is funny and approachable. Always listens to students' concerns and will make adjustments in a fairly (not always your way, but always fair).
Dr. Kim is amazing! Her lectures are engaging and informative while still being fun. I would highly recommend taking her for 1181 and 1182 if you can.

Unlike a some instructors, Dr. Kim actually cares about her students. She consistently provided clear examples of course material, and usually gave helpful advice for exams. She is easy to approach, and offers clear feedback and answers to questions. I wish that I could have her for 1182.
She is n incredibly nice person and really helps you as much as you can. She gives really good reviews for the exams and overall grades pretty easily.
One of the best professors I've had at OSU. She's really helpful and cares about her students.

Dr. Kim is a good person and freaking hilarious.  As someone who just graduated, I can honestly say that she is the best professor I have had in all 4 years at OSU.  She was really helpful and her lectures were clear (even to a non-engineering major like me).  Make sure you get into her class!

Dr. Kim is great! She met with me multiple times outside of class because I wasn't doing well in the beginning of the semester.  If you need help, she is always willing to help.  I really enjoyed her lectures. She made engineering fun. Wish I had her again for 1182!

She is an amazing professor. She is so nice and will make the biggest effort to help you do well. Before the exams she will give you tips for every question. She is always  extremely helpful and wants you to do well. She makes the class extremely easy and I wish I had her again.

I love Prof. Kim! She's so helpful, and always tries her best to clarify things. She makes an effort to even learn students' names. She's honestly such a nice teacher. Class was fun, and I absolutely would take it again.

Two midterms and one final. Midterms are basically from homework. There are lots of calculations in midterms. But it doesn't really matter, because most points come from equations. The lecture is boring so you are not necessary to attend every lecture if you can understand the textbook.

He is very hard working, humorous and do care about his students. He is enthusiastic and have a bunch of office hours. You can ask him questions most of time. But his lecture is a little confusing because he doesn't follow the sequence in the textbook. Anyway, easy HW if you have the textbook.

Kent is a good professor.   He is an adjunct and doubles as the water resources manager for the university.  He teaches this class which is called sustainable pollution prevention.  Kent gave us two mid term exams.  One of them had a math problem he didn't teach.  We also had a group project on solving a sustainability issue.

This guy knows his stuff. However the topics he teaches about are rather dry and lectures are usually pretty boring. His in-class lecture notes are pretty confusing -- they are just screenshots from the book he wrote. Which you should get, because all tests and online quizzes are open book/laptop.

Most boring class I've ever taken. Exams are open book/open laptop, multiple choice. If you do the programs and online quizzes he'll be lenient grading you. I had a 73% raw score after bombing the final and still got a B+. Vish is also an expert on this topic, explains things crystal clear and fields questions perfectly. Rarely makes mistakes.
Very boring class.  Each ten question multiple choice test is worth 25% of your grade so it is easy to dig yourself into hole.  First test is extremely easy but the other two are pretty difficult.

The info in the class is relatively dry, but he is clear and did a good job explaining things.  Rushed towards the end of the quarter when we were low on time.  Tests were all MC, a little frightening when 85% of the grade was dependent on 19 questions, but good curve.

Material is extremely dry. Everything done in class can be found in the textbook. Some homeworks take a while. The tests had 10 questions, multiple choice. They were fairly easy tests (assuming you do the homework) with an occasional trick question. The tests were curved about 2 letter grades in our class, though.

nice guy, very smart...many times during lecture he seemed to have a hard time talking on basic fluid concept levels (too smart to teach 2nd yr undergrads).... did give plenty of lecture notes but tests were hard... generous with curve at the end made up for all the headaches
definatly would reccomend him for chem students even general series!

this class will give u an ulcer, but try not to sweat it...there is nothing you can do to prepare for this guy's tests, they are brutal, and both midterm and final are each worth 45% (the avg on the midterm was only 2% above that weight)...on the plus side, obviously the curve is pretty generous, and we had an "optional" project worth a lot of pts
Great guy and a good teacher as well.
Learn it the way he teaches it and you're better off. It's a general method, but the tests are geared that way.
Very smart, but does everything the hard way.
Awful.  If fate puts you in his class, drop it.

Very dull speaker. Can very easily sleep thru every class. Test is NOT multiple choice. Very tough (class average=61,high=80). Insanely monotone man. He tries hard and material is no help. He does everything in vector quantities when it is completely unneccessary. Even the book's author solves the problems in a much easier fashion.

Good teacher, dry class...some of the hmwrks were rough, others were easy...midterm and final make or break ur grade, 20 multiple choice questions combined and 85% of your grade...the tests were pretty reasonable though
my main impression is ... boring.
Cool guy, has a great accent & sometimes tells funny jokes but not the best teacher. Oh & he Never responded to my e-mails.

Extremely awesome professor! Challenges you to think up to his level (which isn't easy). Lectures are very technical, but tests and homework are over only the easier stuff. Tests are open book, open notes,...and questions are fair. Extremely helpful if you go to him, and very dedicated to teaching.

Absolutely one of the top professors at OSU! One of the most dedicated professors I've seen, extremely helpful. Lectures are a little boring(because of the material, not him), and tests are multiple choice. Highly, highly recommended!
GIVES EXTRA CREDIT

PFAST!! whatever this software does- some student Smart probably made it for him and he potrays it as his own- he does not even know how to make it work in MS Office 2007- outdated class- stubborn guy with 0 intellect and he's arrogant and in your face kind of a person-- he'll talk to you ask if you ate his kids!
Arrogant, Project requirements change weekly, Grading very biased

he's one of the best professors i've had in OSU. really want his students to actually learn something that is applicable in the real world. very demanding but his classes are definitely worth taking. expect to work hard on his classes

Irani is a hard professor, and he is very blunt and to the point.  However, what he teaches is good, and if you know what you're doing and work hard, you'll get the grade you deserve.  Expect to put a lot of time into the projects.
No Comments
The material is good to know for IE's.  Be prepared to put a lot of work into this class.  You'll get out as much as you put into it.  But don't expect much help from Irani.

This guy SUCKS. Honestly I have had bad teachers before but they werent bad and MEAN. This guy is a jerk. Very rude, arrogant, and not helpful at all. On a positive note the course material is very important for an IE and interesting if you can stand Irani. Watch out for this guy.

This is the stuff most IEs are doing, if you did not learn anything from the class why are you in this major.  The more Irani picks on you in class the more he likes you, if you know what your talking about. Bug Christine for fun!!

Good Ideas, Bad Implementation. Does not know the limits, famous for scope-creep. Poor mentor. All he tries to do is sell PFAST (Pea-FAST???? Oops 'FAST). Ideas too vague. Don't care what he speaks :D

He is the worst professor I have ever had. dUmbass, arrogant stupid and he just talks about bullshit that you can never apply in real life
Hes tough, real tough and he demands high quality..give it to him and ur set, if not ..read those other comments! personally we should have more profs like him!

Demand a lot of work from you.  Learned a lot from him.  Can be too full of theory sometimes.  Was not too nice to students.  The only way to get his "good" side is to worked really really hard and kinda let him know that you did those work.
highly sarcastic. Thinks his work is the greatest. Even criticize his own colleageues. Talks more about politics than subject. Unhealthy feeling to sit in his class.
