very arrogant
Little bit crazy. Sometimes nice, sometimes whacko. But OK in general.
whatever you do, don't tell this man that you want to be a consultant
You'll be ok as long as you don't kill trees in his class!!!
I found Dr. Conlisk's lectures to be unorganized and not useful.  I would recommend taking this class in the fall.
Answers every question with ''I'm not interpiter'' (SIC)

Worst learning experience ever in my life. Not helpful to students, Homework is way too hard to help students learn. Errors and typos all over the lecture notes. Notes are inconsistent with the textbook. Most of the class are confused and lost.

Dr. Conlisk is AWESOME!  Do the homework, go to class, ask questions...it's what college is all about.  If something isn't clear, ASK!  He is obsessed with sports and it's amusing! Take his class if you want to be an amazing engineer.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER! His lectures are incoherent and incomprehensible the majority of the time. Sometimes he has a spark of brilliance and tells us what we're being tested on. Other than that, he consistently fails to make sense. The quizzes are a hit/miss-sometimes easy other times difficult. It's best to use the textbook and pray for a good TA.

Nice guy, awful professor. Prints out all notes, but they are full of errors and dont help at all. Has to be constantly corrected by students. Just read and take notes from the book. Tests problems were similar to practice tests. Go to class to do example problems, as he will hint to which will be on tests. Hard class made worse by this professor

I felt Terry did a pretty good job.  If you took the time to do the homework, you can learn all the possible problems he could ask.  If you ever ran into issues, he was always helpful in office hours.  His sports obsession is amusing and maybe a little unnecessary, but he knows his stuff.  Ignore the derivations and focus on the actual equations.

I didnt think he was as bad as the ratings say. his tests are very fair and straight forward, i mean he asks you short answer questions at the beginning (free points on an open book test) . I did crappy in the class but its hard sh*t.

Terry should have been a HS gym teacher/athletic coach--it's obvious he has a passion for sports. He also has a talent of confusing you completely as he stumbles over explaining a fluid subject. Best advice: read the book. Don't ask questions, he'll likely respond in a very short and arrogant tone. Tests are tough because they aren't predictable.

I agree with the evil turtle comment. Poor ability to teach, and was rude in office hours.  Exams were not at all representative of HW but were open book (only somewhat helpful).  Getting ahold of an old exam is your best bet to do well becuase he uses similar questions over and over. Overall, Conlisk is a very bad professor.
pretty bad professor. lectures are really unclear. The problems on the final were nothing like the hw, recitation, or book examples. one of the worst test-writers i've ever had.

Conlisk's lectures consist of him sharing useless sports trivia, reading off his Powerpoint slides, chastising people who arrive late, calling on the same 3 people, and then taking a random problem from the book and telling us to do it while he waltzes around in the front of class. He has an unnatural obsession with John Wooden, UCLA B-ball coach.

Close your eyes (not yet, read this first), picture a jolly fat man of short stature except he's not jolly and kinda looks like a turtle. An evil turtle that wnats to destroy your will and kill your spirit. And not a good teacher either.
Lectures are horrible. You can't learn anything from them. Read the book and do the examples. Nice guy, but really bad professor. hope that you get a good TA

expects you to know prereq material and to be able to judge answers to "make sense" (dont turn something in thats off by a factor of 1000) regardless you can learn everything from the book and exams were fair
PROFESSOR CONLISK ROCKS, DUDE!!!!
A joke, PERIOD.
Dont bother going to lecture, it's worthless.  you can learn most of the material from the book.
No Comments

Hard to say here how I feel about this guy without getting flagged. Myself and another person asked him seperate questions during the final and he literally laughed out loud and walked out of the classroom (never tried to answer the questions). I showed up every day and did all my homework and got a D+. Never got below a B in any other ME course.
He is a very good professor, but sometimes difficult.  He will be very helpful though.  He will make sure you understand everything before the end of the quarter.
His lecture sucks and so does he. The man has no people skills whatsoever.
He's very difficult and makes you work, but it's all worth while in the end.
Terrible lecturer, he stutters constantly, and his presentations are always messed up, which then confuses him and obviously the students.
The most terrible one in ME.

I had a bad experience with him. He was not clear about the grading scheme, wouldn't take the time to discuss class matters outside of class, and acted unprofessionalinconsiderate towards student performance. I have no respect for him. That being said, he is a fair test giver and you need to be (near) perfect for an A.

Feinberg was a really interesting guy and I really enjoyed his lectures. What I didn't enjoy was the fact that he didn't have a clear grading scheme, he didn't hold regular office hours, and was sometimes rude to students in class when they had a question. Overall a pretty good professor though.

Dr. Feinberg is very knowledgeable. You can tell he is a genius, but he makes sure you know it too. He can be a little rude to students at times when they ask questions and he is very unclear on when tests will be and what will be on them. That being said, he explains concepts very well and if you take good notes, you can do well!

Hands down the best teacher in the chemical engineering department.  He has a way of taking extremely complex material and allowing you to understand it on a fundamental level.  I wish I could have him for every class.
Incredible lecturer. You want to have Martin Feinberg as your professor. If I could have him for every class I would.

Dr. Feinberg was the most interesting professor I have ever had.  With that being said, the material was easy to understand...if you went to lecture.  Exams were simple and like the homework, but the final was more difficult. It is apparent he could be doing other things with his vast knowledge but chose to teach instead because he truly enjoys it.

Dr. Feinberg is amazing. Only 5 homeworks all semester with ample time and help. 1 quiz, and 2 midterms--each of which were only 1 question and were extremely fair: just like old exams he give you to study and the homework. His final is more tricky--3 questions and clearly uses it to spread out the grade distribution. You will learn a lot from him

Dr. Feinberg was one of (if not) the most interesting professors that I have had so far at Ohio State.  He loved coming in to teach every day and overall was always doing everything in his power to communicate a difficult topic in such a way that was easy to understand.

Dr. Feinberg is a good teacher. He goes slower at the beginning because he really wants his students to get the material. This might frustrate the brighter students though. Feinberg's exams are like his homework. His final was very tough though. I got a B in the class when I had an A the rest of the quarter.

I actually really liked this guy a lot.  The material is fairly difficult at first (the book is a bit overwhelming) but he takes things very slowly and does an awesome job of breaking down all the problems for you.  The tests are fair and just like the HW, so if you put the effort in you'll do well. He even has a strange, dry, nerdy sense of humor.

I thought he was great teacher, very enthusiastic, and explained himself very well. Every test resembled the homework and he would repeat the last part of the lecture in the beginning part of the next. He insisted that student have a conceptual understanding of the material.

He's obnoxious, rude, and condescending.  You don't really learn anything in the class, but the tests really resemble the homework.  He's not the worst professor in the department, but he has the most annoying personality.
The worst professor I have ever had.  Doesn't teach you anything useful but spends a great deal of time on things that don't matter.

Probably the best teaching professor I had this year. Made all that math 254 stuff I didn't understand at all the first time around make sense. Tests are very fair and not hard if you do the homework well. Gets offended when you talk in class, but otherwise definitely gets a strong recommendation here.
This guy is a good teacher, but he also has a serious mean streak.

One of the most thoughtful and personal engineering professors I have had. She encourages freshman engineers wonderfully, and is especially supportive to women in engineering. I met with her several times about grade concerns and she pulled up a spreadsheet comparing my grades to the class averages and gave me great advice. 10/10, would recommend

Very nice teacher, always willing to help and is friendly to students. Her programming knowledge is sufficient, and she provides a good environment in the classroom. She also makes good use of the TAs in the room, and is not hard to approach with questions. Also, her lectures are rarely long, and are straight to the point. An excellent teacher.
Very helpful
Very nice professor.  Very helpful.
She is a new professor but she is muy bueno she helped me out a bunch.

Her class is easy enough, my engineering class was her first at Ohio State. She is nice but I felt like she relied on the TA's for the actually programming knowledge. Her background is in Civil Engineering. Regardless I felt that the class wasn't too difficult but very time consuming. Kajfez is as good as a prof as any of them.
Great class

Great guy. He's officially retired from the department but I guess he still loves teaching for some reason.  Success keys: invest a lot of time in homework and understanding what is really going on.  His exams are extremely long, so stamina is important as well.  The only compaint I had is his inability to speak loud enough at times during lecture.

This guy is hands down one of my favorite teachers.  Offered extra credit and cares a lot about his students.  I went to class everyday, and when i got sick and missed a class, he called me to make sure I was okay.  He's very dedicated, and more than willing to help you.
Lots of homework. Seems impossible at first. The work load eases up toward the end. Good overall experience.
Dr. Zakin is really helpful and he is so nice, especially if you go to his office and talk to him!  I would recommend him to anyone  :-P

Definitely senile.  Gets lost when explaining problems, can never answer question properly.  He's really nice, but a really bad teacher.  Be ready to crack open the book if you take a class with him, because he won't be teaching you much.
Cool Dude!
Dr Lilly is a good teacher, by far my favorite class to date.

He comes off as a loved teacher but is actually a pretty bad teacher once you are in his class for a while. He tests you on little points he made in class. The only reason why his class is fun is the labs and he has no part in them, his lectures are awful even though he has easy material to present.

Dr Lilly enjoys teaching and it shows. This is the most interesting class I've ever taken. Labs are really fun. Anyone who complains about this class being boring probably shouldn't be a Mechanical Engineer...

He was terrible. Hated this man. His lectures were incredibly boring and useless. The lab was the best part of this class, which he was not part of. Had an issue with a grade with him and sent him an email, and he responded and basically said "I'm in the right here don't bother trying to ask me for help".
Great Guy.  Loves Apple, wears cool hats, super nice, and is extremely clear.
Very good lecturer, especially if you're a female student, fair quizzes but a useless lab that goes with the class.
Amazing Proff! I'd strongly recommend it to everyone who is eligible to go for it! HE WILL MAKE YOU WANT TO COME TO CLASS! And make learning joyous. I really wish he'd teach more classes..

Great professor and very interesting class.  He chose to do 3 midterms instead of one big final this quarter which was very helpful.  Go to class, read the articles and study his notes and you'll do great.

Really great professor and great guy all around. I enjoyed his class thoroughly and wish I could take more from him. Very good lecturer; keeps the class engaged and makes the topics interesting. Also very helpful.

Great class. Makes great points during the class and labs help you understand the maerial even more clearly. Take his class for sure if you are an ISE. He is very liberal by the way and loves Apple's designs.
Challenges engineers to think differently, and see the larger context in which we work.  By far one of my favorite profs.
Lilly is one of the best professors ive ever had. His class is truly interesting and he gets the point across very well.
Great prof, very helpful, if you're ISE student: take his class :)
The best ever, you never learned this stuff and you need to to survive as an engineer in this new age of muda!... You'll learn

This class was only two credit hours and was more work than i had to do for two other five credit hour classes put together. This 'Fundamental' Engineering class is really stupid and tedious and was completely unnecessary. If you have to take this Trott isn't bad but the class itself sucks.
Dr. Trott is not a good teacher.  There are worse.  He is monotone, boring, helpful if you ask, gives vague lessons, and you will be teaching yourself most of what he teaches.

He is boring and reads off his powerpoints, which can be irrelevant. However, he is very helpful if you ask. The class itself is dumb, with loads of busy work, group work, and nonsensical work that really just makes you want to drop out of engineering completely. It is one of the worst designed classes I've ever taken. Not all his fault, though.

I got one point taken off because I improvised a staple, monotone, you spend 4+ hours for 2% of your grade, lectures are basically the reading and nothing more, and  God forbid you have a document printing when he starts lecture.
Easy class, as long as you work with your group and do the work. Easy grading. However Trott himself is monotone and can be long-winded at times.

Solid class. Its first year engineering, so its not hard, you just do CAD drawings, then SolidWorks, then an AEV project. Everything is very easy and thoroughly explained. I feel like a lot of easiness had to do with the fact that I was put in a great group, but no one has really any control over that.

First off, DO NOT BUY THE ENGR TEXTBK. It's used like 5x in the beginning and it's a major waste of $100. Second, Trott is a cool dude. He adds occasional really dry humor that is hilarious based mostly on its rarity. Frosh ENGR is probably the easiest class known to man, so if you think it is difficult (either one), you need to gtfo of engineering

Class is hard/easy. If you get behind: it is hard. If you stay on top of everything: it is easy. There is a pre-class assignment and a post class assignment 3 days a week. Multiple lab reports. Exams are easy compared to the reviews. Easy to get a B in this class. An A takes work. Trott is clear and professional. However his voice is so monotone.

Dr. Trott is very clear and very helpful. His class is a lot of busy work, but if you do it all you are basically guaranteed an A. He teaches everything you need to know and the exams are extremely easy. The averages are always low A's or high B's.

Dr. Trott overall was a very helpful professor. The only complaint that I have would be his voice, it's very monotone and can easily put you to sleep, especially if you have this class very early in the morning. The exams weren't hard, and overall the work in the course was just tedious, not hard.
Trott was a good teacher and very helpful. The class isn't hard, but there are a lot of projects. He is very monotone and having his class early in the morning may put you to sleep.

Dr. Trott is a decent teacher, though his monotone voice takes away from the class and is rather sleep inducing... But, overall, he is willing to help anyone who needs it, and there are always TAs in the room for extra help if needed. All in all, it's a pretty boring class, but if you fall behind, it's easy to get help.
Good teacher, lectures are boring but otherwise a decent class.

His lectures were very understandable, but very sleep inducing(monotone). He was very nice, made sure everyone knew exactly what they were doing. Exam avgs were always B+ to A-. Pts were taken off in HW for stupid things though.
none

Trottski was a pretty cool guy. Although he has a monotone voice that can put you to sleep sometimes in class, he explains things very well. His goal was for everyone to get an A in the class. A very nice teacher.
Yummy

Have my BS & Master's from OSU.  Prof. Trott is the best teacher I learned from in my experience.  As other poster indicates, pay close attention to details of the work you produce.  It was tedious but you'll appreciate when you enter the "real world".  I think his experience in corporate America helped differentiate him from the usual "lifer-profs
He was a decent teacher. Pretty easy class, though we would get points off for the littlest details, just a warning. Labs weren't that bad either.
Very helpful when needed.
Great class.  Very organized, very helpful.
Easy class. You should get an A. You are supposed to get an A. He was good at going over all the stuff.
Very boring lectures, but a good guy.
not too bad.   good guy
Prof is often unclear of the concepts he is lecturing on and does not communicate clearly. He seems to enjoy being overly difficult. The class was easy; just had to put up with him.
Very monotone and boring Matlab lectures, but hes a great guy.
Good class
Nice, fairly easy course.  Trott has a monotone and isn't very "engaging" but is helpful if you don't understand something.
No Comments
Trottdawg is the chief. Almost as cool as Lilly
Very helpful, clear and easy to learn from
Very soft-spoken, fair, and helpful.  Willing to make special arrangements if you're having trouble.

Loved Coop's class. He really tries to teach you as much about polymers as possible. His notes are great study material homeworks are really long and tough, but the TA was super helpful and the homework is very similar to the exams. Final was not cumulative.

If you already have a PhD, you might get something out of his class.  Expectations are way too high, and the homeworks and exams are a pain.  The only thing that salvages his class is his gigantic curve.  Take 773 with him if you want to do the polymer option, otherwise probably skip it.

Sandip is the best teacher I've had at OSU. He has a bit of an accent, but it's easy to understand and actually pretty funny to listen to. He's always willing to help, and gives good feedback. The tests were tough, but the homeworks were easy and made up for it.
Great teacher! Very helpful, concise, clear, and a nice guy!I will miss him.

Good professor, he is very clear in what he says during class.  HW is optional but do it to prepare for his weekly quizzes.  His tests/quizzes usually followed his notes more than the book or the homeworks.  The midterm is a big pain, but he makes up for it with an easier final.  For the project, start working on it ASAP and it'll be over fast.

Hard class.  One of my top 10 best professors ever.  Is the type of professor that doesn't like undergraduate students because they don't seem to be interested in the material, which is why "showing effort" rates high in his book.  He's the kind of guy that'll make you a heavyweight.  I also took 811 from him.

Excellent teacher.  Explains the material clearly, patiently, and shows a true passion for his field.  Always easy to find in his office, and always very helpful.  Class requires a lot of work, but engineering isn't a field for the lazy.  Liked his material so much that I changed my focus to numerical methods.

Hard midterm (avg was 57%), but a very reasonable/easy final. You are almost guaranteed an 8/10 on the quizzes if you just put something down. Extremely helpful in office hrs. You can do terribly in the class and still pass with the built-in curve. He is a good lecturer and means well.
Quizzes are graded really easy. Doesn't collect hw. If you need help he is more than willing. There was a huge curve. Basically guaranteed a C and if you work a little a B isn't hard to get.
the people who are saying he isn't good are wrong.  they're just whining.  his lectures are thorough and he is extremely helpful to students.
This prof is too good.

I had him his 1st quarter teaching & 20% ended up being a passing grade. Doesn't use the internet for anything. Doesn't let you use any computer programs. You have to do a ridiculous amount of hand interpolations & spend more time on those than meaningful calculations. He has poor English skills too
Malicious, hypercompetetive, pseudointellectual snob.  Take this class if you like paying large amounts of money in exchange for insane mental abuse.
He was condescending and mentally abusive in lecture, but still preferable to Dr Moran.  We had an unusual amount of low scores in this class (<50%).

Extremely dedicated, helpful, and patient. He does a wonderful job during his help sessions. Tests are hard, but not unfair (test questions are similar to homework). Highly recommended because he tries to make Thermo as straightforward as possible.
Unbelievable.

Failed kids for his mistakes. Posted incorrect guidlines for a project and still failed kids who didn't get it to work out. He then refused to be reasoned with afterwards by not responding to emails and blew students off completely if they came in person. Unbelievable.

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. The MAE department here at OSU has some terrible profs but he's the worst. He doesn't respond to your emails unless you're Chinese. He gave us 2 huge projects and an even longer take home final which were all extremely hard due to incorrect notes he gave us. Giving him all 1s is a stretch.
worst professor in the league

Professor Yu's lectures are pretty much straight out of the book.  He does the already solved examples and isn't very helpful.  He is absolutely terrible with partial credit; he was very unfair with grading.  You either get 50% or 100% on questions.

Yu is a great teacher, his lectures are pretty boring but he does go over everything you are going to need for the class. His tests are straight forward and he doesn't throw any curveballs at you. If you do the homework you should be okay in the class. He is THE MOST HELPFUL teacher I have ever had if you go to his office hours.
johnny yu is to teaching what jhonny peralta is to baseball
Tests were hard, and a lot of homework, but things lectures usually made sense.
No Comments

Very clear lectures, only complaint is that he did in-class examples straight from sample problems in the textbook...exams were fair but be careful...he is a little harsh when it comes to partial credit, and the 3 tests make up 95% of your class grade...he is extremely helpful and friendly if you go to his office hours...highly recommended
Yu makes fluid dynamics a little easier to understand.  replies to emails really quickly

I first met Mr. Croft in September 1973 at the Community and Technical College on the Campus of West Virginia Institute of Technology (both schools are now part of WVU).  It was his first teaching assignment (I believe); he'd just left Douglas Aircraft in search of his true career passion.  Zero tolerance for foolishness.

Midterms and final were open book, though you still had to study a little bit to know how to do the problems. Very laid-back, go with the flow kind of guy for this class. He's really helpful and you can tell he is actually a teacher because he WANTS to be, not because the dept makes him. Cheesy jokes, but overall his class was enjoyable.

Croft is a great guy. He is very smart and knows a lot about engineering. Sometimes he gets irritated if you ask him a simple question, but he is very good at what he does. He can be picky at times, but it is meant to help you improve.
Good professor. Tells you what is expected. No surprises. Keeps things interesting despite the dry subject matter.
Dr. Croft can be a bit harsh at times, but it's a great class and he enjoys teaching. He can sometimes have a short temper if you ask an obvious question, but he's really helpful otherwise.

Dr. Croft was honestly the best prof of my entire first year at Ohio State. If you ask for help, he is willing to give it. He makes goofy jokes that are a bit cheesy but keep the lecture interesting and he is definitely an expert in his field.

He is a great professor, always exciting, and knows so much about what he teaches. He corrects the book many times during class. It's a pretty easy class if you show up and do all the work. He is also a well-rounded guy. He loves to talk about movies, music, football, you name it after lecture while everyone is working. I loved this class so much.
perfect class for any eng. major....get some autocad experience and an easy A at the same time... be sure to ask questions on projects and show up from time to time and you'll be fine
Funny guy. Makes for an entertaining first quarter of your collegiate career. Good taste in movies.
if you have any previous autocad experience this class is easy.  Easy going and enjoyable class.

Def get to know him, he is very helpfull and will tell you exactly how to do things, so dont be afraid of him. Just listen to what he has to say, hes really easy going. Just make sure you go to every class or he gets pissed. He does grade hard, but fair so nothing is really a surprise

Fun social guy.  Class is easy if you know his expectation but he is NOT very clear communicating what he's expecting from you so if you don't ask questions, you'll screwed yourself out of points.  Be sure to raise any problems or issues early when projects are assigned.
An all around good guy!
Good professor. He made the material easy to understand.
He loves giving people lower grades, so make sure you do well on everything so you can throw it in his face when you do well. Even if you have less than a point needed for an A, he won't do it.

I got along with him ok, but I know of at least two girls who he made cry. He is sensitive to the word "unfair." If you have to miss class, have a good excuse or he'll nail you for it. The tests are hard, but exactly like the hw. He uses a large grading curve, and it's not uncommon to fail a test.

This class was challenging, but if your willing to try you will be ok.  Croft is very helpful.  I had to take this class so i had no choice.  I ended up getting the best grade in this class out of all the EG classes I took.
Dont drop the class if you dont understand it.  Croft will make sure you understand things, he is very helpful.  Even if you do bomb the tests the homework and group project can make up for it.

Anyone who can't understand the first week needs to drop the class. So long as you drag your butt outta bed for the 730a class and do the homework should have no problem. Croft will stay til the bell to help you if you have problems and talk to you.
The class sucked.  Don't expect an A if you can't draw or never have before.  Croft is willing to help though.

Awesome professor! I had her first semester of FEH and set up my schedule around having her the second for robot. She gets how stressful FEH can be because she was once a student. She really cares about making sure you understand the material. There is a fair amount of work in FEH but if you stay on top of it exams aren't bad.

Lauren does a great job of making her lectures interesting. Even though my FEH class was at 8am, I actually anticipated going to this class every morning. She was very helpful with any issues you needed resolved and was very considerate. For example, there was a homework that many of us struggled on and she extended the deadline for it.

One of the best instructors I'll probably have in my college career. She really cares about helping the students, is easy to talk to, and makes class bearable. Lauren really tries to get to know the students. Also she is flexible to help students. The TAs really decide your grade as they grade almost everything. Lauren is one of the best.

Lauren is overall a fairly good professor.  Very willing to help and relates to students since she is very young and went through the same thing not too many years ago.  The FEH TAs were amazing.  The robot project takes up a TON of time and you will get out what you put into the class.  A lot of work but do it and you will get a good grade.

Lauren was hands down my favorite professor from my freshman year.  After having her as an instructor for first semester of FEH, I specifically enrolled to be in her section of FEH robot second semester.  She's aware that lectures can be long and boring, and really tries to make them concise and interesting. She also really cares about her students

Lauren is an amazing professor to have for the OSU FEH Robot Project. She is incredibly helpful and nice to all students, also the FEH TAs are amazing too! Lauren went through FEH and is very relatable and incredibly knowledgeable, definitely one of the greatest teachers I have had thus far and a perfect professor to have for this course.

Lauren was very clear about what she expects from students and is very willing to help anyone out. She has very reasonable standards but beware of the TAs: they can be cruel at grading so read the rubric and follow it!
Lauren goes out of her way to help her students.  It is clear she cares about their success.  If you attend office hours and make the effort Lauren goes out of her way to help you succeed.
Lauren truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. On the plus side, she has the best hair.
Definitely not an easy class (due to class workload), but an A is definitely possible with her.

The class is entirely attendance and group-work based. The weekly lab reports all have rubrics attached in the back-- base your reports directly off those rubrics. If you understand and do all the homework and labs, you probably wont need to study for the 2midterms and final for an easy A.

Good professor, especially if you ask for help. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and generally if you're failing to do so it's because you're being lazy with small assignments that add up in the end. Or your group is terrible. In short, Easy A if you just get stuff done.

The material and assignments are standardized so thats out of her control. But, Lauren goes out of her way to try to help her students understand the material and prepare them for the exams. The best thing for your grade is to work on papers a few days before they're due with everyone present. Make sure you proofread and double check the rubric.

No matter what Engineering 1181 class you take, there will still be lots of assignment, lab reports, and homework to do outside of class. Lauren, however, was very understanding of deadlines and would push back assignments she felt the class wasn't ready for. Extremely approachable and easy to talk to with questions.

Lectures are mostly just reading material off powerpoints. Questions to Harper that are even slightly off the material (like general application, implications, etc.) seem to cause confusion. Did not seem interested in helping students to resolve their issues.

Lectures are very helpful because he explains good. Don't be dumb and skip like me. You'll be clueless what he's  talking about next class. Pop quizzes are group. Tests are hard because he makes tricky questions. Kinda like those "oh" moments. Made me spend way too much time on stuff I already knew. Now I don't know if I'll pass. Lord help me.
Average for midterms  are around 60%, avoid his class and take others!!!!!!!! WORST professor i ever had.
Material is boring but pay attention in class or else you will miss out a lot. Tests are not difficult. Lecture slides might be confusing. Need to get the text for open book exam

Dr. Harper is probably the best engineering teacher in OSU I've ever had so far. He's very clear in teaching the materials, and is very fair in terms of tests. Simply put, as long as you pay attention in class and do the homework, you'll be fine. His tests are NOT hard, but is rather TRICKY.

Very helpful in lecture and makes up for where the book lacks in instruction.  If you don't go to lecture you will suffer. He isn't always the most exciting professor but he knows what he's talking about.
WOW
Easily one of the most poor professors I've had at this school. Unreasonable grading, very unhelpful outside of class. Refers us to the lecture slides if we ask questions during office hours.
Terrible teacher. He expects you to do way too much looking in the book for homeworks, and that isnt even enough to get it done sometimes. Avoid this guy
Great teacher, great guy

He is not a terrible teacher, but when approached during office hours several times, he was extremely unhelpful. He took no interest in helping answer questions I had over the material. He will not allow any exceptions to whatever class structure he has set up. He could improve most by making students feel that their learning needs are important.

Dr. Harper is a really good professor. He is definitely one of the best that I've had so far at OSU. The book is pretty worthless, so you pretty much have to go to lecture to learn, but that's okay because Dr. Harper is very clear and concise when he teaches. The exams aren't easy, but are definitely fair. Make sure you ask for an equation sheet!!

Dr. Harper is the man. He knew that the class material was mind-numbingly boring (numerical methods), so he always tried to lighten the mood with humor (like playing ZZ Top's "LaGrange" when learning about the LaGrange method). Overall a good guy, a solid professor, and his tests weren't too bad. Make you sure you go to class.

First off, the book is not very helpful in actually helping you learn the material. It is a treasure trove filled with wonderful secrets and data but not really any useful examples so going to lecture is a must. The homework is just like the problems from class and his exams are REALLY fair. Overall, a time consuming class but a good one.

Dr. Harper is a straight forward teacher.  He gives pop quizzes in class.  His midterms weren't too bad.  Just do the practice problems and you will know it.  Don't waste your time going to office hours he was useless when I went once.  He is pretty funny though.  Yell, funny stuff out in class to keep him going.  His responses are pretty hilarious

Professor Harper is one of the best teachers I've had at Ohio State. His class is concise and effective; he reviews theory quickly and then goes directly to relevant problems. His homework is very helpful. Exams are fair, it's very possible to get an A in the class if you do homework, study midterm practice problems, and do well in lab.
Lectures were a bit dry, but that's just how it is with statics. Was pretty fair with exams and homework, and group quizzes were definitely good. Good professor.

A really good professor. He goes through the theory fast, then just does examples which are really what is needed in this class. The midterms and final are difficult but fair. I would definitely recommend taking Harper if you can.

Dr. Harper is good, ME department deffinatley has worse.  Gives pop wuizes so have to go to lecture and recitation.  Harper's exams were difficult study before taking them, they make up a lot of the grade.

Dr. Harper is my favorite ME professor.  I had him for H210 and now for 250... I even skip Dr. Lee's 430 lectures so I can go to Harper's instead.  He really seems genuinely interested in teaching, and when the stuff gets too boring he has some pretty good jokes.  Go to office hours even if you don't have to... he's a really nice guy!

Excellenct Professor! Never stops a second from encouraging students. His lectures are very helpful. Strongly suggest going to office hours, because he is very friendly and will help you a great deal！！！！ I would take him again if I ever have a chance to.

250 is the most boring class ever; he impressed me by lecturing for 2 hours without falling asleep. His test are challenging, the homework is a mix, and he seems to be a nice guy. You will have to work to get a good grade. You will learn the material; it's mostly about doing it by hand once so that you understand what the computer is doing.

Gives fair midterms and quizes pertaining well to the assignments. H.W. are not too challenging either as long as effort is given. His Final is extremely difficult and graded very strictly, so be prepared going into the class with an A or high B till the final and coming out with a C since he goes for a C average. Overall an average/good professor.
Good professor overall.  Midterms are fair, somewhat dry, but not bad overall.  Do the suggested problems and you'll be fine.
Brian Harper is my hero.  I had him for 250, 430, and H210, and they have been the best ME classes I have taken so far.
Nice guy. Clearly answers questions in office hours. Knows what he's talking about.
He averaged the grades of the two midterms instead of taking a final which was AWESOME!
he is a great instructor ... he grades the papers fairly easy, but be ready for all sorts of questions in mid-terms and the final if u want a good grade
Very fair in grading. Makes lectures humorous. Answers questions via email promptly. Overall great teacher.
Good teacher

Great professor to have in class! Tries to make things as simple as possible, incorporates some humor in lecture, and he definitely knows his stuff! Assignments are straightforward, tests are based off of sample/HW problems. One of the best M.E. professors at OSU!!!

Very helpful in office hours. This class was pretty straightforward and he always did a great job of explaining the harder material. Online hw was hard at times, but exams were exactly like the review sheet and quizes were open book in groups.

This guy is not fun, but he tries to get to the point and show you how to do the problems. Then the tests are based on homework. Open book tests and you are allowed to write anything in the margins. He makes the class manageable.
great teacher, he makes things easy to understand, like he knows what it is/was like to be a student.  they need more profs like harper out there.
What can I say? The guy's hilarious, if you catch on to his dry sense of humor. He's just chillin' and enjoyin' life....

Has open book tests, and the problems in them are very straightforward.  Dry sense of humor, but makes you smile sometimes.  Class can get boring, but Failure Modes isn't exactly the most riveting of courses.
frickin'  awesome. Best TA ever. Hilarious. Really great at coding. Really great at SOLIDWORKS. Has no weakness. Like Superman, except immune to kryptonite.

Not gonna lie, not the most helpful person.  He's your classic tech nerd, that apparently has an athletic side that no one has ever seen.  Only ask him for help with coding stuff, because asking for help with SolidWorks will only confuse you more.

Not an OSU student, a CCAD student. Had his Writing Fiction class at CCAD. He was very passionate about the topic and cared a lot about his students. He was used to longer classes and often lost track of time, but by the end of the semester he had better time management. I'd take a fiction class with him again.

Terrance is a great professor. He genuinely cares for his students and wants them to do well. He understood that a writing class wasn't at the top of engineering students' priority list and gave out doable assignments that just required a showing of effort and care to get a good grade.

This man is amazing.  He is really passionate about what he does and it shows... primarily through him more or less shouting with enthusiasm about whatever it is he's lecturing on.  It is quite entertaining to watch and learn from him.  Homework isn't too hard.  Word of advice, though: go through the book and talk to the TAs if you want to do well.

Prof. Volakis spends more time in class yelling at his TAs and the IT department than he does teaching. His lectures are nothing more than copying formulas from the book into the board. He even told us that he would fail his own exam as he handed it out. Extremely disorganized, angry, and just downright rude... Avoid at all costs.

Comes into class five minutes late, rambles about nothing for ten minutes, and keeps the class ten minutes late everyday. He is extremely rude to other profs, his TAs, students, and IT people on a regular basis. He is disorganized and regularly gives out contradicting information (and will not clarify it). Avoid him  you wont learn a thing.
great teacher

Terrifying. He's very angry sometimes, esp at inanimate objects like projectors. Teaches you all about life and not so much about antennas. Would rather be at ESL, which is fine, but don't teach. The class is all about him for sure. It's an ok class I guess but would be better with another teacher.
really bad should explain with ease
some comments here
No Comments
No Comments
Lots of work for the class.  Difficult project.  Not a bad guy, but lectures are difficult to follow because he always goes off on tangents.
The lectures were very informative. The prof often teaches classes based on the research papers he published (some of them are not used in the industry, so might be boring).

I thought Professor Martinez was an awesome professor.  He has a very dry sense of humor that I think some people could find annoying, but he was very fair and always seemed to make class interesting with his one liner comments.  It was a hard subject for me, but I think that his class really helped to understand digital logic as a complete newbie.
Tries to make every lecture interesting. Very helpful AND lenient with the grades. The course is demanding, but you end up learning a lot!

This professor is extremely clear and very helpful.  For one of my homework assignments, I half-assed it because I had another huge project due the same day.  Since I did so poorly on the homework, he took the time to e-mail me and offered help.  I've never had a professor who was so concerned with his students' performance.
This guy really knows the material and really knows how to teach it.  His exams are fair and this class is an easy A or B. This guy can be pretty funny as well.

Highly recommended Professor, funny and easy going; however, that doesn't mean not doing any works in his class. Topics in class are hard(comeon what do you expect, is freakin 700 lvl), but you will get lot out of this class.
Kept me awake in a class I had no interest in -- he definitely gets points for that.  Also a very fair professor, actually let me turn a project in a few hours late and I still got full credit.
Martinez was an amazing professor. He made what could of been a difficult subject seem like it was child's play...I RECOMMEND HIM HIGHLY!

I really enjoyed this class. The class is fairly easy, but Martinez made the life easier for us. Exams, homeword, quizzes, and projects are extremely fair. He is always interested in helping students. Also, I really liked the way he acted and talked in class. This guy is hilarious. Very cool person, and I strongly recommend him:).
First of all, he is so hilarious! Also, enthusiastic in lecture. Of course, the course is not at all easy, but when asked, he's so eager to help students. I learned a lot from him!
His exams were exactly what he said in lecture. go to class and take lecture notes and you will have no prob. he also allows pages of notes for exams.

Anyone who thinks that this man is rude or inconsiderate is probably rude and inconsiderate themselves. I found the course to be extremely difficult but then again I have never taken an engineering course in my life.
Demanding but excellent professor. Definitely not for the weak students that want to be spoon-fed.
Some difficult lectures.
This man is rude to students, unhelpfull, condescending, and ridiculous in both his grading scheme and course layout. I learned nothing, and received an A.

He was a decent prof., but he was rude and inconsiderate.  Even when you're BREATHING he'll tell us to shut up, because it's too much of a distraction for him.  Oh, don't be late to class either.  He once threw someone out of class for being late.  Crazy.

Ozkan is really awesome.  You can tell she really cares about the material and wants everyone to succeed.  If you go to lecture every day and put effort into the homeworks, you'll do just fine in her class. Tests are fair. Would definitely recommend taking a class with her.

So first off, I think Dr. Ozkan is a brilliant and caring professor. That being said, she has been my least favorite ChemE professor. She takes attendance. She doesn't post homework or worksheet solutions ( which aren't graded for accuracy). You also have 4 exams and a final which is overkill in my opinion. Those are just my biggest pet peeves

Umit is a great professor. Her lectures are clear cut and really all you need to do the homework and exams. Homework doesn't take long to do at all. Be careful though, she takes attendance at lectures and I am pretty sure she uses that when making her curve (she curves to a C). Also, she is really big on cheating and won't hesitate to use COAM.

Her exams and quizzes were very difficult, especialy the final which had an average of 58%. however, she curved the class quite a bit, so I ended up getting a B+ with only 79% in the class. Overall, decent professor.
Crazy professor, not helpful. Get out while you can.
Overall a good class. Her exams are tough but fair. Lecture is helpful.
Wasnt as bad as people say. Hey exams can be quite tough. But going over hw and reviewing quizzes helps. A lot of sample problems are given in class so dont miss them....overall not bad
I found it very hard to learn from her, especially after having Tomasko for 200.  I had to teach myself out of the book for every topic.  Test averages are very low, 55 on our first midterm

Decent professor but a little boring. It is important to attend his class as the methods he uses are extremely simple but very hard to find in the textbook. Exams and homeworks are really easy if you use the methods he covers in class. He is also always very helpful during office hours.

It is a very abstract and tough class, but he made is easy. Exams are easy. Probably half of the class got an A, but they didn't learn anything. If you know how to use Utkin, you will learn. He is a genius, very kind, and very willing to help. He is one of my favorites although it is hard to follow him. He is just too smart for his students!
Excellent

What a prestigious and kind person. No need to praise him because his resume speaks for itself. Not a very good instructor because he has been teaching Control for more than 50 years:) But he still does his best to explain everything. You are more than welcome to go to his office to ask him any type of questions as long as his office door is open!
This man is completely useless. I don't think I learned a thing in his class. If you had essenhigh, then you will know what to expect.

Easy and Awful.  You'll get a good grade (if you go to office hours, where he does the problem for you) but you won't learn.  Also, all of his courses are the same, despite the different departments and course descriptions.  Having taken one of his classes, I could take any other he teaches and get the same grade (better) using just my old notes.

BAD: Possibly the most worthless class in ME.  The more you listen, the more you're confused, the dumber you get.  GOOD: Possibly the easiest engineering professor.  Turn in the homework, and you'll get an A or B (even if every answer is wrong).  Test questions are exactly like homework, except EASIER!

he speaks softly and writes small on the board...he goes fast and has an accent that can cause problems occasionally...i was confused all quarter by the material, but if you can do the hmwrk you can do his tests b/c they are very similar...plus there were only 3 hmwrks the whole quarter and none of them were all that long
Terrible

Dr. Utkin is a very kind and brilliant man.  I did not understand much of the material, though I'm not sure I can totally fault him for that.  He is VERY happy to help you outside of class.  If you understand the material, you get an A.  If you work at it but really don't get most of it, you get A-.

Nicest professor ever.  Gives you in class examples that are very similar to homework and exam problems.  Idiot that i am, i slept through class the day of the midterm and he let me take the test later that afternoon with no penalty.
This dude is brilliant, but can't teach worth anything.  He's nice, but he might as well teach in his native Russian.

It was his last year teaching and he was the worst professor I have ever had. He did not do example problems while he was teaching us new things, he did not have office hours, and did not put solutions to the homework problems that nobody (including the TAs) could figure out. Arrogant, completely did not know what we didn't understand. I Hate him.

Dr. Paulaitis is a no-nonsense kind of guy. He gives you the basics and you are responsible for taking the material and knowing it inside and out. The averages are low all semester but if you work hard and really try an A is pretty easy--about 60-70% on most assignments will give you an A. Not a class you can blow off. ATTEND LECTURE.

Dr. Paulaitis clearly commands a vast knowledge of engineering thermodynamics. He also explains the material very clearly in class.  However, the homework, exams, and group project are all extremely difficult and time-consuming; I worked harder in thermo than other class I have taken. Be prepared to work hard the entire semester to earn your grade.

incredibly difficult and theoretical professor and class, but he really knows his stuff.  expect to understand thermo at the end.  midterms, homework, and project are all very difficult and time consuming, but they're a great look into chem-e.  don't overload yourself while taking a class with paulaitis; his class demands your time

This was Thermo II. That being said very hard. Tests can be either easy or hard, but either way you did almost everything wrong. MAKE ASSUMPTIONS. OH are at 7:30 everyday, but if another one of your classes has a test or something going on, he knows and will not show up. Very good prof though and learn a lot from lecture. Project sucks, but fun.

If you're not a genius at chemical engineering, you will be very frustrated in this class. This professor teaches at a fast pace that his smart students love. For regular students like the rest of us, it's a battle we're outnumbered against. The test are very difficult. The project is very difficult and that's all that need to be said.

You will discover he can write on the board faster than you can write on paper. His hw's take around 15 hours a week. The project is hard and there isn't a whole lot to learn from it. His exams are hard and he doesn't give much partial credit. Think of this class as an initiation into chemical engineering. On the bright side, it only gets easier :)

This man will challenge you to no end. The midterms are alright, but the homeworks and the final are impossibly hard. Be prepared to spend countless hours working on this class, but also be prepared to have a firm grasp on thermo when you come out of it.

He is very hard to understand and could not answer all my questions. He asked his graduate students in his lab to answer my questions. I am wondering if this professor has ever performed research by his own. It looks like research is done by his students and they also have to answer our questions related to the class.  Not  one my favorites.

Lots of people hate him, but I rather like him.  His lectures are good, he's fairly clear.  He likes participation, sit in the front and speak when you can, he plays favorites.  His exams are hard but not unfair, nor is his grading.  Make sure you answer everything in explicit detail.  Homeworks are very time consuming, nature of the course.

One of the worst professors in ChBE at OSU.  He expects students to know everything off hand and is a hard and unreasonable grader.  He expects every detail/assumption to be written on the exam sheet.  The avgs on the exams were 34% and 42%.  You have no way of knowing how you're doing in the class.  I have no idea how I got a B!!!

Homework and project are pretty labor intensive, and sometimes nearly impossible without pointers from TAs.  Exam grading could stand to be more objective.  Go to his review sessions - he'll tell you almost exactly what problems will be on the tests. His class was difficult but I think I probably learned more than in any other ChBE class so far.

Nice Guy but a horrible teacher. Taking points a way is part of his religion. His lecture is understandable if and only if you read the chapter ten times before coming to the class. Exams are very hard and the final is ten times harder. Basically, you will fail the entire exam and if he likes you or not will determine you grade. Best advice; avoid

Homeworks are extremely time intensive.  He is fairly helpful if you can manage to make it to his 7 AM office hours, plus it always helps for him to learn your name when it comes to his final judgement.  I did way better than what I anticipated, so put the time in and make sure he's aware of your effort.
I liked his lectures, he obviously knows his stuff.  I really don't see why so many people have issues with him.  He likes to make students think for themselves, not give them the answers

Think he's a great guy. Not a good teacher though.  I'm not sure he understands thermodynamics at all.  I say this because he never ever answered any of my questions.  He would just ask me a question in response, which is, A, rude, and B, not very helpful.  I'm not opposed to the Socratic method, in general, either. Also the book is undecipherable.

He's VERY arrogant, and takes points off for rediculous things during an exam, even iff all the work is correct, be sure to put WHY you're doing anything, even if it's obvious.  and spell it out, he wont take SS as a reason, you have to write steady state.  That said, his curve helped me out big time.

Favoritism definitely plays a part in the class. Takes off points for borderline rediculous reasons on the midterms. Make sure you that if you say something equals zero, write why, even if it is painfully obvious. Lost over 20% on a MT for not writing "steady state" in the problem...
Heavy favoritism...
He sucks and thinks he is the God.
He's a nice guy and a pretty good lecturer, but if you want help outside of class his hints usually aren't very good. Can be frustrating at times when he answers your question with another question.
No Comments

He's ok, but the tests are tough and the project SUCKS!  It will take up the last two weeks of the quarter, so be prepared.  He's nice, but kind of arrogant.  He sort of tries to be helpful, but he expects a lot.
good teacher but hard exams but I guess somewhat fair. this course is pretty challenging. the book sucks. over all he is good.
No Comments
Professional and helpful. You can learn a lot. However his tests are tough you really need to strive for them if you don't have very solid background knowledge already!

took my MS reseach with him a while ago.He was nice in general, however I wont do research with him again. very diffcult to deal with and make him understand. He is very busy and took him long time to review my thesis.. ESL lab is full of great EM profossers and easier to deal with, I would recommund find some body else for any one MS or PhD
Worst class ever... do not take it ...

For this class I thought he was pretty good and very organized. Quite a bit of homework, but not a crazy amount. Tests weren't bad, but as normal they had little twists in them that could throw you if you didn't understand the material that well.

All Rojas did was stand at the board and derive his equations from the book.  He would tell you one subject would be on an exam and it wouldn't show up at all.  Homeworks were surprisingly hard, even though they were just bookwork.  He gives no examples during lectures.  Exams are painfully hard even compared to homework, curves VERY heavily.

Talked though the hand written notes. Painfully hard midterms and final. Tosses in random stuff that makes the problems very hard in compairson to the hw and quizes. Can't explain AC analysis for the life of him. Horrible professor.
Worst professor I’ve had.  Easy HW and Quizes but hard midterms and Final.
Bad man, very bad man. If your a PHD of EE you'll do fine, if not, sooooo screwed. Walked out of the final crying. Take anyone else. Very unclear, bad handwriting and just not a nice person.

he gave u only few & easy HWs, quizzes are mostly easy too. so u got very hi confident walking to the exam. then u realized that the midterms are nothing like the HWs, or quizzes. 5x times harder. Not helpful at all.

the questions on the midterms have random things in them that make the questions so much harder than the homework or quizes or example problems. He was called in to fill a teaching spot for ece 300 so he wasn't really prepared.

716 was very boring.  I'm not sure if it is Rojas' fault or the material for the course.  Lectures consist of Rojas deriving every equation in the book.  He needs to include more applications and liven up his lectures a little.
Great engineer and great professor. He moves fast and expects you to work hard and study a lot. Learned a lot from him.
Its nice to hear from a teacher who actually knows about real world engineering applications
he was good

He didn't do much to help my robot group. Didn't help make members of our group show up in time.  Was not helpful at all. A real pain. Plus we got screwed in the competition, then his TA threw away our Project Notebook!
Not very hands on or helpful, was fair with everyone, but not active enough for how intense this course is.
He loves to tell stories! Generally they are pretty interesting. He could have explained things slower and more clearly. The tests were and the hard side, study well!!
ask him about his automatic garage door opener... the  Linda
I really enjoyed his class, he is my FAV prof
Overall Great!

Not a bad class to learn, but lectures can get boring which led to many people skipping class.  I know it's a long lecture, but I would advise staying in class to understand the topics.  The grades on the final show what happens when people stop attending class.  It's tough to learn it on your own.  Overall not a bad class.

Very willing to help! Lectures become boring! Midterm material significantly easier than final. As long as you know how to do all the homework, then you will be fine for the tests! Will give 5% bonus to grade for doing all homework.Ask what the quizzes will cover ahead of time, and then study the corresponding lecture in order to succeed on them.
Lectures are kinda boring. The class isn't too hard. HW is due every class. Quiz once a week. Hes a good guy. Obsessed with grad school.

Prof. Kinzel is very dedicated to teaching and interacting with students.  Class is very organized and structured (perhaps a bit too much).  The design projects are generally interesting and involved.  Get in a good team and don't wait to complete everything at the last moment, and it'll be a good experience w/ Kinzel.
He's OK. BUt very boring lecture.

he wrote the book so he knows his stuff, but spends too much time on some pretty easy matl...he will fall behind and you will be rushed at the end...the second half of this class is a lot harder than the first...hmwrks take a while and there's a lot of them...the project was involved, but i think it was worthwhile and beneficial in the end
Dr. Marras is amazing. Great professor, great person and chilli pepper hot.  Do not take this course as fluff, you will learn alot, but you will work for it.
Great guy, learned a lot from him. He made this class more interesting then it should have been.
Prof. Marras is extremely knowledgeable in his field.  We are lucky to have him at Ohio State.
Awesome class. Learned a ton plus it was fun. Exams are based upon class lectures so if you pay attention, no need to cram.

Very clear lecture, greatly communicate the subject, really know his field, awesome prof. If you're in the quarter when the other prof (start with "S") is teaching, postpone and take it when Dr. Marras is teaching, trust me.

Good course, very interesting. Exams are not so easy, but as long as you study hard, you should be OK. Professor looks good, and knows what he is talking about. If you have to take this course, then you might as well take his class. Team project and course material is too. NO NEED to buy the book!

Dr. Fan is really good at explaining the concepts and physics behind Heat Transfer.  His homeworks and exams are fair. Go to class because he keeps mental note of whom attends and good impressions can make a difference between a B+ and A- at the end of the quarter.

If there were a BCS for least organized professors, this guy would be on his way to Arizona.  Routinely found out about homeworks 2 days before they were due, and due dates were always subject to change without warning.  Nice guy, but not really great at explaining things either.

if you like to learn EM, this is your man, vry good in explaining MaxwellEquation and physics, very into to the math and analytical approch. Highly recommunded, one if the best profosser I have ever had in EM
Didn't learn a damn thing in his class, but still got an A...due to open-book on all quizes and tests, not to mention problems STRAIGHT from the book...haha

Dr. C is a great guy. He is very lenient in class and with the final project, which is nice, but allows you to slack off and still do fine. However, he's a very nice guy and is (although sometimes unclear) truly passionate about his students. I am sure he was a great engineer. Take class with Dr. C if you get a chance.

Christensen was a cool guy, but his class is a mess. The TAs were incredibly unprepared, and the material was not presented well. It is hard for me to rate Christensen because I liked him, but the class was awful. Sadly, it is an intro engineering class so if you're in the program you have to take it. My word of advice: STAY ORGANIZED!

He is a great teacher and really is passionate about what he is teaching. Extremely helpful when you ask for help! Class overall wasn't a very hard class as long as you paid attention, attended class and did your work.
Dr. C was a okay professor, the class is easy with which ever professor you have. He was nothing special. Usually based on how good your TAs are.
He was ok. Not very clear on some of the material. This class is a lot of work. I did more work in this 3 hour class than any 5 hour class I have taken.

I like this professor, I really do! But the guy is just disorganized about his homework! Sometimes I think he doesnt know what hw is due. Maintains a terrible syllabus which is rarely followed, often ignored, and changed frequently.  This makes assignments difficult and preparing for quizzes impossible.

Just go to class, pay attention you will get an A.  She's pretty friendly and overall a pretty good teacher.  The examples she does in class are EXACTLY like her tests, no surprises.  Very fair with grading.  The book is unclear a lot of times so it makes the homeworks hard if she hasn't covered the stuff yet but she hardly ever collects it.

if you pay attention in class, the examples she does are exactly like her tests. Really easy, ididnt have to read the book at all. I was afraid seeing how bad her ratings were, but i have to say she was an awesome teacher

My class notes are filled with references to the book.  (ie "See table 4-1")  This is because she freqently puts diagrams from book on overhead projector and talks about them in class.  A little bit unclear.  Not horrible, but not highly recommended either.  Wish I had taken with Orin.

We're about 2/3's through the quarter, and so far only 1 homework assignment has been collected (although 4 or 5 have been assigned).  She's too lazy to state exactly which problems to do so she just assigns an entire chapters worth.  Seems like she's talking to herself when she lectures.  Completely disorganized.  Should have been an easy class.
Her teaching is suck!! Only she knows what she talking about.
Worst teacher i ever had. Only one i've ever rated badly too. Almost made me not want to be an ECE major. Thank god i didnt listen.
Easy tests straight from samples.  Boring.
The worst professor ive ever had at OSU.  Avoid this professor at all costs!

Gah...very difficult to understand: not clear/organized at all.  Shows very little interest in students or class-unless you like teaching yourself and still being clueless as to what might be on tests/quizes, avoid this professor!
Clueless and mean....
Not a tough class, but she can't teach this class, even if it hit her in the face!
Doesn't explain well, disorganized/
Nice professor, but poor class notes and organization.

BJ's lectures are very old fashioned. I find that he tends to just talk and explain everything up in the air, rather than do in class examples. He is willing to help but he tends to be very unapproachable since he will treat you like an idiot if you don't know exactly what you are doing. He even said he had never taught this class before either.
He really loves to say the word worK but is really helpful.  Good guy.

This professor is a nice guy, willing to help, gives extra credit ( I clutched with an A). However, 2 midterms are pretty long but no final. A lot of group projects, lots of writing, so watch out for this.  Textbook is used for 1% of the time.
BJ Stephens is such a great teacher, he is so helpful and kind. Sign up with him for 1181!

I don't understand all of these negative posts, Oz was great and I learned a lot of cool things. He's a gangster professor and really smart. He's tough but very fair. Pay attention and do not procrastinate on the homework.

Oz is hilarious.. He uses the word 'baby' way too much. His notes are all over the place and his handwriting is terrible. His homework deadlines are messed up and he never sticks to the syllabus. Oh and don't get me started on his badass overcoats..
Very harg working as a professor

Very difficult professor, but showed genuine interest in helping students.  He made everyone in our class come to his office hours to pick up the midterms and discuss mistakes and make sure we knew how to do the problems we missed.  I met with him almost every day the second half of the quarter and went from E on first to A on the second midterm.

In lecture he repeats trivial points at great length.  Lectures directly from notes but refuses to answer questions.  Rude to those who do ask good questions.  He writes in 4 directions on his notes, very sloppy. Consistently goes over allowed time. Tests on uncovered material. Very unprofessional.

The worst prof I've ever had. the guy doesn't know when to shut up..He sends WAY too many emails..crowds my inbox. He is extremely unclear, puts students down (even when asking intelligent ?'s), and often makes stupid remarks. This guy should have been fired a while ago. nobody likes him incl. profs

He is very unhelpful, unorganized and unclear.  You never know what homework is due when, he always goes past time and usually you'll be tested on the stuff he said as you were walking out. Don't get me started on his emails...
Man, who wrote that second one?!

Oz has absolutely no interest in helping students.  I'd often come to him with problems and find that he lacked the fluency in the material usually demanded of professors.  He also gave out more E's than A's (including A-'s).  Still, I'm sure I beat the guy who wrote the second comment, idiot.
Whoever wrote the last one is an idiot.  Dr. Oz is a very helpful and knowledgeable professor and teaches his class very well.  He is very interested in helping his student but does push them hard.
Total jerk for no reason.  Does not care about students.  Blabs alot.  Never says anything with a point
yup

I started this class taking lots of notes, doing all the work and attempting to stay awake.  He tests on things that we haven't really done the labs are not organized with the class and he teaches absolutely nothing.  Especially considering what he tests, all I can say is you have to learn on your own.

Lecture consists of him rambling on about graphs. The first exam left the class stunned (avg-60%/high-80% for intro class). Questions were insanely particular. The only way you could do well on the exam is if you read the book 4 times over and knew what questions he would ask ahead of time. This is coming from a student with 3.8+ GPA. Avoid.

Alternate energy sources class as a tech elective for my masters- too many slides but good content to know and follow- he'll show he cares if you show u want to learn- else why bother choosing a tech elective anyway!

Automobile manufacturing class- it was fun...Dr. Shivpuri was actually interested in the stuff he was teaching- ask him questions and you'll see his enthusiastic side. lots of practical knowledge and useful information regarding cars.learnt more from him then i learnt from any of my OR classes. he's laid back and approachable and easy to work with.

Good guy, bad professor.  Took an interest in the class, but quickly lost it as it would take weeks to get a response.  You could not depend on anything he said becasue he'd do just the opposite.  Terrible feedback as to how you are doing in the class.

Easily one of the worst professors I've ever had here at OSU. Doesn't seem to take note that we never finish quizzes/exams on time, and continues to make them very long. Good intentions, bad professor.

Completely out of date class, and professor does not seem to care. Continually shows up late, gives quizzes over material not covered, puts wrong formulas on exams, and spends most of class flying through Powerpoint, making it impossible to take notes. Worst prof I have had in the ISE department.

I am two weeks into this course and want to shoot myself.  He has so far assigned us homework from a chapter we haven't gotten a page into, assigned us a 14 problem homework and a case study due within a few days, and refuses to put up his slides no matter how much you ask, but then insists on going through material at lightening speeds, what a jok
i dunno what to say, you can not ace on his tests, no matter how hard you try

quizzes are impossible, the only good thing is that they are impossible for everybody...goes too quickly through too much material...incosistent quiz format...only thing that kept me sane in this class is that the teaching assistant did half the lectures (wallace)
Terrible class, but he is a good guy.
Worst class ever

Very nice woman. Can be a little confusing, but it is only because she thinks very highly of her students' intelligence. Must get the book and if you have trouble with some homework, she is more than willing to lend a helping hand. The class is fairly easy, except for some homeworks.
I had Olga for both engineering 1181 and 1182 and she was wonderful. Very engaging with her students and a genuine interest in helping everyone succeed. Highly recommended.
Olga is a great teacher. an honor for her to teach me and really cares about her students.

Really easy teacher, kind of unorganized so she comes off very confused, but still very good. Had to take this course for my major so I got her again for next semester. Mandatory attendance but it's not something you want to miss.
Olga was wonderful to have for this class. Very easy, she is really helpful and always interested. Go to class and do the home works (which for the most part are very easy ) and you'll get an A

If you don't think you should take the class - don't take it. It's super easy and super flexible. However, you HAVE to attend every class because it's mandatory. Ends earlier than most classes. You need the workbook (and you can do the pages over the span of a week). Chilled out class, but doesn't count towards GPA. (Pass/Fail)

She was my mentor for a summer bridge I did, so I had to take this class as a requirement. Except for a couple annoying assignments, she is a very good person in the College of Engineering to talk to because she has her students' backs at all times. She is always willing to help students with anything.
He is probably one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He is very nice, helpful, and funny. He definitely makes the most of the joke that the FE is.

Best professor I've had at OSU. Extremely helpful, always willing to answer questions, very fair with grading, and if you need advice on literally anything he's there to talk. The class requires a lot of writing for group projects, but with him as the professor it makes it tolerable.

Very kind and willing to help.  Great professor, helped our group work out some issues.  Lots of group work in this class but it is laid back and fairly easy to get all of your work done on time and correctly.  He is also really funny

Very good and interesting teacher. The only reason class is mandatory is to turn in the HW. Usually lectures for half of the class and lets you work on HW for the other half. The HW assignments are actually fairly interesting, and will take varying amounts of time to complete depending on your programming ability.
Great guy, cares about you as an individual and understands that things do get messy sometimes. Is willing to work with you and help you out. Overall, a great teacher
Awesome teacher! Hands down the best teacher I have had at OSU to date

Very cool guy.  Just an example; second day of class he wanted to get to know his students so he walked around to every table (~70 students) and asked everyone their name, once.  He then went around the room and repeated every student's name.  He did not miss any
Funny, down to earth guy. However, is a total prick to his TA's, and sometimes demeaning. If you're thick-skinned, you'll love him. Rarely need the MATLAB book, it's all covered in the HELP section.

Funny real-world connections during lecture. All the info is in the powerpoints or in Matlab's help doc, so you don't really need the book. If you're stuck, he talks you through the thought process. Great overall, and I wasn't one to like programming before.

Andrew is the man.  He is very understanding and down to earth with students (who he treats like peers rather than students).  He is very helpful and WANTS TO HELP STUDENTS LEARN! He makes students think for themselves rather than just giving them the answers and he likes to have fun in class.  I recommend him.
Andy is lax. He's the man, and he makes the class fun, while being challenging at the same time.

Great professor, really wants to help everyone understand.  Keeps things as simple as he can.  Extremely helpful on any hw questions but still makes you think before giving the anwser. I had the first 167 class he taught and I thought he was the best professor Ive had yet at OSU. Posts all hw questions online so you only use the book as a refrenc
Reasonable.

Definitely my favorite professor that I've had. Very clear lectures, useful assignments, and communicates effectively. I would highly recommend taking this class, and I wish he could teach some of my other classes!
Probably the best professor i've had so far at Ohio State. Very knowledgeable, cares about his students, and a great person all around. Wish he was my big brother.

Great professor, I give my highest recommendation. Very insightful and clear plus he keeps it interesting. I'm going to pursue an internship with his company because I believe he would bake a great boss.
Enjoyed his class and would take his classes in the future.
He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He knows his materials very well and presents it in a simplified manner.
HE IS A GREAT PROFESSOR. FUNNY AND EXTREMELY INTELLIGENT!!!
I really enjpyed

El-Gamal is an okay professor.  The class material wasn't that interesting and his lectures weren't particularly exciting.  The exams and homework were about what could be expected but were still very difficult, but grading was on a curve and was fair.  He's available for office hours by email but it might take 2 days.
Didn't learn a damn thing in his class, but still pulled off a B.  I don't recommend him, but if he's the only choice, don't sweat it.

Pretty funny.  However, has difficulty conveying course content to his students.  Seems to lack interest in teaching the material.  TA will be your best hope if you can't do study groups.  Highly suggest working in study groups since those who did in our class generally had higher grades than the other half of the class which didn't.

Great lecturer. He can be very sarcastic about student responses, but he's just joking around. You definitely learn a lot in his class, and he does a great job of presenting the material.  Probably easier relative to other 501 classes.  He did miss a few days.

He teaches well but his exams are meant to show that you don't know anything. If you can survive those you will get a good grade. Repeates all his HWs, it seems he doesn't really care for the HW. He knows what he is teaching but it would really help if he made a little more effort during teaching.

Fairly difficult class.  El-Gamal can be funny but only in a condescending way.  He seems to think everyone in the class is an idiot.  I'm not sure if he's just being funny or really thinks we're all stupid.  Didn't seem very into he analog material but might be more enthusiastic about digital class
Helped me out back in the late 80's

Avoid him if you can. He can't teach. Unclear. Just avoid him.
If you have the old midterms take this guy. Otherwise avoid him. He can't teach, and refuses to even try. This guy ruined me from taking another class in this topic.
