probably the laziest teacher at osu. horrible lectures, and never answers questions clearly.

Interesting professor to listen to. Is excited about the course and talks about fun facts applicable to topic covered. Has quite voice. HWks are really challenging and you are expected to figure them out. Exams are fair and not long if you understand well (don't rely on open notes). Cares for students to do well.

After two quarters of taking him, I really enjoy his lecture. Did a good job teaching the basics and intricacies of computer architecture. Homeworks can range from easy to abstract, but the exams were almost always fair.
Applicable homeworks, fair midterms, easy final. Not the easiest to follow along, but listening to him really helps. Willing to help students.
Difficult to pay attention to. Homeworks are lengthy but teach you something. Midterms are just applications of the homework. Final is a bit harder. Not great but definitely not awful.
The class is very interesting and he explained everything very clear. But the homeworks are kinda hard. Be prepared to spend most of the time on homeworks.
Good professor. Midterms are easy, Final is long and a challenge. HW is a little time consuming but necessary. Text book on reserve and not used much.

I found it hard to stay interested in what he was lecturing about.  I would be bored out of my mind because I would understand a pretty simple aspect of the course but he would go on and on and on explaining every minute detail.  Sometimes hard to understand because of bad English.

He goes sorta slow but explains stuff well, depsite the occasional bad english. Homeworks are usually pretty short but graded kind hard. The midterm wasn't bad but the final was hard since the stuff after the midterm is harder. Office hours are useful and he only assigned two machine problems instead of three.

Highly respected mentor to multiple generations of aerospace engineers.  Was the chairman of the Aero Eng department when I was there in 1987-1995.  Gifted teacher and researcher.  Energetic and passionate.  Inspiring.  Challenging.  Kind.  You should be so lucky.
dr G was the reason I attended OSU. HIS LOVE OF Areo and OSU wee what made the hard work worth it.  He exemplified " but for OSU..." And is why I am a proud graduate. GO BUCKS
Best Prof ever!!!

Very knowledgeable professor that can answer any question for you.  He is very hard to hear though, so you definitely should try to sit in front.  If you pay attention, use his notes, and go to office hours periodically, the homeworks and midterms/finals are not bad.

Like everyone else has said, Dr. Gregorek is a nice man and is very helpful and knowledgeable. However, he's not the best teacher in the world. He's very disorganized and hard to hear - even with a microphone. With that said, make sure you get a seat up front during lectures. The class is hard but if you want easy, don't chose AAE as your major!
Very knowledgable and friendly. A joy to listen to.

Dr. G is the best professor in the entire department.  While his class is tough, it's nothing compared to what is to come.  He is a bit hard to hear in class, but if you go to office hours it would be nearly impossible to walk out without a better understanding.

Gregorek is a fair professor who knows his stuff for sure. Class is hard as balls though. Have fun taking this class...get with cliff...he's kind of lazy in class, but ask him questions and he will always help out a lot.
Very smart and well organized. Puts most of his notes into packets so you can spend more time listening and less writing. Softspoken and sometimes hard to hear and see what he is writing.

You will never find a man with more experience then this guy.  His teaching style is excellent and is sprinkled with real life experiences.  He really, really knows his stuff, and his classes are extremely informative and completely fair.
Great guy, you'll never find anyone with more experience.  He'll answer any question, but can be hard to track down...  a great class and an amazing teacher

I love conversing with him. Class was tough, but I enjoyed the challenge. Definately the man to talk to if you're really hardcore about doing aeronautical engineering--he's got close to half a century's worth of experience...

Dr. G is the nicest professor I've ever had.  He's got a crapload of real life experience but he stumbles over words in his lectures and has been known to make a lot of mistakes in what he says.  Great and helpful guy though.
Dr G is a good prof once you get used to his style.  He makes you work though. Don't expect an A unless you are going to work your tail off.  He shoots for mid 50's for averages on exams. Aim High.
Dr G is the man, he is tough but he will teach you everything you need to know, fun and entrtaining

Wow, what a quarter!  Tough homework and exams, aims for a 50% average on exams.  There's no way through it and an almost fair curve... if you want to do Aeronautical / Astronautical Engineering, there's no way through him!
Didn't do any work or put any effort in. Missed half of the lecture days due to travel. Rarely prepared before class - made everything up as he went.

Dr. Delaine is a really awesome person. He is so cultured and approachable, he came up to me the first day of class and had a conversation and knew my name after that. He is super fair about grades and probably one of the best professors I've had. If you take his class, get to know him from day one, he's a really cool person

One of the most poorly organized professors I have had at Ohio State. There is no logical reason for him to jump back and forth between chapters in our book but he does. His handwritten notes are illegible and full of math mistakes. You can barely understand what you are looking at. I doubt I could apply what I learned with the way he taught.
He is a very quite teacher and is a very dull lecturer.
Very soft voice.  Sit up front and go to his office hours. He is very helpful.
this prof. saved my life:)
Worst engineering professor I've ever had; couldn't understand him, nightmare exams.
Focused on Aviation topics in a class that many engineers have to take in order to learn the basics... however, those basics were never presented well in his 420 section.

Shen is an excelent professor. A little hard to understand at first. Lecture notes are hand written so you can print them off. He will let you know exactly what type of problems will be on the exam. Learned more from Dr. Shen than any other ME professor.
HAHA, yeah, this guy sucks. Took the class last year sometime.

Herman Shen is the type of guy who answers his cell phone in the middle of your exam and talks through the test. He is very stuck on aviation, even in ME. When the TA would try to help the students, we would confuse her with what we learned in class.

Do the practice homework to study for the quizzes, then read the book. If you don't have the book, you're screwed. Really knows his stuff, don't be afraid to ask about anything. Lets you use cheatsheets on quizzes plus the book on exams, but will make it much harder to compensate. Pick good partner for the report too.

Prof. Teixeira gave us very clear structure and analysis of wireless propagation techniques. He made things easy. However, the quiz is a little weird. You must be very careful with the quiz because he always focused on things that you may omit, though the quiz is not hard. Project is very important. Choose good partners in order to get good grades.
Dr. Teixeira is a great professor. I learned a lot from this class, largely thanks to the fact the Prof. Teixeira was teaching it. I highly recommend anything he teaches.
This course is tough but Prof make it easy
Professor Fernando is the best instructor for Hard core EM courses at ESL

He is very helpful and nice. He posted the lectured video, so students can playback anytime they don't understand something. Other professors should do the same to improve the quality of learning for students.

I took few 800 EM courses with Prof.Teixeira his class normaly is very challanging, he is well orgnized person,helpful direct you to understand more than your concern about the grade, if you do resonable work you will get a good grade, highly recommunded if you taken EM at OSU or working at ESL

Amazing class, really packed a lot of interesting material in. Explains things very well, and is a very nice guy. Homeworks are quite fair and challenging, and his exam problems are like easier homework problems. I learned a lot. I highly recommend taking any class you can with him!
One of the best professors in the ECE department by far.  Makes the physics very easy, and the midterm and final were straightforward and based off of the homeworks.  Highly recommended.
Nothing much can be said about him other than he is the BESTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!!! He is one of the most pleasant ECE faculties I have ever seen. Good job department for hiring him.

Hoo boy.  This class is a TOUGH one...disregard the easiness.  I misclicked.  He's a great prof who does what he can to help, but this class is hard.  Like, better know all your math and physics extremely well before going into the class, and know your 311/312 intimately.  If you invest a lot of time and use Teixeira, you can get through, but it's no walk in the park.
NO COMMENT..... Dr. Teixiera is the best!!!!!
Great person as well as a great instructor. Very willing to help and curves a lot. Exams are fair and grading is fantastic. Take any class you can with him.
Great professor.  Clear lectures.  Very willing to help and explain anything you ask.  Exams are average difficulty but he prepares you very well.
Very clear in class and willing to explain anything resquested by students.
Awesome prof, very clear, nice guy. Makes a hard class a lot easyer.
Best Electromagnetics Professor in OSU!!
This guy is a legend.  Super chill and awesome.  Some may know him as Fratrick.
Not all heroes wear capes. They wear sheep ears for their preschool play. He is an everyday superhero. Pro-Tip: he is a solid TA.

Class is interactive with simulations every Friday. Curzon is not a very good instructor. A few ways to describe him is that he is erratic in grading with unclear rubrics, he seems to get control crazy-- if you think you have done something well, a lot of times he will poke holes in it just to show that he is still in control and smarter than you.

Hands down the best part of this course is the simulation you play every Friday, but the paper you have to write after it is painful and is never graded on a clear rubric, he kind of just gives you random grades it seems.

He has no clear grading rubrics for his required essays. Did everything he told me to and never gotten a 100% on any essays. Expect to read about 60 pages every night. Make sure you know everything from the readings. Quizzes are very specific based on the readings. Would never take again.

Readings are long and pop quizzes dealing with them are challenging, have one page paper due every week, groups bring food to every Friday class, Great Game is played on Fridays where groups are different countries that act out wars throughout History
Fair exams. Fair grading. Goes over a lot of useless information during lecture but seems to be interested. At least he didn't screw us like Sutton.
Excellent!!!

I had a great interest in this class since it gets to cover compressible flows, and Samimy was very helpful in understanding the topics.  He doesn't really know how to use Carmen, so when he posts notes, print them immediately or he may delete them from carmen.  Fair tests and fair homeworks, should be easy to get an A or B.

Good lecturer.  His tests are very fair.  Tests are on problems that go over basics concepts or he will ask theory questions on basic concepts.  If people stop coming to class he will start giving pop quizes.  Overall good class very good teacher.
Samimy is great. Very proud of himself too.

Extremely nice and understanding, passionate about teaching, lectures are very helpful, tests are fair (similar to homework and examples). Made fluids as easy as possible. Take any class with Samimy, can't go wrong.

Horrible lectures, difficult to get your point across in office hours but a very nice man.

dr. sun comes as advertised... always looks to help students understand material and excel on exams... class subject matter can be dry at times but his lecture slides are so good he makes the book practically worthless (except for hw problems)

Wow, how big of a difference it makes when a professor actually cares and is passionate about teaching and helping students.  One of the best ME has to offer.  Lectures were very good, homeworks were fair, tests were probably easier than the homework.  Only thing that sucks about the class are the infamous "570 labs."  But Professor Sun is awesome!

Definitely not a class you can blow off, especially if MSE is not your field.  Took this as an engineering science and it was a lot harder than I anticipated.  Study, work through the homeworks, and utilize office hours.  She's very helpful and clear!

She is currently in a class survey in which she does not directly answer any questions.  Class can get tough at times, review sessions are pointless since they do not answer your questions.  Nice lady, bad concept of how to teach.

Contrary to a lot of these reviews... this was NOT an easy class. I pulled a B in it, but I had to work hard. The average for both the midterms was around 68%. There's a lot of information. Make sure you attend the recitation sections. 2/3 of the exam questions were based off recitation work sheets. The other third were from the hw calculations.

The class was supposed to be easy, but upto this point it has not. The professor is currently changing material in the class according some research she does throughout the course on her students. Clickers are still used to track attendance, so go to class.

Extremely easy class that she didn't do a bad job teaching. 10% of your grade is based on attendance, otherwise the lectures are pointless since the slides and lecture videos are online. Easy midterms and final.

She did an adequate job teaching the somewhat boring material...responds very quickly to message boards.  Exams were mult. choice and she provided practice tests and review sessions.  Limited writing in class because Powerpoints are on Carmen...take Flores if you can

very easy class, she records lectures on videos (still need to go to class otherwise you lose 10% for attendance), clearly conveys topics, exams are fair with review sessions beforehand and practice tests.  use recitation for example problems.

Prof. Flores is a pretty good teacher.  There aren't many examples in class, which is what are really needed.  She does a good job of conveying concepts and helping you understand the theory/memorization parts.  The lecture can be a little boring and the mandatory "clicker" attendance will make you want to never go again.  Class wasn't too hard.
Good professor. She obviously tried pretty hard, with online lecture videos, guided notes and she watched the posts on carmen alot. Exams were easy if you studied and very straight forward.

She is a nice professor, explains her powerpoints moderately well, but doesnt deviate from them very much.  The class may as well be an online class.  The recitations are not helpful or worth attending.  The material that is covered on the homework doesnt reflect was is gone over in the class at all, maybe very abstracly. Overall very dissatisfied.

Her powerpoint presentations cover the material well and are available online along with a video recording of each lecture.  Helpful and good at applying engineering to all kinds of stuff.  Comes off as boring, though.  Mabye because most of her real life examples aren't interesting.

Prof. Flores cares a lot about the students and making sure they understand the material. She puts a lot of effort into making the class as interesting as possible. In fact, she brought in pizza for everyone one day to explain diffusion!
She is nice, and it's true that the quizes are just like the homeworks, but you will have to study a lot if you want to pass.

listened to student input and made changes throughout the quarter...midterms were easy and quizzes were just like hmwrk problems...class could have been brutal but she made it as basic as possible, although she did start flying through chapters towards the end..final wasn't comprehensive!
He just doesnt teach well
prof miller is awesome. he really cares and understands what college is suppoesed to be about. Yeah theres a lot of work, but college isnt supposed to be easy
It is easy to get a B in this class. It is exteremly difficult to get an A.

His homework is fairly easy, but very laborious. Expect to spend more than 2 hrs per week on a single homework assignment. If you keep up with homework and study for the exams you should get at least a B. I learned a lot. Many of his lectures don't apply to the homework or the exams. He expects you to know statistics even though it is not a require
i think he is a nice guy, if you show him that you are interested in his class. the class is fairly easy as long as u put enough time and effort into it.
Lectures can put you to sleep; Homeworks are hard; Exams are very hard; but the professor curves the class, so do the best you can, and hope for the best!

(Dr.Lenhart is pretty cool too) No textbook needed (he has his own so you can download it off the website for free)...exams are straight from the solution that he provided. He even gave us a take home final because many of us have 3 finals on same day. Wish I can have him for rest of my classes.
Busiest guy in the CE department.  Bring him a bottle of scotch and you've got an A.
Great professor, but watch out in 431.  It does get a bit tricky.

Easiest class I've taken in a long time. He goes over things a million times; class is four days a week, but you only have to go twice to get the material, if that. Tests are EXACTLY like the homework, no suprises. Really nice teacher and a good guy.
stay away from this guy, he seems nice but will cut your throat when it comes to grading!

He just presents to know the stuff, but actually doesn't know anything. You can't be a control faculty without having a good mathematical background. He also seems to be a bad person from heart and only copies everything from his notes. Very useless. Shame on the control department for having such a person walking around in it!

Enjoyed the class.  Pretty nice guy.  Clear lecturer. Homeworks were pretty easy, not too long, and usually there were similar examples in the book.  Tests were a bit challenging, but the class was curved.  Responded to emails in a timely manner.  Would take a class with him again.

I must say I found him to be a clear lecturer, but his exams did make attempts to throw you.  His thinking is that it "sees if you really know" stuff, but I found them to be mostly just curveballs that made me mad.  He does curve though, and btw the homework takes a lot of time, this is not a blow off course.

Totally scum bag!!! He just pretends to be a good person and always pretends he knows stuff. He is the type of person who says one thing and does another. If you think getting him as your advisor, he will ruin your life. He is even not good enough to be a professor in the first place.

Good teacher, knows his stuff. HW takes to damn long to finish. Exams are tough.If you have to have a good lecturer this is your guy, otherwise take with someone else. Everyone says you learn more from this guy but thats b.s, work hard w/ another prof and get a much better grade and still learn.

All he does is sit at the projector and write stuff out.  He thinks he's teaching us well, but in fact he can't teach at all.  He gives terrible explanations, along with bad homework problems.  Avoid him if he ever teaches this class again.

This class is taught by yet another osu turn off the lights all class and sit behind an overhead while i write down some equations and talk about my paper pulp project to regulate the moisture in the never get out of my seat and go back to sleep prof.
hard hard class....and the goofiest person i have ever met. but still a cool guy
Professor Orin makes learning fun.  All tests and quizzes are open book.  Quizzes and tests can be tricky, so make sure you come to class and write down everything he says.

He is a machine.  He'll power through his notes and makes sure to cover all the material he meant to that day.  Did a great job making the class easy to understand.  Notes are clear and well thought out.  Easy A or B.  "Keep asking"
Generally good. Curve-balls sometimes on tests. Homeworks can be long or have some pitas on occasion. I'd still recommend this class.

Extremely helpful and clear in lecture, but repeats himself frequently which can get annoying.  Tests are not pretty challenging but open-notes open-book.  Notes from lecture are much more helpful than the book.

Can't spell boring without Orin.  He's actually not bad in homework/tests/projects, but good luck staying awake in lecture.  Avoid taking 662 with him unless you've had him previously...seriously.  Classes with him become significantly easier if you've had him for something else already (I've taken 261, 265, 561, and 662 that have all ended up bein

One of the best ECE professors at OSU.  He's clear and takes things nice and slow during lecture.  He repeats himself quite often, which can get annoying, but he is very helpful and always encourages questions.   His quizzes and tests are tricky, but not long.  I only used the book to get the homework problems, which is sad for a $100 book.

Dr. Orin is a great professor. Goes through things step by step so there's no doubt what's going on. Go to office hours if you don't understand, and he will explain it so you can. I agree that you get the impression that you don't have to study but the tests are somewhat difficult. The book is only for reference--nothing in tests he doesn't say.

Material in class is very easy to understand but quiz's and midterms/finals are very tricky. Be sure to do the example problems he provides for midterms. **All quiz's and tests were open book/open notes**

Great.  Great professor.  Does whatever he can to help a student.  Very clear and concise on lectures.  Homework and computer problems are fair and helpful, grading is very fair.  One thing:  the book is useless, don't buy one.  He gives out all of the info you need for the course unless you miss some class, then just ask for a copy.  Awesome prof.

Not bad at all.  Give's you a vibe that the class is easy and you should just relax but exams are tricky.  Better than most professors, lectures are heres what it is, example of what it is, any questions.  Very good teaching methods.  Grader was a jerk, but not his fault.

Dr. Orin is probably the best professor in the department, period.  Makes tough material manageable, with fair tests.  You have to do well to get an A though.  Take professor Orin, you definitely wont regret it.  662 is a microprocessor design course and was very interesting.

Prof. Orin is probably the best professor I've had here.  Very good explanations, leaves nothing important out.  Homeworks, exams, quizzes and projects are very fair and helpful.  Go to class because his lectures are very important.
No Comments

Good prof overall, but the midterm was kinda tough. Final was better. Homeworks are very fair, and projects are mostly fair. Make sure to start on the last project early. He's also very willing to help on homeworks in office hours.
Good teacher but beware he is very miser with the grades.
Incredible teacher. Must work hard, but well worth it. Aced an interview with Intel thanks to his leadership.   He leads you to the trough but doesnt shove your face in it.
The class is quite easy, and he explains everything very well. The tests were also pretty easy. Just go to lectures and pay attention and you should do fine.

An all around good prof and nice guy.  Can't blame tough material on him.  Pay attention in class, do what you are supposed to and be fine.  Homework kinda sucked, and tests threw a vew curves but oh well!
decent professor. have to go to class to do well on his tests. boring.
He is a great instructor, but I was pissed off little bit in his grading scale at the end of the class. (IF U WANNA LEARN, TAKE A CLASS WOTH HIM)

Dr. Orin's a great professor; he's very clear while explaining concepts, and his examples are perfect - not too complex, but enough so to be interesting.  His exams are also very reasonable.  Overall, a great teacher and pretty nice guy.
Although I received a C+ in this class, I learned a lot from Dr. Orin.  Very clear on the material and very helpful during office hours.  The computer problem we did was pretty cool, too.
Very clear and well-paced lectures.  The class is really pretty easy.

As has already been said, get a-hold of past midterms and DO EVERY PRACTICE PROBLEM HE GIVES YOU.  The optional homeworks really don't help that much but doing the practice for the 3 midterms and you'll be fine and will get out of having to take a final.

Pretty good teacher. Get old copies of exams, they'll help out a lot. Go through every single practice problem he gives you in the midterm packets and you'll to fine. This stuff isn't hard to learn, its just tedious. The book homework is not that helpful, focus on the exam practice problems.

The material is easy and presented in a pretty logical fashion.  He seems to make some concepts more complicated than they need to be, but otherwise is an okay teacher.  If you understand the practice exams you will do well.  The info in the class is really important for your career and personal life, more so than a lot of technical electives.
All around great guy and really cares about his students.  He was my Faculty Advisor too and got along with him great.  I enjoyed the class, and use the concepts all the time.

the material covered in this class is really practical for the real world - basically finance for engineers - and its easy to understand.... you just have to get over his attitude as the greatest cheat catcher of all-time...which isnt hard since this class is usually huge..  also, hes really on to something with the grading...it works well
i did not like the way he teaches and presents the matrial in class, but he can be so very helpful if you go to his office and ask for help

One of the easier engineering classes; more like a finance class. Lectures are pretty boring, homeworks are sometimes challenging (but you can get into a group to complete homework), and tests are pretty straightforward if you understand the practice midterm problems. Can be a bit sarcastic.

Moody professor but an easy class. It is extremely easy to get an A or A- in this class. For midterms, don't read the book at all becasue it doesn't help you. Read the review problems and be a master of them. I got 72% (read the book), 77% (read the book), and 96% (didn't read the book) on my midterms and did pretty well on the final, so I got an A
Great class.  Instructor often seems reluctant to help students, though.

When you copy the excell sheets make sure you "cut and paste" to a new file because if you try to use an old file it has a history. HE is moody! IF HIS OFFICE DOOR IS OPEN he is in a GOOD MOOD and will be willing to give you more points on tests.Don't be scared to ask!By the way if you have to take the final he makes everyone sit two chairs appart.

Dr. Lundquist is a great guy.  The subject matter can only be made so interesting.  Do the HW & Computer projects as they are assigned, and you'll be happy with your grade.  Again, Dr. L. is a really good guy - you've just got to get to know him.
Lectures are boring because the subject matter is so simple.  Getting an A should be no problem if you do the homework.

He is a HORRIBLE teacher, and the only one that teaches the class.  I could feel myself getting dumber every time I went to lecture.  The midterms were worded VERY poorly, and he did not seem to mind.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CAN AVOID IT. (HAHA-YOU CANNOT ESCAPE- HE IS THE ONLY ONE WHO TEACHES IT!) The "grading system" is the most convoluted joke every conceived of. If you don't get an A in this class, KILL YOURSELF.
Material is not hard, but a lot of work, and do well on the mid-terms means no final, which is nice. Do your homework, and projects!
Soo simple, just do your homework and the projects, you dont even have to go to class.

Class is basically an elaborate practical joke, easy but eye-crossingly boring and outrageously convoluted ... lectures are known to induce catatonia.  I found it painfully boring and pointless but most people seem to like it.
Has an unique grading system that insures you a good grade, not big on Fri classes, but who is.  Really nice to talk to, but want to shoot him in class.  Material is pretty easy but he makes it tuff.

Don't get to know this guy on a personal level or even talk to him, he will ruin your life if he can, just go to class and do your work, avoid talking to him at all costs. He will try to throw his weight around in the ISE dept. and influence your reput.
Nice guy, good teacher.  If you don't get an A in his class you are a moron.  Oh yeah, he loves busting cheaters which I like too!  Too bad he doesn't teach more classes!
No Comments

One of the EASIEST classes you will take as an OSU engineering student.  My advice:  do the work if you expect an A.  The work and material aren't difficult at all.  Professor Lundquist is a good professor and cool guy once you get to know him.
very easy class, can get an A without even going to class except on exam
Great all around guy. He knows alot about everything, no matter what your major might be. Visit him in his office.

Really easy class, makes you wonder who actully gets less than an A in it. His grading system is pretty complicated but it ensures you a good grade.  I wish he would not encourage stupid people to voice their opinions though.
His grading systems almost guarantees an A or A- if you do the work.  He can be condescending, but he's very fair.
Tough but fair
if someone else offers 504 even Satan choose satan

Seriously, if you are too stupid to get an A in his class, then you are GW Bush!
if you can't figure out how to ace this class, you don't belong in engineering
this class is stupid if you figure out the system you have it made
very strict but very good
Fair professor.  Learn how he likes things and do it exactly that way.

It can't get any easier than this class!
If you can't get an A in this class, you are a moron.  You can retake everything
he let's you re-take up tp half of the test. if u  do homework u should get an A
very BAD class/teacher, he does want to help anyone, grading scheme is stupid
Grading is horrible, lectures are horrible...  you don't have a choice.
Good GTA, very knowledgeable and articulates ideas relatively clearly, would recommend for any ENG class.
He is great! Highly recommended.
Terrible unfair brutal grading of lab reports. Even if one follows his rubric exactly, points are deducted seemingly for nothing.....

Tim Garcia was so different from how the comments describe him when I took his lab class.  He was very willing to help, even when he was having a long day.  The only complaint I have is a minor one: occasionally, he stumbles over words during lecture, but it happens to everybody.

Garcia sucks, hes always taking siestas in class and plus his room is a total mess!
It seems he knows what he's talking about, just has a difficult time actually teaching it. His homework assignments were ridiculous, and would rarely ever go over them. Hope I never have him again.
very hard to follow his lectures , he is confusing. the Text-book sucks, but exams are fairly similar to the sample tests ....
Not very professional, and not helpful at all. Had to take the class but regret having him as a professor. He does not remember your name unless you talk to him more than 10 times... Not fun...
not fun
one of the most pointless lectures ever.  very hard to follow during class.  make sure that you try the practice exams so you know what to expect.
Very helpful if you need/seek help.
Retarted grading policy.  Knows the material to the point that he forgets to teach it.  Couldnt stand his class. One of the worst ive had at OSU.

A colorful professor who has completely mastered his material.  He's slightly hard of hearing right now, which means sometimes he comes off a little goofy, but he's genuinely a great guy and I've learned a lot from him.
Happy-Go-Lucky fella.  He is generally easy if you do the homework.  If you have any questions go ask him (especially with projects) he is very nice and will help you quite a bit.

"The" laziest teacher I've seen.  Was very unhelpful.  Talks a lot about him instead of the subject during class.

Very interesting material.  Lots of little busy work type assignments that are annoying in addition to the the 25-30 question online reading quizzes.  Our midterm was fairly easy but since our midterm average was very high he made our final IMPOSSIBLE.  Kind of annoying to curve the exam difficulty rather than test us on what we should know.

great class... he's able to pack this elective with tons of info on eveything from engineering to political to social to historical aspects of nuclear science... along with tours to the osu research reactor and james cancer hospital....this is a must take class
Interesting material and good professor. He could have shown more example calculations (usually talks most of the time) but still very fair and worth taking for NE505.
Easy class.  Very interesting, you learn all about the politics & prejudices surrounding Nuclear power in the U.S.
Definitely knows what he is teaching! Co-Advisor for the Student Chapter of the American Nuclear Society

Very good professor with stimulating class. Take as a tech elect.
